personal_agent.core

Core package for Personal Agent.

  1"""Core package for Personal Agent."""

class SimpleMCPClient: 
 16class SimpleMCPClient:
 17    """Simple MCP client based on the working test_mcp.py implementation."""
 18
 19    def __init__(self, server_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]):
 20        self.server_configs = server_configs
 21        self.active_servers = {}
 22
 23    def start_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
 24        """Start an MCP server process synchronously."""
 25        if server_name not in self.server_configs:
 26            logger.error("Unknown MCP server: %s", server_name)
 27            return False
 28
 29        if server_name in self.active_servers:
 30            logger.info("MCP server %s already running", server_name)
 31            return True
 32
 33        config = self.server_configs[server_name]
 34        try:
 35            # Start the MCP server process
 36            # Set working directory based on the server root path
 37            cwd = None
 38            if server_name == "filesystem-home":
 39                cwd = ROOT_DIR
 40            elif server_name == "filesystem-data":
 41                cwd = DATA_DIR
 42
 43            # Prepare environment variables
 44            env = os.environ.copy()  # Start with current environment
 45            if "env" in config:
 46                env.update(config["env"])  # Add server-specific env vars
 47
 48            process = subprocess.Popen(
 49                [config["command"]] + config["args"],
 50                stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
 51                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
 52                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
 53                text=True,
 54                bufsize=0,
 55                cwd=cwd,
 56                env=env,  # Pass environment variables
 57            )
 58
 59            self.active_servers[server_name] = {"process": process, "config": config}
 60
 61            # Wait a moment for server to start
 62            time.sleep(1)
 63
 64            # Initialize the server
 65            if self._initialize_server_sync(server_name):
 66                logger.info("Started MCP server: %s", server_name)
 67                return True
 68            else:
 69                logger.error("Failed to initialize MCP server: %s", server_name)
 70                return False
 71
 72        except Exception as e:
 73            logger.error("Failed to start MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
 74            return False
 75
 76    def _initialize_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
 77        """Initialize server synchronously."""
 78        try:
 79            # Send initialize request
 80            init_request = {
 81                "jsonrpc": "2.0",
 82                "id": 1,
 83                "method": "initialize",
 84                "params": {
 85                    "protocolVersion": "2024-11-05",
 86                    "capabilities": {"tools": {}},
 87                    "clientInfo": {"name": "personal-agent", "version": "0.1.0"},
 88                },
 89            }
 90
 91            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, init_request)
 92            if response and response.get("result"):
 93                logger.info("Initialized MCP server: %s", server_name)
 94                return True
 95
 96        except Exception as e:
 97            logger.error("Failed to initialize MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
 98
 99        return False
100
101    def _send_request_sync(
102        self, server_name: str, request: Dict[str, Any]
103    ) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
104        """Send a JSON-RPC request to an MCP server synchronously."""
105        if server_name not in self.active_servers:
106            return None
107
108        try:
109            process = self.active_servers[server_name]["process"]
110            request_json = json.dumps(request) + "\n"
111
112            # Send request
113            process.stdin.write(request_json)
114            process.stdin.flush()
115
116            # Read response
117            response_line = process.stdout.readline()
118            if response_line:
119                return json.loads(response_line.strip())
120
121        except Exception as e:
122            logger.error("Error sending request to MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
123
124        return None
125
126    def call_tool_sync(
127        self, server_name: str, tool_name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]
128    ) -> str:
129        """Call a tool on an MCP server synchronously."""
130        try:
131            request = {
132                "jsonrpc": "2.0",
133                "id": 3,
134                "method": "tools/call",
135                "params": {"name": tool_name, "arguments": arguments},
136            }
137
138            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
139            if response and response.get("result"):
140                content = response["result"].get("content", [])
141                if content and len(content) > 0:
142                    return content[0].get("text", "No response")
143
144        except Exception as e:
145            logger.error(
146                "Error calling tool %s on server %s: %s", tool_name, server_name, e
147            )
148
149        return f"Error calling tool {tool_name}"
150
151    def list_tools_sync(self, server_name: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
152        """List available tools on an MCP server synchronously."""
153        try:
154            request = {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 2, "method": "tools/list"}
155
156            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
157            if response and response.get("result"):
158                tools = response["result"].get("tools", [])
159                logger.debug(
160                    "Available tools on %s: %s",
161                    server_name,
162                    [tool.get("name") for tool in tools],
163                )
164                return tools
165
166        except Exception as e:
167            logger.error("Error listing tools on server %s: %s", server_name, e)
168
169        return []
170
171    def stop_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
172        """Stop a specific MCP server."""
173        if server_name not in self.active_servers:
174            logger.debug("MCP server %s not running", server_name)
175            return True
176
177        try:
178            server_info = self.active_servers[server_name]
179            process = server_info["process"]
180
181            # Terminate the process
182            process.terminate()
183
184            # Wait for it to exit gracefully
185            try:
186                process.wait(timeout=3)
187            except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
188                # Force kill if it doesn't exit gracefully
189                process.kill()
190                process.wait()
191
192            # Remove from active servers
193            del self.active_servers[server_name]
194            logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
195            return True
196
197        except Exception as e:
198            logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
199            return False
200
201    def start_servers(
202        self, server_configs: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]] = None
203    ) -> bool:
204        """Start all configured MCP servers."""
205        configs = server_configs or self.server_configs
206        success = True
207
208        for server_name in configs:
209            if not self.start_server_sync(server_name):
210                logger.error("Failed to start MCP server: %s", server_name)
211                success = False
212
213        return success
214
215    def stop_all_servers(self):
216        """Stop all active MCP servers."""
217        for server_name, server_info in self.active_servers.items():
218            try:
219                process = server_info["process"]
220                process.terminate()
221                process.wait(timeout=5)  # Wait up to 5 seconds
222                logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
223            except Exception as e:
224                logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
225
226        self.active_servers.clear()

Simple MCP client based on the working test_mcp.py implementation.

SimpleMCPClient(server_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]) 
19    def __init__(self, server_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]):
20        self.server_configs = server_configs
21        self.active_servers = {}
server_configs
active_servers
def start_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool: 
23    def start_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
24        """Start an MCP server process synchronously."""
25        if server_name not in self.server_configs:
26            logger.error("Unknown MCP server: %s", server_name)
27            return False
28
29        if server_name in self.active_servers:
30            logger.info("MCP server %s already running", server_name)
31            return True
32
33        config = self.server_configs[server_name]
34        try:
35            # Start the MCP server process
36            # Set working directory based on the server root path
37            cwd = None
38            if server_name == "filesystem-home":
39                cwd = ROOT_DIR
40            elif server_name == "filesystem-data":
41                cwd = DATA_DIR
42
43            # Prepare environment variables
44            env = os.environ.copy()  # Start with current environment
45            if "env" in config:
46                env.update(config["env"])  # Add server-specific env vars
47
48            process = subprocess.Popen(
49                [config["command"]] + config["args"],
50                stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
51                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
52                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
53                text=True,
54                bufsize=0,
55                cwd=cwd,
56                env=env,  # Pass environment variables
57            )
58
59            self.active_servers[server_name] = {"process": process, "config": config}
60
61            # Wait a moment for server to start
62            time.sleep(1)
63
64            # Initialize the server
65            if self._initialize_server_sync(server_name):
66                logger.info("Started MCP server: %s", server_name)
67                return True
68            else:
69                logger.error("Failed to initialize MCP server: %s", server_name)
70                return False
71
72        except Exception as e:
73            logger.error("Failed to start MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
74            return False

Start an MCP server process synchronously.

def call_tool_sync(self, server_name: str, tool_name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]) -> str: 
126    def call_tool_sync(
127        self, server_name: str, tool_name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]
128    ) -> str:
129        """Call a tool on an MCP server synchronously."""
130        try:
131            request = {
132                "jsonrpc": "2.0",
133                "id": 3,
134                "method": "tools/call",
135                "params": {"name": tool_name, "arguments": arguments},
136            }
137
138            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
139            if response and response.get("result"):
140                content = response["result"].get("content", [])
141                if content and len(content) > 0:
142                    return content[0].get("text", "No response")
143
144        except Exception as e:
145            logger.error(
146                "Error calling tool %s on server %s: %s", tool_name, server_name, e
147            )
148
149        return f"Error calling tool {tool_name}"

def list_tools_sync(self, server_name: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]: 
151    def list_tools_sync(self, server_name: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
152        """List available tools on an MCP server synchronously."""
153        try:
154            request = {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 2, "method": "tools/list"}
155
156            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
157            if response and response.get("result"):
158                tools = response["result"].get("tools", [])
159                logger.debug(
160                    "Available tools on %s: %s",
161                    server_name,
162                    [tool.get("name") for tool in tools],
163                )
164                return tools
165
166        except Exception as e:
167            logger.error("Error listing tools on server %s: %s", server_name, e)
168
169        return []

def stop_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool: 
171    def stop_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
172        """Stop a specific MCP server."""
173        if server_name not in self.active_servers:
174            logger.debug("MCP server %s not running", server_name)
175            return True
176
177        try:
178            server_info = self.active_servers[server_name]
179            process = server_info["process"]
180
181            # Terminate the process
182            process.terminate()
183
184            # Wait for it to exit gracefully
185            try:
186                process.wait(timeout=3)
187            except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
188                # Force kill if it doesn't exit gracefully
189                process.kill()
190                process.wait()
191
192            # Remove from active servers
193            del self.active_servers[server_name]
194            logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
195            return True
196
197        except Exception as e:
198            logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
199            return False

def start_servers(self, server_configs: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]] = None) -> bool: 
201    def start_servers(
202        self, server_configs: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]] = None
203    ) -> bool:
204        """Start all configured MCP servers."""
205        configs = server_configs or self.server_configs
206        success = True
207
208        for server_name in configs:
209            if not self.start_server_sync(server_name):
210                logger.error("Failed to start MCP server: %s", server_name)
211                success = False
212
213        return success

Start all configured MCP servers.

def stop_all_servers(self): 
215    def stop_all_servers(self):
216        """Stop all active MCP servers."""
217        for server_name, server_info in self.active_servers.items():
218            try:
219                process = server_info["process"]
220                process.terminate()
221                process.wait(timeout=5)  # Wait up to 5 seconds
222                logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
223            except Exception as e:
224                logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
225
226        self.active_servers.clear()

Stop all active MCP servers.

def setup_weaviate() -> bool: 
 31def setup_weaviate() -> bool:
 32    """
 33    Setup Weaviate client and vector store. Returns True if successful.
 34
 35    :return: True if Weaviate setup succeeded, False otherwise
 36    """
 37    global vector_store, weaviate_client
 38
 39    if not USE_WEAVIATE:
 40        logger.info("Weaviate disabled by configuration")
 41        return False
 42
 43    try:
 44        # Verify Weaviate is running with retries
 45        for attempt in range(5):
 46            logger.info(
 47                "Attempting to connect to Weaviate at %s (attempt %d/5)",
 48                WEAVIATE_URL,
 49                attempt + 1,
 50            )
 51            response = requests.get(f"{WEAVIATE_URL}/v1/.well-known/ready", timeout=10)
 52            if response.status_code == 200:
 53                logger.info("Weaviate is ready")
 54                break
 55            else:
 56                raise RuntimeError(f"Weaviate returned status {response.status_code}")
 57        else:
 58            # If we've exhausted all attempts
 59            logger.error(
 60                "Cannot connect to Weaviate at %s after 5 attempts",
 61                WEAVIATE_URL,
 62            )
 63            return False
 64
 65    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
 66        logger.error("Attempt %d/5: Error connecting to Weaviate: %s", attempt + 1, e)
 67        if attempt == 4:
 68            logger.error(
 69                "Cannot connect to Weaviate at %s, proceeding without Weaviate",
 70                WEAVIATE_URL,
 71            )
 72            return False
 73        time.sleep(10)
 74
 75    # Parse WEAVIATE_URL to create ConnectionParams
 76    parsed_url = parse_url(WEAVIATE_URL)
 77    connection_params = ConnectionParams.from_params(
 78        http_host=parsed_url.host or "localhost",
 79        http_port=parsed_url.port or 8080,
 80        http_secure=parsed_url.scheme == "https",
 81        grpc_host=parsed_url.host or "localhost",
 82        grpc_port=50051,  # Weaviate's default gRPC port
 83        grpc_secure=parsed_url.scheme == "https",
 84    )
 85
 86    # Initialize Weaviate client !!!
 87    try:
 88        weaviate_client = WeaviateClient(
 89            connection_params,
 90            skip_init_checks=True,
 91            additional_headers={
 92                "X-OpenAI-Api-Key": os.environ[
 93                    "OPENAI_API_KEY"
 94                ]  # Add inference API keys as needed
 95            },
 96        )
 97        weaviate_client.connect()  # Explicitly connect
 98        collection_name = "UserKnowledgeBase"
 99
100        # Create Weaviate collection if it doesn't exist
101        if not weaviate_client.collections.exists(collection_name):
102            logger.info("Creating Weaviate collection: %s", collection_name)
103            weaviate_client.collections.create(
104                name=collection_name,
105                properties=[
106                    wvc.Property(name="text", data_type=wvc.DataType.TEXT),
107                    wvc.Property(name="timestamp", data_type=wvc.DataType.DATE),
108                    wvc.Property(name="topic", data_type=wvc.DataType.TEXT),
109                ],
110                vectorizer_config=wvc.Configure.Vectorizer.text2vec_ollama(
111                    api_endpoint="http://host.docker.internal:11434",
112                    model="nomic-embed-text",
113                ),
114            )
115    except ImportError as e:
116        logger.error("Import error initializing Weaviate client or collection: %s", e)
117        return False
118    except AttributeError as e:
119        logger.error(
120            "Attribute error initializing Weaviate client or collection: %s", e
121        )
122        return False
123    except Exception as e:
124        logger.error(
125            "Unexpected error initializing Weaviate client or collection: %s", e
126        )
127        return False
128
129    # Initialize Weaviate vector store
130    try:
131        vector_store = WeaviateVectorStore(
132            client=weaviate_client,
133            index_name=collection_name,
134            text_key="text",
135            embedding=OllamaEmbeddings(model="nomic-embed-text", base_url=OLLAMA_URL),
136            attributes=["timestamp", "topic"],
137        )
138        logger.info("Successfully initialized Weaviate vector store")
139        return True
140    except Exception as e:
141        logger.error("Error initializing vector store: %s", e)
142        return False

Setup Weaviate client and vector store. Returns True if successful.

Returns

True if Weaviate setup succeeded, False otherwise

def is_weaviate_connected() -> bool: 
145def is_weaviate_connected() -> bool:
146    """
147    Check if Weaviate is available and connected.
148
149    :return: True if Weaviate is connected and ready, False otherwise
150    """
151    if not USE_WEAVIATE:
152        return False
153
154    if weaviate_client is None:
155        return False
156
157    try:
158        # Check if Weaviate is ready via HTTP endpoint
159        response = requests.get(f"{WEAVIATE_URL}/v1/.well-known/ready", timeout=5)
160        if response.status_code != 200:
161            return False
162
163        # Additionally check database health and attempt recovery if needed
164        return reset_weaviate_if_corrupted()
165
166    except (requests.exceptions.RequestException, Exception) as e:
167        logger.debug("Weaviate connection check failed: %s", e)
168        return False

Check if Weaviate is available and connected.

Returns

True if Weaviate is connected and ready, False otherwise

def reset_weaviate_if_corrupted() -> bool: 
171def reset_weaviate_if_corrupted() -> bool:
172    """
173    Check for Weaviate database corruption and attempt recovery.
174
175    :return: True if reset was successful or not needed, False if reset failed
176    """
177    global vector_store, weaviate_client
178
179    if not USE_WEAVIATE or weaviate_client is None:
180        return False
181
182    try:
183        # Try a simple operation to test database health
184        collection = weaviate_client.collections.get("UserKnowledgeBase")
185        # Attempt to get collection info
186        collection.config.get()
187        return True  # Database is healthy
188
189    except Exception as e:
190        error_msg = str(e).lower()
191
192        # Check for common corruption indicators
193        corruption_indicators = [
194            "no such file or directory",
195            "wal",
196            "segment-",
197            "commit log",
198            "failed to send all objects",
199            "weaviateinsertmanyallfailederror",
200        ]
201
202        if any(indicator in error_msg for indicator in corruption_indicators):
203            logger.warning("Database corruption detected: %s", e)
204            logger.info("Attempting to reconnect to Weaviate...")
205
206            # Close existing connection
207            try:
208                if weaviate_client:
209                    weaviate_client.close()
210            except Exception:
211                pass
212
213            # Reset global variables
214            weaviate_client = None
215            vector_store = None
216
217            # Wait a moment for cleanup
218            time.sleep(2)
219
220            # Attempt to reconnect
221            return setup_weaviate()
222
223        # Not a corruption error, re-raise
224        logger.error("Non-corruption Weaviate error: %s", e)
225        return False

Check for Weaviate database corruption and attempt recovery.

Returns

True if reset was successful or not needed, False if reset failed

def is_agno_storage_connected() -> bool: 
228def is_agno_storage_connected() -> bool:
229    """
230    Check if Agno storage is available and connected.
231
232    :return: True if Agno storage directories exist and are accessible, False otherwise
233    """
234    from ..config import STORAGE_BACKEND, AGNO_STORAGE_DIR, AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR
235    
236    if STORAGE_BACKEND != "agno":
237        return False
238    
239    try:
240        import os
241        from pathlib import Path
242        
243        # Check if storage directories exist and are accessible
244        storage_path = Path(AGNO_STORAGE_DIR)
245        knowledge_path = Path(AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR)
246        
247        # Create directories if they don't exist (this is normal for Agno)
248        storage_path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
249        knowledge_path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
250        
251        # Test write access to storage directory
252        test_file = storage_path / ".connection_test"
253        try:
254            test_file.write_text("test")
255            test_file.unlink()  # Remove test file
256        except (OSError, PermissionError):
257            logger.debug("Cannot write to Agno storage directory: %s", storage_path)
258            return False
259        
260        # Check if we can import required Agno modules
261        try:
262            from agno.storage.sqlite import SqliteStorage
263            from agno.memory.v2.db.sqlite import SqliteMemoryDb
264            return True
265        except ImportError as e:
266            logger.debug("Agno modules not available: %s", e)
267            return False
268            
269    except Exception as e:
270        logger.debug("Agno storage connection check failed: %s", e)
271        return False

Check if Agno storage is available and connected.

Returns

True if Agno storage directories exist and are accessible, False otherwise

def is_memory_connected() -> bool: 
274def is_memory_connected() -> bool:
275    """
276    Check if the configured memory backend is connected.
277    
278    :return: True if the configured memory backend is connected, False otherwise
279    """
280    from ..config import STORAGE_BACKEND
281    
282    if STORAGE_BACKEND == "weaviate":
283        return is_weaviate_connected()
284    elif STORAGE_BACKEND == "agno":
285        return is_agno_storage_connected()
286    else:
287        logger.warning("Unknown storage backend: %s", STORAGE_BACKEND)
288        return False

Check if the configured memory backend is connected.

Returns

True if the configured memory backend is connected, False otherwise

def create_agent_executor( tools: List[langchain_core.tools.base.BaseTool]) -> langchain.agents.agent.AgentExecutor: 
17def create_agent_executor(tools: List[BaseTool]) -> AgentExecutor:
18    """Create the ReAct agent executor with the provided tools."""
19
20    # Initialize Ollama LLM
21    llm = ChatOllama(model=LLM_MODEL, temperature=0.7, base_url=OLLAMA_URL)
22
23    # System prompt for the agent
24    system_prompt = """You are a helpful personal assistant with access to various tools for file operations, knowledge management, web search, and GitHub integration.
25
26You have access to the following tools:
27{tools}
28
29Use the following format:
30
31Question: the input question you must answer
32Thought: you should always think about what to do
33Action: the action to take, should be one of [{tool_names}]
34Action Input: the input to the action as valid JSON (e.g., {{"param1": "value1", "param2": "value2"}})
35Observation: the result of the action
36... (this Thought/Action/Action Input/Observation can repeat N times)
37Thought: I now know the final answer
38Final Answer: the final answer to the original input question
39
40IMPORTANT: Action Input must be valid JSON format. For example:
41- Correct: {{"file_path": "~/test.txt", "content": "Hello world"}}
42- Incorrect: file_path = '~/test.txt', content = '''Hello world'''
43
44When storing information, always use a relevant topic to categorize it for better retrieval.
45When working with files, prefer using absolute paths and be careful about file permissions.
46Always store important interactions in memory for future reference. When asked about Github
47repositories, use the GitHub tool to search for repositories and provide relevant information.
48When asked about the weather, use the weather tool to get current conditions. When asked about
49the news, use the news tool to get the latest headlines.
50
51Begin!
52
53Question: {input}
54Thought: {agent_scratchpad}"""
55
56    # Create prompt template
57    prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(system_prompt)
58
59    # Create the ReAct agent
60    agent = create_react_agent(llm, tools, prompt)
61
62    # Create agent executor
63    agent_executor = AgentExecutor(
64        agent=agent,
65        tools=tools,
66        verbose=True,
67        max_iterations=10,
68        handle_parsing_errors=True,
69    )
70
71    logger.info("Created agent executor with %d tools", len(tools))
72    return agent_executor

Create the ReAct agent executor with the provided tools.

def create_simple_personal_agent( storage_dir: str = None, knowledge_dir: str = None, model_provider: str = 'ollama', model_name: str = 'qwen3:8b'): 
1208def create_simple_personal_agent(
1209    storage_dir: str = None,
1210    knowledge_dir: str = None,
1211    model_provider: str = "ollama",
1212    model_name: str = LLM_MODEL,
1213):
1214    """Create a simple personal agent following the working pattern from knowledge_agent_example.py
1215
1216    This function creates an agent with knowledge base integration using the simple
1217    pattern that avoids async initialization complexity.
1218
1219    Args:
1220        storage_dir: Directory for storage files (defaults to PERSAG_ROOT/agno)
1221        knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files (defaults to PERSAG_ROOT/knowledge)
1222        model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
1223        model_name: Model name to use
1224
1225    Returns:
1226        Tuple of (Agent instance, knowledge_base) or (Agent, None) if no knowledge
1227    """
1228    from agno.knowledge.combined import CombinedKnowledgeBase
1229
1230    # Create knowledge base (synchronous creation)
1231    knowledge_base = create_combined_knowledge_base(storage_dir, knowledge_dir)
1232
1233    # Always use AgentModelManager to ensure consistent model creation
1234    model_manager = AgentModelManager(
1235        model_provider=model_provider,
1236        model_name=model_name,
1237        ollama_base_url=OLLAMA_URL,
1238        seed=None,
1239    )
1240    model = model_manager.create_model()
1241
1242    # Create agent with simple pattern
1243    agent = Agent(
1244        name="Personal AI Agent",
1245        model=model,
1246        knowledge=knowledge_base,
1247        search_knowledge=True,  # Enable automatic knowledge search
1248        show_tool_calls=True,  # Show what tools the agent uses
1249        markdown=True,  # Format responses in markdown
1250        instructions=[
1251            "You are a personal AI assistant with access to the user's knowledge base.",
1252            "Always search your knowledge base when asked about personal information.",
1253            "Provide detailed responses based on the information you find.",
1254            "If you can't find specific information, say so clearly.",
1255            "Include relevant details from the knowledge base in your responses.",
1256        ],
1257    )
1258
1259    logger.info("✅ Created simple personal agent")
1260    if knowledge_base:
1261        logger.info("   Knowledge base: Enabled")
1262        logger.info("   Search enabled: %s", agent.search_knowledge)
1263    else:
1264        logger.info("   Knowledge base: None (no knowledge files found)")
1265
1266    return agent, knowledge_base

Create a simple personal agent following the working pattern from knowledge_agent_example.py

This function creates an agent with knowledge base integration using the simple pattern that avoids async initialization complexity.

Args: storage_dir: Directory for storage files (defaults to PERSAG_ROOT/agno) knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files (defaults to PERSAG_ROOT/knowledge) model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai') model_name: Model name to use

Returns: Tuple of (Agent instance, knowledge_base) or (Agent, None) if no knowledge

async def load_agent_knowledge(knowledge_base, recreate: bool = False) -> None: 
1269async def load_agent_knowledge(knowledge_base, recreate: bool = False) -> None:
1270    """Load knowledge base content asynchronously.
1271
1272    This should be called after creating the agent to load the knowledge content.
1273
1274    Args:
1275        knowledge_base: Knowledge base instance to load
1276        recreate: Whether to recreate the knowledge base from scratch
1277
1278    Returns:
1279        None
1280    """
1281    if knowledge_base:
1282        await load_combined_knowledge_base(knowledge_base, recreate=recreate)
1283        logger.info("✅ Knowledge base loaded successfully")
1284    else:
1285        logger.info("No knowledge base to load")

Load knowledge base content asynchronously.

This should be called after creating the agent to load the knowledge content.

Args: knowledge_base: Knowledge base instance to load recreate: Whether to recreate the knowledge base from scratch

Returns: None

class AgentKnowledgeManager: 
 23class AgentKnowledgeManager:
 24    """Manages knowledge operations including storage, retrieval, and updates."""
 25    
 26    def __init__(self, user_id: str, storage_dir: str, 
 27                 lightrag_url: Optional[str] = None, 
 28                 lightrag_memory_url: Optional[str] = None):
 29        """Initialize the knowledge manager.
 30        
 31        Args:
 32            user_id: User identifier for knowledge operations
 33            storage_dir: Directory for storage files
 34            lightrag_url: Optional URL for LightRAG API
 35            lightrag_memory_url: Optional URL for LightRAG Memory API
 36        """
 37        self.user_id = user_id
 38        self.storage_dir = storage_dir
 39        self.lightrag_url = lightrag_url
 40        self.lightrag_memory_url = lightrag_memory_url
 41        self.knowledge_base_file = os.path.join(storage_dir, f"{user_id}_knowledge.json")
 42        self.knowledge_base = self._load_knowledge_base()
 43        
 44    def _load_knowledge_base(self) -> Dict:
 45        """Load the knowledge base from file.
 46        
 47        Returns:
 48            Dict containing the knowledge base
 49        """
 50        try:
 51            if os.path.exists(self.knowledge_base_file):
 52                with open(self.knowledge_base_file, "r") as f:
 53                    return json.load(f)
 54            else:
 55                # Initialize with empty structure
 56                knowledge_base = {
 57                    "facts": [],
 58                    "preferences": {},
 59                    "entities": {},
 60                    "relationships": [],
 61                    "metadata": {
 62                        "version": "1.0",
 63                        "last_updated": None
 64                    }
 65                }
 66                # Save the initial structure
 67                self._save_knowledge_base(knowledge_base)
 68                return knowledge_base
 69        except Exception as e:
 70            logger.error(f"Error loading knowledge base: {e}")
 71            # Return a default empty structure
 72            return {
 73                "facts": [],
 74                "preferences": {},
 75                "entities": {},
 76                "relationships": [],
 77                "metadata": {
 78                    "version": "1.0",
 79                    "last_updated": None
 80                }
 81            }
 82            
 83    def _save_knowledge_base(self, knowledge_base: Optional[Dict] = None) -> bool:
 84        """Save the knowledge base to file.
 85        
 86        Args:
 87            knowledge_base: Optional knowledge base to save (uses self.knowledge_base if None)
 88            
 89        Returns:
 90            True if save was successful
 91        """
 92        try:
 93            kb = knowledge_base if knowledge_base is not None else self.knowledge_base
 94            
 95            # Create directory if it doesn't exist
 96            os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(self.knowledge_base_file), exist_ok=True)
 97            
 98            # Update metadata
 99            import datetime
100            kb["metadata"]["last_updated"] = datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
101            
102            with open(self.knowledge_base_file, "w") as f:
103                json.dump(kb, f, indent=2)
104            
105            return True
106        except Exception as e:
107            logger.error(f"Error saving knowledge base: {e}")
108            return False
109            
110    def add_fact(self, fact: str, source: str = "user", confidence: float = 1.0) -> bool:
111        """Add a fact to the knowledge base.
112        
113        Args:
114            fact: The fact to add
115            source: Source of the fact (user, inference, etc.)
116            confidence: Confidence score (0.0-1.0)
117            
118        Returns:
119            True if fact was added successfully
120        """
121        try:
122            # Create a fact object
123            import datetime
124            fact_obj = {
125                "text": fact,
126                "source": source,
127                "confidence": confidence,
128                "created_at": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat(),
129                "last_accessed": None,
130                "access_count": 0
131            }
132            
133            # Add to knowledge base
134            self.knowledge_base["facts"].append(fact_obj)
135            
136            # Save knowledge base
137            return self._save_knowledge_base()
138        except Exception as e:
139            logger.error(f"Error adding fact: {e}")
140            return False
141            
142    def get_facts(self, filter_source: Optional[str] = None, min_confidence: float = 0.0) -> List[Dict]:
143        """Get facts from the knowledge base with optional filtering.
144        
145        Args:
146            filter_source: Optional source to filter by
147            min_confidence: Minimum confidence threshold
148            
149        Returns:
150            List of fact objects
151        """
152        try:
153            facts = self.knowledge_base["facts"]
154            
155            # Apply filters
156            if filter_source:
157                facts = [f for f in facts if f.get("source") == filter_source]
158                
159            facts = [f for f in facts if f.get("confidence", 0.0) >= min_confidence]
160            
161            # Update access metadata
162            import datetime
163            now = datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
164            
165            for fact in facts:
166                # Find the original fact in the knowledge base and update it
167                for kb_fact in self.knowledge_base["facts"]:
168                    if kb_fact.get("text") == fact.get("text"):
169                        kb_fact["last_accessed"] = now
170                        kb_fact["access_count"] = kb_fact.get("access_count", 0) + 1
171            
172            # Save the updated knowledge base
173            self._save_knowledge_base()
174            
175            return facts
176        except Exception as e:
177            logger.error(f"Error getting facts: {e}")
178            return []
179            
180    def set_preference(self, category: str, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
181        """Set a user preference.
182        
183        Args:
184            category: Preference category (e.g., 'communication', 'interface')
185            key: Preference key
186            value: Preference value
187            
188        Returns:
189            True if preference was set successfully
190        """
191        try:
192            # Initialize category if it doesn't exist
193            if category not in self.knowledge_base["preferences"]:
194                self.knowledge_base["preferences"][category] = {}
195                
196            # Set preference
197            self.knowledge_base["preferences"][category][key] = value
198            
199            # Save knowledge base
200            return self._save_knowledge_base()
201        except Exception as e:
202            logger.error(f"Error setting preference: {e}")
203            return False
204            
205    def get_preference(self, category: str, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
206        """Get a user preference.
207        
208        Args:
209            category: Preference category
210            key: Preference key
211            default: Default value if preference doesn't exist
212            
213        Returns:
214            Preference value or default
215        """
216        try:
217            return self.knowledge_base["preferences"].get(category, {}).get(key, default)
218        except Exception as e:
219            logger.error(f"Error getting preference: {e}")
220            return default
221            
222    def get_all_preferences(self, category: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict:
223        """Get all preferences, optionally filtered by category.
224        
225        Args:
226            category: Optional category to filter by
227            
228        Returns:
229            Dictionary of preferences
230        """
231        try:
232            if category:
233                return self.knowledge_base["preferences"].get(category, {})
234            else:
235                return self.knowledge_base["preferences"]
236        except Exception as e:
237            logger.error(f"Error getting all preferences: {e}")
238            return {}
239            
240    def add_entity(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str, properties: Dict = None) -> bool:
241        """Add an entity to the knowledge base.
242        
243        Args:
244            entity_name: Name of the entity
245            entity_type: Type of the entity (person, place, thing, etc.)
246            properties: Optional properties of the entity
247            
248        Returns:
249            True if entity was added successfully
250        """
251        try:
252            # Create entity object
253            import datetime
254            entity_obj = {
255                "name": entity_name,
256                "type": entity_type,
257                "properties": properties or {},
258                "created_at": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat(),
259                "last_updated": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
260            }
261            
262            # Add to knowledge base
263            self.knowledge_base["entities"][entity_name] = entity_obj
264            
265            # Save knowledge base
266            return self._save_knowledge_base()
267        except Exception as e:
268            logger.error(f"Error adding entity: {e}")
269            return False
270            
271    def get_entity(self, entity_name: str) -> Optional[Dict]:
272        """Get an entity from the knowledge base.
273        
274        Args:
275            entity_name: Name of the entity
276            
277        Returns:
278            Entity object or None if not found
279        """
280        try:
281            return self.knowledge_base["entities"].get(entity_name)
282        except Exception as e:
283            logger.error(f"Error getting entity: {e}")
284            return None
285            
286    def update_entity(self, entity_name: str, properties: Dict) -> bool:
287        """Update an entity's properties.
288        
289        Args:
290            entity_name: Name of the entity
291            properties: Properties to update
292            
293        Returns:
294            True if entity was updated successfully
295        """
296        try:
297            # Check if entity exists
298            if entity_name not in self.knowledge_base["entities"]:
299                logger.warning(f"Entity {entity_name} not found")
300                return False
301                
302            # Update properties
303            entity = self.knowledge_base["entities"][entity_name]
304            entity["properties"].update(properties)
305            
306            # Update the last_updated timestamp
307            import datetime
308            entity["last_updated"] = datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
309            
310            # Save knowledge base
311            return self._save_knowledge_base()
312        except Exception as e:
313            logger.error(f"Error updating entity: {e}")
314            return False
315            
316    def add_relationship(self, entity1: str, relation: str, entity2: str, properties: Dict = None) -> bool:
317        """Add a relationship between entities.
318        
319        Args:
320            entity1: First entity name
321            relation: Relationship type
322            entity2: Second entity name
323            properties: Optional properties of the relationship
324            
325        Returns:
326            True if relationship was added successfully
327        """
328        try:
329            # Create relationship object
330            import datetime
331            rel_obj = {
332                "entity1": entity1,
333                "relation": relation,
334                "entity2": entity2,
335                "properties": properties or {},
336                "created_at": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
337            }
338            
339            # Add to knowledge base
340            self.knowledge_base["relationships"].append(rel_obj)
341            
342            # Save knowledge base
343            return self._save_knowledge_base()
344        except Exception as e:
345            logger.error(f"Error adding relationship: {e}")
346            return False
347            
348    def get_relationships(self, entity: Optional[str] = None, relation: Optional[str] = None) -> List[Dict]:
349        """Get relationships, optionally filtered by entity or relation type.
350        
351        Args:
352            entity: Optional entity to filter by (either entity1 or entity2)
353            relation: Optional relation type to filter by
354            
355        Returns:
356            List of relationship objects
357        """
358        try:
359            relationships = self.knowledge_base["relationships"]
360            
361            # Apply filters
362            if entity:
363                relationships = [
364                    r for r in relationships 
365                    if r.get("entity1") == entity or r.get("entity2") == entity
366                ]
367                
368            if relation:
369                relationships = [r for r in relationships if r.get("relation") == relation]
370                
371            return relationships
372        except Exception as e:
373            logger.error(f"Error getting relationships: {e}")
374            return []
375            
376    def clear_knowledge_base(self) -> bool:
377        """Clear the entire knowledge base.
378        
379        Returns:
380            True if knowledge base was cleared successfully
381        """
382        try:
383            # Reset to empty structure
384            self.knowledge_base = {
385                "facts": [],
386                "preferences": {},
387                "entities": {},
388                "relationships": [],
389                "metadata": {
390                    "version": "1.0",
391                    "last_updated": None
392                }
393            }
394            
395            # Save knowledge base
396            return self._save_knowledge_base()
397        except Exception as e:
398            logger.error(f"Error clearing knowledge base: {e}")
399            return False
400            
401    async def sync_with_graph(self) -> str:
402        """Synchronize the local knowledge base with the graph database.
403        
404        This method syncs entities and relationships from the local knowledge base
405        to the LightRAG graph database.
406        
407        Returns:
408            Status message
409        """
410        if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
411            return "Graph sync not available: LightRAG memory URL not configured"
412            
413        try:
414            results = []
415            
416            # 1. Sync entities
417            for entity_name, entity in self.knowledge_base["entities"].items():
418                try:
419                    # Check if entity exists in graph
420                    entity_exists = await self._check_entity_exists(entity_name)
421                    
422                    if not entity_exists:
423                        # Create entity in graph
424                        success = await self._create_graph_entity(
425                            entity_name, entity["type"], entity["properties"]
426                        )
427                        
428                        if success:
429                            results.append(f"Created entity: {entity_name}")
430                        else:
431                            results.append(f"Failed to create entity: {entity_name}")
432                    else:
433                        # Update entity in graph
434                        success = await self._update_graph_entity(
435                            entity_name, entity["properties"]
436                        )
437                        
438                        if success:
439                            results.append(f"Updated entity: {entity_name}")
440                        else:
441                            results.append(f"Failed to update entity: {entity_name}")
442                except Exception as e:
443                    logger.error(f"Error syncing entity {entity_name}: {e}")
444                    results.append(f"Error syncing entity {entity_name}: {str(e)}")
445                    
446            # 2. Sync relationships
447            for rel in self.knowledge_base["relationships"]:
448                try:
449                    # Create relationship in graph
450                    success = await self._create_graph_relationship(
451                        rel["entity1"], rel["relation"], rel["entity2"], rel["properties"]
452                    )
453                    
454                    if success:
455                        results.append(f"Created relationship: {rel['entity1']} {rel['relation']} {rel['entity2']}")
456                    else:
457                        results.append(f"Failed to create relationship: {rel['entity1']} {rel['relation']} {rel['entity2']}")
458                except Exception as e:
459                    logger.error(f"Error syncing relationship: {e}")
460                    results.append(f"Error syncing relationship: {str(e)}")
461                    
462            # Return combined results
463            return "\n".join(results)
464            
465        except Exception as e:
466            logger.error(f"Error syncing with graph: {e}")
467            return f"Error syncing with graph: {str(e)}"
468            
469    async def _check_entity_exists(self, entity_name: str) -> bool:
470        """Check if entity exists in the graph.
471        
472        Args:
473            entity_name: Name of the entity
474            
475        Returns:
476            True if entity exists
477        """
478        try:
479            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/entity/exists"
480            
481            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
482                async with session.get(url, params={"entity_name": entity_name}, timeout=10) as resp:
483                    if resp.status == 200:
484                        result = await resp.json()
485                        return result.get("exists", False)
486                    else:
487                        logger.warning(f"Failed to check entity existence: {resp.status}")
488                        return False
489        except Exception as e:
490            logger.error(f"Error checking entity existence: {e}")
491            return False
492            
493    async def _create_graph_entity(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str, properties: Dict) -> bool:
494        """Create an entity in the graph.
495        
496        Args:
497            entity_name: Name of the entity
498            entity_type: Type of the entity
499            properties: Properties of the entity
500            
501        Returns:
502            True if entity was created successfully
503        """
504        try:
505            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/entity/create"
506            
507            payload = {
508                "entity_name": entity_name,
509                "entity_type": entity_type,
510                "properties": properties
511            }
512            
513            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
514                async with session.post(url, json=payload, timeout=10) as resp:
515                    if resp.status in [200, 201]:
516                        logger.info(f"Created entity in graph: {entity_name}")
517                        return True
518                    else:
519                        error_text = await resp.text()
520                        logger.warning(f"Failed to create entity in graph: {error_text}")
521                        return False
522        except Exception as e:
523            logger.error(f"Error creating graph entity: {e}")
524            return False
525            
526    async def _update_graph_entity(self, entity_name: str, properties: Dict) -> bool:
527        """Update an entity in the graph.
528        
529        Args:
530            entity_name: Name of the entity
531            properties: Properties to update
532            
533        Returns:
534            True if entity was updated successfully
535        """
536        try:
537            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/entity/update"
538            
539            payload = {
540                "entity_name": entity_name,
541                "properties": properties
542            }
543            
544            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
545                async with session.put(url, json=payload, timeout=10) as resp:
546                    if resp.status == 200:
547                        logger.info(f"Updated entity in graph: {entity_name}")
548                        return True
549                    else:
550                        error_text = await resp.text()
551                        logger.warning(f"Failed to update entity in graph: {error_text}")
552                        return False
553        except Exception as e:
554            logger.error(f"Error updating graph entity: {e}")
555            return False
556            
557    async def _create_graph_relationship(self, entity1: str, relation: str, entity2: str, properties: Dict) -> bool:
558        """Create a relationship in the graph.
559        
560        Args:
561            entity1: First entity name
562            relation: Relationship type
563            entity2: Second entity name
564            properties: Properties of the relationship
565            
566        Returns:
567            True if relationship was created successfully
568        """
569        try:
570            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/relationship/create"
571            
572            payload = {
573                "entity1": entity1,
574                "relation": relation,
575                "entity2": entity2,
576                "properties": properties
577            }
578            
579            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
580                async with session.post(url, json=payload, timeout=10) as resp:
581                    if resp.status in [200, 201]:
582                        logger.info(f"Created relationship in graph: {entity1} {relation} {entity2}")
583                        return True
584                    else:
585                        error_text = await resp.text()
586                        logger.warning(f"Failed to create relationship in graph: {error_text}")
587                        return False
588        except Exception as e:
589            logger.error(f"Error creating graph relationship: {e}")
590            return False
591            
592    async def query_graph(self, query: str) -> Dict:
593        """Query the graph database.
594        
595        Args:
596            query: Cypher query
597            
598        Returns:
599            Query results
600        """
601        try:
602            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/query"
603            
604            payload = {
605                "query": query
606            }
607            
608            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
609                async with session.post(url, json=payload, timeout=30) as resp:
610                    if resp.status == 200:
611                        return await resp.json()
612                    else:
613                        error_text = await resp.text()
614                        logger.warning(f"Failed to query graph: {error_text}")
615                        return {"error": error_text}
616        except Exception as e:
617            logger.error(f"Error querying graph: {e}")
618            return {"error": str(e)}

Manages knowledge operations including storage, retrieval, and updates.

AgentKnowledgeManager( user_id: str, storage_dir: str, lightrag_url: Optional[str] = None, lightrag_memory_url: Optional[str] = None) 
26    def __init__(self, user_id: str, storage_dir: str, 
27                 lightrag_url: Optional[str] = None, 
28                 lightrag_memory_url: Optional[str] = None):
29        """Initialize the knowledge manager.
30        
31        Args:
32            user_id: User identifier for knowledge operations
33            storage_dir: Directory for storage files
34            lightrag_url: Optional URL for LightRAG API
35            lightrag_memory_url: Optional URL for LightRAG Memory API
36        """
37        self.user_id = user_id
38        self.storage_dir = storage_dir
39        self.lightrag_url = lightrag_url
40        self.lightrag_memory_url = lightrag_memory_url
41        self.knowledge_base_file = os.path.join(storage_dir, f"{user_id}_knowledge.json")
42        self.knowledge_base = self._load_knowledge_base()

Initialize the knowledge manager.

Args: user_id: User identifier for knowledge operations storage_dir: Directory for storage files lightrag_url: Optional URL for LightRAG API lightrag_memory_url: Optional URL for LightRAG Memory API

user_id
storage_dir
lightrag_url
lightrag_memory_url
knowledge_base_file
knowledge_base
def add_fact(self, fact: str, source: str = 'user', confidence: float = 1.0) -> bool: 
110    def add_fact(self, fact: str, source: str = "user", confidence: float = 1.0) -> bool:
111        """Add a fact to the knowledge base.
112        
113        Args:
114            fact: The fact to add
115            source: Source of the fact (user, inference, etc.)
116            confidence: Confidence score (0.0-1.0)
117            
118        Returns:
119            True if fact was added successfully
120        """
121        try:
122            # Create a fact object
123            import datetime
124            fact_obj = {
125                "text": fact,
126                "source": source,
127                "confidence": confidence,
128                "created_at": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat(),
129                "last_accessed": None,
130                "access_count": 0
131            }
132            
133            # Add to knowledge base
134            self.knowledge_base["facts"].append(fact_obj)
135            
136            # Save knowledge base
137            return self._save_knowledge_base()
138        except Exception as e:
139            logger.error(f"Error adding fact: {e}")
140            return False

Add a fact to the knowledge base.

Args: fact: The fact to add source: Source of the fact (user, inference, etc.) confidence: Confidence score (0.0-1.0)

Returns: True if fact was added successfully

def get_facts( self, filter_source: Optional[str] = None, min_confidence: float = 0.0) -> List[Dict]: 
142    def get_facts(self, filter_source: Optional[str] = None, min_confidence: float = 0.0) -> List[Dict]:
143        """Get facts from the knowledge base with optional filtering.
144        
145        Args:
146            filter_source: Optional source to filter by
147            min_confidence: Minimum confidence threshold
148            
149        Returns:
150            List of fact objects
151        """
152        try:
153            facts = self.knowledge_base["facts"]
154            
155            # Apply filters
156            if filter_source:
157                facts = [f for f in facts if f.get("source") == filter_source]
158                
159            facts = [f for f in facts if f.get("confidence", 0.0) >= min_confidence]
160            
161            # Update access metadata
162            import datetime
163            now = datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
164            
165            for fact in facts:
166                # Find the original fact in the knowledge base and update it
167                for kb_fact in self.knowledge_base["facts"]:
168                    if kb_fact.get("text") == fact.get("text"):
169                        kb_fact["last_accessed"] = now
170                        kb_fact["access_count"] = kb_fact.get("access_count", 0) + 1
171            
172            # Save the updated knowledge base
173            self._save_knowledge_base()
174            
175            return facts
176        except Exception as e:
177            logger.error(f"Error getting facts: {e}")
178            return []

Get facts from the knowledge base with optional filtering.

Args: filter_source: Optional source to filter by min_confidence: Minimum confidence threshold

Returns: List of fact objects

def set_preference(self, category: str, key: str, value: Any) -> bool: 
180    def set_preference(self, category: str, key: str, value: Any) -> bool:
181        """Set a user preference.
182        
183        Args:
184            category: Preference category (e.g., 'communication', 'interface')
185            key: Preference key
186            value: Preference value
187            
188        Returns:
189            True if preference was set successfully
190        """
191        try:
192            # Initialize category if it doesn't exist
193            if category not in self.knowledge_base["preferences"]:
194                self.knowledge_base["preferences"][category] = {}
195                
196            # Set preference
197            self.knowledge_base["preferences"][category][key] = value
198            
199            # Save knowledge base
200            return self._save_knowledge_base()
201        except Exception as e:
202            logger.error(f"Error setting preference: {e}")
203            return False

Set a user preference.

Args: category: Preference category (e.g., 'communication', 'interface') key: Preference key value: Preference value

Returns: True if preference was set successfully

def get_preference(self, category: str, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any: 
205    def get_preference(self, category: str, key: str, default: Any = None) -> Any:
206        """Get a user preference.
207        
208        Args:
209            category: Preference category
210            key: Preference key
211            default: Default value if preference doesn't exist
212            
213        Returns:
214            Preference value or default
215        """
216        try:
217            return self.knowledge_base["preferences"].get(category, {}).get(key, default)
218        except Exception as e:
219            logger.error(f"Error getting preference: {e}")
220            return default

Get a user preference.

Args: category: Preference category key: Preference key default: Default value if preference doesn't exist

Returns: Preference value or default

def get_all_preferences(self, category: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict: 
222    def get_all_preferences(self, category: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict:
223        """Get all preferences, optionally filtered by category.
224        
225        Args:
226            category: Optional category to filter by
227            
228        Returns:
229            Dictionary of preferences
230        """
231        try:
232            if category:
233                return self.knowledge_base["preferences"].get(category, {})
234            else:
235                return self.knowledge_base["preferences"]
236        except Exception as e:
237            logger.error(f"Error getting all preferences: {e}")
238            return {}

Get all preferences, optionally filtered by category.

Args: category: Optional category to filter by

Returns: Dictionary of preferences

def add_entity( self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str, properties: Dict = None) -> bool: 
240    def add_entity(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str, properties: Dict = None) -> bool:
241        """Add an entity to the knowledge base.
242        
243        Args:
244            entity_name: Name of the entity
245            entity_type: Type of the entity (person, place, thing, etc.)
246            properties: Optional properties of the entity
247            
248        Returns:
249            True if entity was added successfully
250        """
251        try:
252            # Create entity object
253            import datetime
254            entity_obj = {
255                "name": entity_name,
256                "type": entity_type,
257                "properties": properties or {},
258                "created_at": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat(),
259                "last_updated": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
260            }
261            
262            # Add to knowledge base
263            self.knowledge_base["entities"][entity_name] = entity_obj
264            
265            # Save knowledge base
266            return self._save_knowledge_base()
267        except Exception as e:
268            logger.error(f"Error adding entity: {e}")
269            return False

Add an entity to the knowledge base.

Args: entity_name: Name of the entity entity_type: Type of the entity (person, place, thing, etc.) properties: Optional properties of the entity

Returns: True if entity was added successfully

def get_entity(self, entity_name: str) -> Optional[Dict]: 
271    def get_entity(self, entity_name: str) -> Optional[Dict]:
272        """Get an entity from the knowledge base.
273        
274        Args:
275            entity_name: Name of the entity
276            
277        Returns:
278            Entity object or None if not found
279        """
280        try:
281            return self.knowledge_base["entities"].get(entity_name)
282        except Exception as e:
283            logger.error(f"Error getting entity: {e}")
284            return None

Get an entity from the knowledge base.

Args: entity_name: Name of the entity

Returns: Entity object or None if not found

def update_entity(self, entity_name: str, properties: Dict) -> bool: 
286    def update_entity(self, entity_name: str, properties: Dict) -> bool:
287        """Update an entity's properties.
288        
289        Args:
290            entity_name: Name of the entity
291            properties: Properties to update
292            
293        Returns:
294            True if entity was updated successfully
295        """
296        try:
297            # Check if entity exists
298            if entity_name not in self.knowledge_base["entities"]:
299                logger.warning(f"Entity {entity_name} not found")
300                return False
301                
302            # Update properties
303            entity = self.knowledge_base["entities"][entity_name]
304            entity["properties"].update(properties)
305            
306            # Update the last_updated timestamp
307            import datetime
308            entity["last_updated"] = datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
309            
310            # Save knowledge base
311            return self._save_knowledge_base()
312        except Exception as e:
313            logger.error(f"Error updating entity: {e}")
314            return False

Update an entity's properties.

Args: entity_name: Name of the entity properties: Properties to update

Returns: True if entity was updated successfully

def add_relationship( self, entity1: str, relation: str, entity2: str, properties: Dict = None) -> bool: 
316    def add_relationship(self, entity1: str, relation: str, entity2: str, properties: Dict = None) -> bool:
317        """Add a relationship between entities.
318        
319        Args:
320            entity1: First entity name
321            relation: Relationship type
322            entity2: Second entity name
323            properties: Optional properties of the relationship
324            
325        Returns:
326            True if relationship was added successfully
327        """
328        try:
329            # Create relationship object
330            import datetime
331            rel_obj = {
332                "entity1": entity1,
333                "relation": relation,
334                "entity2": entity2,
335                "properties": properties or {},
336                "created_at": datetime.datetime.now().isoformat()
337            }
338            
339            # Add to knowledge base
340            self.knowledge_base["relationships"].append(rel_obj)
341            
342            # Save knowledge base
343            return self._save_knowledge_base()
344        except Exception as e:
345            logger.error(f"Error adding relationship: {e}")
346            return False

Add a relationship between entities.

Args: entity1: First entity name relation: Relationship type entity2: Second entity name properties: Optional properties of the relationship

Returns: True if relationship was added successfully

def get_relationships( self, entity: Optional[str] = None, relation: Optional[str] = None) -> List[Dict]: 
348    def get_relationships(self, entity: Optional[str] = None, relation: Optional[str] = None) -> List[Dict]:
349        """Get relationships, optionally filtered by entity or relation type.
350        
351        Args:
352            entity: Optional entity to filter by (either entity1 or entity2)
353            relation: Optional relation type to filter by
354            
355        Returns:
356            List of relationship objects
357        """
358        try:
359            relationships = self.knowledge_base["relationships"]
360            
361            # Apply filters
362            if entity:
363                relationships = [
364                    r for r in relationships 
365                    if r.get("entity1") == entity or r.get("entity2") == entity
366                ]
367                
368            if relation:
369                relationships = [r for r in relationships if r.get("relation") == relation]
370                
371            return relationships
372        except Exception as e:
373            logger.error(f"Error getting relationships: {e}")
374            return []
