137                    topics = None
138            else:
139                # Convert anything else to string and put in list
140                topic_str = str(topics).strip()
141                topics = [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else None
142
143            # 1. Store in local SQLite memory system
144            local_result = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.add_memory(
145                memory_text=restated_content,
146                db=self.agno_memory.db,
147                user_id=self.user_id,
148                topics=topics,
149            )
150
151            # Handle different rejection cases
152            if not local_result.is_success:
153                logger.info("Local memory rejected: %s", local_result.message)
154                # Return the rejection status directly from the memory manager
155                return local_result
156
157            # Local storage succeeded
158            logger.info(
159                "Stored in local memory: %s... (ID: %s)",
160                content[:50],
161                local_result.memory_id,
162            )
163
164            # 2. Store in LightRAG graph memory system
165            graph_success = False
166            graph_message = ""
167
168            try:
169                # Store in graph memory
170                graph_result = await self.store_graph_memory(
171                    restated_content, local_result.topics, local_result.memory_id
172                )
173                logger.info("Graph memory result: %s", graph_result)
174                if "✅" in graph_result:
175                    graph_success = True
176                    graph_message = "Graph memory synced successfully"
177                else:
178                    graph_message = f"Graph memory sync failed: {graph_result}"
179
180            except Exception as e:
181                logger.error("Error storing in graph memory: %s", e)
182                graph_message = f"Graph memory error: {str(e)}"
183
184            # Determine final status based on local and graph results
185            if graph_success:
186                final_status = MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS
187                final_message = (
188                    f"Memory stored successfully in both systems: {content[:50]}..."
189                )
190                logger.info(
191                    "✅ DUAL STORAGE SUCCESS: Memory stored in both local SQLite and LightRAG graph"
192                )
193            else:
194                final_status = MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS_LOCAL_ONLY
195                final_message = f"Memory stored in local system only: {content[:50]}... | {graph_message}"
196                logger.warning(
197                    "⚠️ PARTIAL STORAGE: Memory stored in local SQLite only (graph sync failed)"
198                )
199
200            # Return the enhanced result with dual storage information
201            return MemoryStorageResult(
202                status=final_status,
203                message=final_message,
204                memory_id=local_result.memory_id,
205                topics=local_result.topics,
206                local_success=True,
207                graph_success=graph_success,
208                similarity_score=local_result.similarity_score,
209            )
210
211        except Exception as e:
212            logger.error("Error storing user memory: %s", e)
213            return MemoryStorageResult(
214                status=MemoryStorageStatus.STORAGE_ERROR,
215                message=f"Error storing memory: {str(e)}",
216                local_success=False,
217                graph_success=False,
218            )

Store information as a user memory in BOTH local SQLite and LightRAG graph systems.

Args: content: The information to store as a memory topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory (None = auto-classify)

Returns: MemoryStorageResult: Structured result with detailed status information

def restate_user_fact(self, content: str) -> str: 
220    def restate_user_fact(self, content: str) -> str:
221        """Restate a user fact from first-person to third-person.
222
223        This method converts statements like "I have a PhD" to "{user_id} has a PhD"
224        to ensure correct entity mapping in the knowledge graph.
225
226        Args:
227            content: The original fact from the user
228
229        Returns:
230            The restated fact
231        """
232        # Ensure user_id is a safe string for replacement
233        user_id_str = str(self.user_id)
234
235        # Define regex patterns for pronoun and verb replacement
236        # Using word boundaries (\b) to avoid replacing parts of words like "mine" in "mining"
237        patterns = [
238            (r"\bI am\b", f"{user_id_str} is"),
239            (r"\bI was\b", f"{user_id_str} was"),
240            (r"\bI have\b", f"{user_id_str} has"),
241            (r"\bI'm\b", f"{user_id_str} is"),
242            (r"\bI've\b", f"{user_id_str} has"),
243            (r"\bI\b", user_id_str),
244            (r"\bmy\b", f"{user_id_str}'s"),
245            (r"\bmine\b", f"{user_id_str}'s"),
246            (r"\bmyself\b", user_id_str),
247        ]
248
249        restated_content = content
250        for pattern, replacement in patterns:
251            # Use re.IGNORECASE to handle variations like "i" vs "I"
252            restated_content = re.sub(
253                pattern, replacement, restated_content, flags=re.IGNORECASE
254            )
255
256        return restated_content

Restate a user fact from first-person to third-person.

This method converts statements like "I have a PhD" to "{user_id} has a PhD" to ensure correct entity mapping in the knowledge graph.

Args: content: The original fact from the user

Returns: The restated fact

async def seed_entity_in_graph(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str) -> bool: 
258    async def seed_entity_in_graph(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str) -> bool:
259        """Seed an entity into the graph by creating and uploading a physical file.
260
261        Args:
262            entity_name: Name of the entity to create
263            entity_type: Type of the entity
264
265        Returns:
266            True if entity was successfully seeded
267        """
268        try:
269            # Create a minimal document to seed the entity
270            seed_text = f"{entity_name} is a {entity_type.lower()}."
271
272            # Create a unique filename for this entity seed
273            entity_hash = hashlib.md5(
274                f"{entity_name}_{entity_type}_{time.time()}".encode()
275            ).hexdigest()[:8]
276            filename = f"entity_seed_{entity_name.replace(' ', '_').replace('/', '_')}_{entity_hash}.txt"
277
278            # Create a temporary file
279            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(
280                mode="w", suffix=".txt", delete=False
281            ) as temp_file:
282                temp_file.write(seed_text)
283                temp_file_path = temp_file.name
284
285            try:
286                # Upload the file using the /documents/upload endpoint
287                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/upload"
288
289                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
290                    with open(temp_file_path, "rb") as file:
291                        # Create form data for file upload
292                        data = aiohttp.FormData()
293                        data.add_field(
294                            "file", file, filename=filename, content_type="text/plain"
295                        )
296
297                        async with session.post(url, data=data, timeout=30) as resp:
298                            if resp.status in [200, 201]:
299                                logger.info(
300                                    f"Successfully seeded entity: {entity_name}"
301                                )
302                                return True
303                            else:
304                                error_detail = await resp.text()
305                                logger.warning(
306                                    f"Failed to seed entity {entity_name}: {error_detail}"
307                                )
308                                return False
309
310            finally:
311                # Clean up the temporary file
312                try:
313                    os.unlink(temp_file_path)
314                except OSError:
315                    pass  # Ignore cleanup errors
316
317        except Exception as e:
318            logger.error(f"Error seeding entity {entity_name}: {e}")
319            return False

Seed an entity into the graph by creating and uploading a physical file.

Args: entity_name: Name of the entity to create entity_type: Type of the entity

Returns: True if entity was successfully seeded

async def check_entity_exists(self, entity_name: str) -> bool: 
321    async def check_entity_exists(self, entity_name: str) -> bool:
322        """Check if entity exists in the graph using the correct /graph/entity/exists endpoint.
323
324        Args:
325            entity_name: Name of the entity to check
326
327        Returns:
328            True if entity exists
329        """
330        try:
331            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/entity/exists"
332
333            # Try different parameter formats that LightRAG might expect
334            params_options = [
335                {"entity_name": entity_name},
336                {"name": entity_name},
337                {"entity": entity_name},
338            ]
339
340            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
341                for params in params_options:
342                    try:
343                        async with session.get(url, params=params, timeout=10) as resp:
344                            if resp.status == 200:
345                                result = await resp.json()
346                                # Handle different response formats
347                                if isinstance(result, bool):
348                                    exists = result
349                                elif isinstance(result, dict):
350                                    exists = result.get("exists", False) or result.get(
351                                        "found", False
352                                    )
353                                else:
354                                    exists = False
355
356                                logger.debug(
357                                    f"Entity {entity_name} exists: {exists} (params: {params})"
358                                )
359                                return exists
360                            elif resp.status == 422:
361                                # Try next parameter format
362                                continue
363                            else:
364                                logger.warning(
365                                    f"Failed to check entity existence for {entity_name}: {resp.status}"
366                                )
367                                break
368                    except Exception as e:
369                        logger.debug(f"Error with params {params}: {e}")
370                        continue
371
372                # If all parameter formats fail, fall back to label list approach
373                logger.debug(
374                    f"All parameter formats failed for {entity_name}, falling back to label list"
375                )
376                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/label/list"
377                async with session.get(url, timeout=10) as resp:
378                    if resp.status == 200:
379                        labels_data = await resp.json()
380
381                        # Handle both response formats: direct array or dict with 'labels' key
382                        if isinstance(labels_data, list):
383                            all_labels = labels_data
384                        elif isinstance(labels_data, dict) and "labels" in labels_data:
385                            all_labels = labels_data["labels"]
386                        else:
387                            all_labels = []
388
389                        # Check if entity name exists in labels (case-insensitive)
390                        exists = any(
391                            label.lower() == entity_name.lower() for label in all_labels
392                        )
393                        logger.debug(
394                            f"Entity {entity_name} exists (via labels): {exists}"
395                        )
396                        return exists
397                    else:
398                        logger.warning(
399                            f"Failed to get graph labels for entity check: {resp.status}"
400                        )
401                        return False
402
403        except Exception as e:
404            logger.error(f"Error checking entity existence for {entity_name}: {e}")
405            return False

Check if entity exists in the graph using the correct /graph/entity/exists endpoint.

Args: entity_name: Name of the entity to check

Returns: True if entity exists

async def clear_all_memories(self) -> str: 
407    async def clear_all_memories(self) -> str:
408        """Clear all memories from both SQLite and LightRAG systems.
409
410        This method provides a complete reset of the dual memory system by:
411        1. Clearing all memories from the local SQLite database
412        2. Clearing all documents from the LightRAG memory server
413        3. Deleting the knowledge graph file
414
415        Returns:
416            str: Success or error message
417        """
418        try:
419            results = []
420
421            # 1. Clear local SQLite memories
422            if self.agno_memory and self.agno_memory.memory_manager:
423                success, message = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.clear_memories(
424                    db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
425                )
426
427                if success:
428                    logger.info(
429                        "Cleared all memories from SQLite for user %s", self.user_id
430                    )
431                    results.append("✅ Local memory: All memories cleared successfully")
432                else:
433                    logger.error("Failed to clear memories from SQLite: %s", message)
434                    results.append(f"❌ Local memory error: {message}")
435            else:
436                logger.warning(
437                    "Memory system not initialized, skipping SQLite memory clear"
438                )
439                results.append("⚠️ Local memory: System not initialized")
440
441            # 2. Clear LightRAG graph memories
442            try:
443                # Use LightRAG API to delete all documents
444                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents"
445
446                # First get all documents
447                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
448                    async with session.get(url, timeout=30) as resp:
449                        if resp.status == 200:
450                            data = await resp.json()
451                            all_docs = []
452
453                            # Extract documents from response
454                            if isinstance(data, dict) and "statuses" in data:
455                                statuses = data["statuses"]
456                                for status_name, docs_list in statuses.items():
457                                    if isinstance(docs_list, list):
458                                        all_docs.extend(docs_list)
459                            elif isinstance(data, dict) and "documents" in data:
460                                all_docs = data["documents"]
461                            elif isinstance(data, list):
462                                all_docs = data
463
464                            if all_docs:
465                                # Delete all documents
466                                doc_ids = [doc["id"] for doc in all_docs]
467                                payload = {"doc_ids": doc_ids, "delete_file": True}
468
469                                async with session.delete(
470                                    f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/delete_document",
471                                    json=payload,
472                                    timeout=60,
473                                ) as del_resp:
474                                    if del_resp.status == 200:
475                                        logger.info(
476                                            "Cleared all memories from LightRAG (%d documents)",
477                                            len(doc_ids),
478                                        )
479                                        results.append(
480                                            f"✅ Graph memory: All memories cleared successfully ({len(doc_ids)} documents)"
481                                        )
482                                    else:
483                                        error_text = await del_resp.text()
484                                        logger.error(
485                                            "Failed to clear memories from LightRAG: %s",
486                                            error_text,
487                                        )
488                                        results.append(
489                                            f"❌ Graph memory error: {error_text}"
490                                        )
491                            else:
492                                logger.info("No documents found in LightRAG to clear")
493                                results.append(
494                                    "✅ Graph memory: No documents found to clear"
495                                )
496                        else:
497                            error_text = await resp.text()
498                            logger.error(
499                                "Failed to get documents from LightRAG: %s", error_text
500                            )
501                            results.append(f"❌ Graph memory error: {error_text}")
502
503                    # 3. Clear the knowledge graph file
504                    try:
505                        # Clear cache to ensure all in-memory data is flushed
506                        await session.post(
507                            f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/clear_cache",
508                            json={"modes": None},
509                            timeout=30,
510                        )
511
512                        # Delete the knowledge graph files
513                        import os
514
515                        from ..config.settings import (
516                            LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_STORAGE_DIR,
517                            LIGHTRAG_STORAGE_DIR,
518                        )
519
520                        graph_file_paths = [
521                            os.path.join(
522                                LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_STORAGE_DIR,
523                                "graph_chunk_entity_relation.graphml",
524                            )
525                        ]
526
527                        graph_deleted = False
528                        for graph_file_path in graph_file_paths:
529                            if os.path.exists(graph_file_path):
530                                os.remove(graph_file_path)
531                                logger.info(
532                                    "Deleted knowledge graph file: %s", graph_file_path
533                                )
534                                graph_deleted = True
535
536                        if graph_deleted:
537                            results.append(
538                                "✅ Knowledge graph: Graph file deleted successfully"
539                            )
540                        else:
541                            logger.info("No knowledge graph files found to delete")
542                            results.append(
543                                "ℹ️ Knowledge graph: No graph files found to delete"
544                            )
545
546                    except Exception as e:
547                        logger.error("Error deleting knowledge graph file: %s", e)
548                        results.append(f"❌ Knowledge graph error: {str(e)}")
549
550            except Exception as e:
551                logger.error("Error clearing LightRAG memories: %s", e)
552                results.append(f"❌ Graph memory error: {str(e)}")
553
554            # Return combined results
555            return " | ".join(results)
556
557        except Exception as e:
558            logger.error("Error clearing all memories: %s", e)
559            return f"❌ Error clearing all memories: {str(e)}"

Clear all memories from both SQLite and LightRAG systems.

This method provides a complete reset of the dual memory system by:

  1. Clearing all memories from the local SQLite database
  2. Clearing all documents from the LightRAG memory server
  3. Deleting the knowledge graph file

Returns: str: Success or error message

async def query_memory(self, query: str, limit: Optional[int] = None) -> str: 
564    async def query_memory(self, query: str, limit: Union[int, None] = None) -> str:
565        """Search user memories using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls.
566
567        Args:
568            query: The query to search for in memories
569            limit: Maximum number of memories to return
570
571        Returns:
572            str: Found memories or message if none found
573        """
574        try:
575            stripped_query = query.strip().lower()
576
577            # List of phrases that should trigger get_all_memories instead of search
578            get_all_phrases = [
579                "all",
580                "all memories",
581                "everything",
582                "summarize all memories",
583                "what do you know about me",
584                "what have i told you",
585                "list all memories",
586                "show all memories",
587                "tell me everything",
588                "list everything you know",
589            ]
590
591            # Check for explicit "do not interpret" or "just list" requests
592            no_interpret_phrases = [
593                "do not interpret",
594                "don't interpret",
595                "just list",
596                "just show",
597                "raw list",
598                "simple list",
599                "list them",
600                "show them"
601            ]
602            
603            should_skip_interpretation = any(phrase in query.lower() for phrase in no_interpret_phrases)
604
605            if stripped_query in get_all_phrases or "list all memories" in query.lower():
606                logger.info(
607                    "Generic/list query '%s' detected. Using optimized list_memories for performance.",
608                    query,
609                )
610                return await self.list_memories()
611
612            # Validate query parameter
613            if not query or not query.strip():
614                logger.warning("Empty query provided to query_memory")
615                return "❌ Error: Query cannot be empty. Please provide a search term."
616
617            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.search_memories()
618            results = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.search_memories(
619                query=query.strip(),
620                db=self.agno_memory.db,
621                user_id=self.user_id,
622                limit=limit,
623                similarity_threshold=0.3,
624                search_topics=True,
625                topic_boost=0.5,
626            )
627
628            if not results:
629                logger.info("No matching memories found for query: %s", query)
630                return f"🔍 No memories found for '{query}'. Try different keywords or ask me to remember something new!"
631
632            # Format results
633            display_memories = results[:limit] if limit else results
634            result_note = f"🧠 MEMORY RETRIEVAL (found {len(results)} matches via semantic search)"
635
636            if should_skip_interpretation:
637                # PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZED: Skip interpretation instructions for explicit listing requests
638                result = f"{result_note}: The following memories were found for '{query}':\n\n"
639                
640                for i, (memory, score) in enumerate(display_memories, 1):
641                    result += f"{i}. {memory.memory} (similarity: {score:.2f})\n"
642                    if memory.topics:
643                        result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
644                    result += "\n"
645                    
646                logger.info("Found %d matching memories for query: %s (no interpretation mode)", len(results), query)
647            else:
648                # Standard mode with interpretation instructions
649                result = f"{result_note}: The following memories were found for '{query}'. You must restate this information addressing the user as 'you' (second person), not as if you are the user:\n\n"
650
651                for i, (memory, score) in enumerate(display_memories, 1):
652                    result += f"{i}. {memory.memory} (similarity: {score:.2f})\n"
653                    if memory.topics:
654                        result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
655                    result += "\n"
656
657                result += "\nREMEMBER: Restate this information as an AI assistant talking ABOUT the user, not AS the user. Use 'you' instead of 'I' when referring to the user's information."
658                
659                logger.info("Found %d matching memories for query: %s (standard mode)", len(results), query)
660
661            return result
662
663        except Exception as e:
664            logger.error("Error querying memories: %s", e)
665            return f"❌ Error searching memories: {str(e)}"

Search user memories using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls.

Args: query: The query to search for in memories limit: Maximum number of memories to return

Returns: str: Found memories or message if none found

async def update_memory( self, memory_id: str, content: str, topics: Union[List[str], str, NoneType] = None) -> str: 
667    async def update_memory(
668        self, memory_id: str, content: str, topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None
669    ) -> str:
670        """Update an existing memory using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls.
671
672        Args:
673            memory_id: ID of the memory to update
674            content: New memory content
675            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory
676
677        Returns:
678            str: Success or error message
679        """
680        try:
681            # SIMPLIFIED TOPIC HANDLING: Handle the common cases simply
682            if topics is None:
683                # Leave as None - let memory manager auto-classify
684                pass
685            elif isinstance(topics, str):
686                # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
687                if "," in topics:
688                    topics = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
689                else:
690                    topics = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else None
691            elif isinstance(topics, list):
692                # Clean up list - remove empty entries
693                topics = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
694                if not topics:
695                    topics = None
696            else:
697                # Convert anything else to string and put in list
698                topic_str = str(topics).strip()
699                topics = [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else None
700
701            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.update_memory()
702            success, message = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.update_memory(
703                memory_id=memory_id,
704                memory_text=content,
705                db=self.agno_memory.db,
706                user_id=self.user_id,
707                topics=topics,
708            )
709
710            if success:
711                logger.info("Updated memory %s: %s...", memory_id, content[:50])
712                return f"✅ Successfully updated memory: {content[:50]}..."
713            else:
714                logger.error("Failed to update memory %s: %s", memory_id, message)
715                return f"❌ Error updating memory: {message}"
716
717        except Exception as e:
718            logger.error("Error updating memory: %s", e)
719            return f"❌ Error updating memory: {str(e)}"

Update an existing memory using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls.

Args: memory_id: ID of the memory to update content: New memory content topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory

Returns: str: Success or error message

async def delete_memory(self, memory_id: str) -> str: 
721    async def delete_memory(self, memory_id: str) -> str:
722        """Delete a memory from both SQLite and LightRAG systems.
723
724        Args:
725            memory_id: ID of the memory to delete
726
727        Returns:
728            str: Success or error message
729        """
730        try:
731            # 1. Delete from local SQLite memory system
732            success, message = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.delete_memory(
733                memory_id=memory_id, db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
734            )
735
736            if success:
737                sqlite_deleted_message = (
738                    f"Successfully deleted memory from SQLite: {memory_id}"
739                )
740                logger.info(f"Deleted memory {memory_id} from SQLite")
741            else:
742                sqlite_deleted_message = f"Error deleting memory from SQLite: {message}"
743                logger.error(
744                    f"Failed to delete memory {memory_id} from SQLite: {message}"
745                )
746                # If local deletion fails, no need to proceed with graph deletion
747                return sqlite_deleted_message
748
749            # 2. Delete from LightRAG graph memory
750            graph_deleted_message = ""
751            if self.lightrag_memory_url:
752                try:
753                    # Step 1: Find the document ID by its filename pattern
754                    list_url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents"
755                    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
756                        async with session.get(list_url, timeout=30) as response:
757                            if response.status != 200:
758                                error_text = await response.text()
759                                raise Exception(
760                                    f"Failed to list documents from LightRAG: {error_text}"
761                                )
762                            docs_response = await response.json()
763
764                            # Extract documents from the actual LightRAG structure
765                            documents = []
766                            if (
767                                isinstance(docs_response, dict)
768                                and "statuses" in docs_response
769                            ):
770                                statuses = docs_response["statuses"]
771                                for status_name, docs_list in statuses.items():
772                                    if isinstance(docs_list, list):
773                                        documents.extend(docs_list)
774                            elif (
775                                isinstance(docs_response, dict)
776                                and "documents" in docs_response
777                            ):
778                                documents = docs_response["documents"]
779                            elif isinstance(docs_response, list):
780                                documents = docs_response
781
782                    doc_id_to_delete = None
783                    # The filename is memory_{memory_id}_{hash}.txt
784                    filename_pattern = f"memory_{memory_id}_"
785
786                    for doc in documents:
787                        # Check file_path field (not metadata.source)
788                        file_path = doc.get("file_path", "")
789                        if file_path.startswith(filename_pattern):
790                            doc_id_to_delete = doc.get("id")
791                            logger.info(
792                                f"Found document to delete: {doc_id_to_delete} (file_path: {file_path})"
793                            )
794                            break
795
796                    # Step 2: Delete the document if found
797                    if doc_id_to_delete:
798                        delete_url = (
799                            f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/delete_document"
800                        )
801                        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
802                            # Use doc_ids (plural) as expected by the API
803                            async with session.delete(
804                                delete_url,
805                                json={"doc_ids": [doc_id_to_delete]},
806                                timeout=30,
807                            ) as response:
808                                if response.status == 200:
809                                    logger.info(
810                                        f"Successfully deleted memory {memory_id} (doc_id: {doc_id_to_delete}) from LightRAG."
811                                    )
812                                    graph_deleted_message = (
813                                        f"Successfully deleted from graph memory"
814                                    )
815                                else:
816                                    error_text = await response.text()
817                                    logger.error(
818                                        f"Failed to delete document {doc_id_to_delete} from LightRAG: {error_text}"
819                                    )
820                                    graph_deleted_message = f"⚠️ Could not delete from graph memory: {error_text}"
821                    else:
822                        logger.warning(
823                            f"Memory {memory_id} not found in LightRAG graph memory (searched for pattern: {filename_pattern})."
824                        )
825                        # Treat "not found" as successful deletion since the goal is achieved
826                        graph_deleted_message = "Successfully deleted from graph memory"
827
828                except Exception as e:
829                    logger.error(f"Exception deleting memory from graph: {e}")
830                    graph_deleted_message = f"⚠️ Could not delete from graph memory: {e}"
831            else:
832                graph_deleted_message = (
833                    "Graph memory client not configured, skipping deletion."
834                )
835
836            return f"{sqlite_deleted_message} {graph_deleted_message}".strip()
837
838        except Exception as e:
839            logger.error(f"Error deleting memory: {e}")
840            return f"❌ Error deleting memory: {str(e)}"

Delete a memory from both SQLite and LightRAG systems.

Args: memory_id: ID of the memory to delete

Returns: str: Success or error message

async def get_recent_memories(self, limit: int = 10) -> str: 
842    async def get_recent_memories(self, limit: int = 10) -> str:
843        """Get recent memories by searching all memories and sorting by date.
844
845        Args:
846            limit: Maximum number of memories to return
847
848        Returns:
849            str: Formatted string of recent memories
850        """
851        try:
852            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
853            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
854                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
855            )
856
857            if not memories:
858                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
859                return "🔍 No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
860
861            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
862            sorted_memories = sorted(
863                memories,
864                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
865                reverse=True,
866            )
867
868            # Limit the number of memories
869            display_memories = sorted_memories[:limit] if limit else sorted_memories
870
871            # Format results
872            result = f"🧠 RECENT MEMORIES (showing {len(display_memories)} of {len(memories)} total memories):\n\n"
873
874            for i, memory in enumerate(display_memories, 1):
875                # Format the memory content
876                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory}\n"
877
878                # Add topics if available
879                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
880                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
881
882                # Add timestamp if available
883                if hasattr(memory, "timestamp") and memory.timestamp:
884                    # Convert timestamp to readable format
885                    from datetime import datetime
886
887                    timestamp = datetime.fromtimestamp(memory.timestamp)
888                    result += f"   Created: {timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n"
889
890                # Add memory ID for reference
891                result += f"   ID: {memory.memory_id}\n\n"
892
893            logger.info(
894                "Retrieved %d recent memories for user %s",
895                len(display_memories),
896                self.user_id,
897            )
898            return result
899
900        except Exception as e:
901            logger.error("Error retrieving recent memories: %s", e)
902            return f"❌ Error retrieving recent memories: {str(e)}"

Get recent memories by searching all memories and sorting by date.

Args: limit: Maximum number of memories to return

Returns: str: Formatted string of recent memories

async def get_all_memories(self) -> str: 
904    async def get_all_memories(self) -> str:
905        """Get all user memories.
906
907        Returns:
908            str: Formatted string of all memories
909        """
910        try:
911            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
912            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
913                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
914            )
915
916            if not memories:
917                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
918                return "🔍 No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
919
920            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
921            sorted_memories = sorted(
922                memories,
923                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
924                reverse=True,
925            )
926
927            # Format results
928            result = f"🧠 ALL MEMORIES ({len(memories)} total):\n\n"
929
930            for i, memory in enumerate(sorted_memories, 1):
931                # Format the memory content
932                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory}\n"
933
934                # Add topics if available
935                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
936                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
937
938                # Add timestamp if available
939                if hasattr(memory, "timestamp") and memory.timestamp:
940                    # Convert timestamp to readable format
941                    from datetime import datetime
942
943                    timestamp = datetime.fromtimestamp(memory.timestamp)
944                    result += f"   Created: {timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n"
945
946                # Add memory ID for reference
947                result += f"   ID: {memory.memory_id}\n\n"
948
949            logger.info(
950                "Retrieved all %d memories for user %s", len(memories), self.user_id
951            )
952            return result
953
954        except Exception as e:
955            logger.error("Error retrieving all memories: %s", e)
956            return f"❌ Error retrieving all memories: {str(e)}"

Get all user memories.

Returns: str: Formatted string of all memories

async def get_memory_stats(self) -> str: 
 958    async def get_memory_stats(self) -> str:
 959        """Get memory statistics.
 960
 961        Returns:
 962            str: Formatted string with memory statistics
 963        """
 964        try:
 965            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
 966            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
 967                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
 968            )
 969
 970            if not memories:
 971                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
 972                return "🔍 No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
 973
 974            # Calculate basic statistics
 975            total_memories = len(memories)
 976
 977            # Get all unique topics
 978            all_topics = {}
 979            for memory in memories:
 980                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
 981                    for topic in memory.topics:
 982                        all_topics[topic] = all_topics.get(topic, 0) + 1
 983
 984            # Sort topics by frequency (most common first)
 985            sorted_topics = sorted(all_topics.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
 986
 987            # Calculate average memory length
 988            total_length = sum(len(memory.memory) for memory in memories)
 989            avg_length = total_length / total_memories if total_memories > 0 else 0
 990
 991            # Get oldest and newest memory timestamps
 992            timestamps = [
 993                memory.timestamp for memory in memories if hasattr(memory, "timestamp")
 994            ]
 995            oldest_timestamp = min(timestamps) if timestamps else None
 996            newest_timestamp = max(timestamps) if timestamps else None
 997
 998            # Format results
 999            result = f"📊 MEMORY STATISTICS\n\n"
1000            result += f"Total memories: {total_memories}\n"
1001            result += f"Average memory length: {avg_length:.1f} characters\n"
1002
1003            if oldest_timestamp:
1004                from datetime import datetime
1005
1006                oldest_date = datetime.fromtimestamp(oldest_timestamp).strftime(
1007                    "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
1008                )
1009                result += f"Oldest memory: {oldest_date}\n"
1010
1011            if newest_timestamp:
1012                from datetime import datetime
1013
1014                newest_date = datetime.fromtimestamp(newest_timestamp).strftime(
1015                    "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
1016                )
1017                result += f"Newest memory: {newest_date}\n"
1018
1019            if sorted_topics:
1020                result += f"\nTop topics:\n"
1021                # Show top 10 topics
1022                for topic, count in sorted_topics[:10]:
1023                    result += f"- {topic}: {count} memories\n"
1024
1025                if len(sorted_topics) > 10:
1026                    result += f"... and {len(sorted_topics) - 10} more topics\n"
1027
1028            logger.info("Generated memory statistics for user %s", self.user_id)
1029            return result
1030
1031        except Exception as e:
1032            logger.error("Error retrieving memory statistics: %s", e)
1033            return f"❌ Error retrieving memory statistics: {str(e)}"

Get memory statistics.

Returns: str: Formatted string with memory statistics

async def get_memories_by_topic( self, topics: Union[List[str], str, NoneType] = None, limit: Optional[int] = None) -> str: 
1035    async def get_memories_by_topic(
1036        self, topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None, limit: Union[int, None] = None
1037    ) -> str:
1038        """Get memories by topic without similarity search.
1039
1040        Args:
1041            topics: Topic or list of topics to filter memories by
1042            limit: Maximum number of memories to return
1043
1044        Returns:
1045            str: Formatted string of memories matching the topics
1046        """
1047        try:
1048            # Validate topics parameter
1049            if topics is None:
1050                logger.warning("No topics provided to get_memories_by_topic")
1051                return (
1052                    "❌ Error: No topics provided. Please specify at least one topic."
1053                )
1054
1055            # Parse topics parameter
1056            if isinstance(topics, str):
1057                # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
1058                if "," in topics:
1059                    topic_list = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
1060                else:
1061                    topic_list = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else []
1062            elif isinstance(topics, list):
1063                # Clean up list - remove empty entries
1064                topic_list = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
1065            else:
1066                # Convert anything else to string and put in list
1067                topic_str = str(topics).strip()
1068                topic_list = [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else []
1069
1070            if not topic_list:
1071                logger.warning("No valid topics provided after parsing")
1072                return "❌ Error: No valid topics provided. Please specify at least one topic."
1073
1074            # Get all memories first
1075            all_memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
1076                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
1077            )
1078
1079            if not all_memories:
1080                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
1081                return "🔍 No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
1082
1083            # Filter memories by topic
1084            filtered_memories = []
1085            for memory in all_memories:
1086                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1087                    # Check if any of the requested topics match this memory's topics
1088                    if any(
1089                        topic.lower() in [t.lower() for t in memory.topics]
1090                        for topic in topic_list
1091                    ):
1092                        filtered_memories.append(memory)
1093
1094            if not filtered_memories:
1095                topics_str = ", ".join(topic_list)
1096                logger.info("No memories found for topics: %s", topics_str)
1097                return f"🔍 No memories found for topics: {topics_str}. Try different topics or store new memories with these topics."
1098
1099            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
1100            sorted_memories = sorted(
1101                filtered_memories,
1102                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
1103                reverse=True,
1104            )
1105
1106            # Limit the number of memories if specified
1107            display_memories = sorted_memories[:limit] if limit else sorted_memories
1108
1109            # Format results
1110            topics_str = ", ".join(topic_list)
1111            result = f"🧠 MEMORIES BY TOPIC: {topics_str} (showing {len(display_memories)} of {len(filtered_memories)} matching memories)\n\n"
1112
1113            for i, memory in enumerate(display_memories, 1):
1114                # Format the memory content
1115                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory}\n"
1116
1117                # Add topics if available
1118                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1119                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
1120
1121                # Add timestamp if available
1122                if hasattr(memory, "timestamp") and memory.timestamp:
1123                    # Convert timestamp to readable format
1124                    from datetime import datetime
1125
1126                    timestamp = datetime.fromtimestamp(memory.timestamp)
1127                    result += f"   Created: {timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n"
1128
1129                # Add memory ID for reference
1130                result += f"   ID: {memory.memory_id}\n\n"
1131
1132            logger.info(
1133                "Retrieved %d memories for topics %s", len(display_memories), topics_str
1134            )
1135            return result
1136
1137        except Exception as e:
1138            logger.error("Error retrieving memories by topic: %s", e)
1139            return f"❌ Error retrieving memories by topic: {str(e)}"

Get memories by topic without similarity search.

Args: topics: Topic or list of topics to filter memories by limit: Maximum number of memories to return

Returns: str: Formatted string of memories matching the topics

async def list_memories(self) -> str: 
1141    async def list_memories(self) -> str:
1142        """List all memories in a simple, user-friendly format.
1143
1144        This method provides a more concise view of all memories compared to get_all_memories,
1145        focusing on just the content and topics without additional metadata.
1146        
1147        PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZED: Returns raw memory data without interpretation instructions
1148        to avoid unnecessary LLM inference when user requests simple listing.
1149
1150        Returns:
1151            str: Simplified list of all memories without interpretation instructions
1152        """
1153        try:
1154            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
1155            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
1156                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
1157            )
1158
1159            if not memories:
1160                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
1161                return "🔍 No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
1162
1163            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
1164            sorted_memories = sorted(
1165                memories,
1166                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
1167                reverse=True,
1168            )
1169
1170            # Format results in a simplified way - NO INTERPRETATION INSTRUCTIONS
1171            result = f"📝 MEMORY LIST ({len(memories)} total):\n\n"
1172
1173            for i, memory in enumerate(sorted_memories, 1):
1174                # Just show the memory content and topics, omit other metadata
1175                memory_preview = (
1176                    memory.memory[:100] + "..."
1177                    if len(memory.memory) > 100
1178                    else memory.memory
1179                )
1180                result += f"{i}. {memory_preview}\n"
1181
1182                # Add topics if available
1183                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1184                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
1185
1186                result += "\n"
1187
1188            logger.info(
1189                "Listed all %d memories for user %s in simplified format (performance optimized)",
1190                len(memories),
1191                self.user_id,
1192            )
1193            return result
1194
1195        except Exception as e:
1196            logger.error("Error listing memories: %s", e)
1197            return f"❌ Error listing memories: {str(e)}"

List all memories in a simple, user-friendly format.

This method provides a more concise view of all memories compared to get_all_memories, focusing on just the content and topics without additional metadata.

PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZED: Returns raw memory data without interpretation instructions to avoid unnecessary LLM inference when user requests simple listing.

Returns: str: Simplified list of all memories without interpretation instructions

async def store_graph_memory( self, content: str, topics: Union[List[str], str, NoneType] = None, memory_id: str = None) -> str: 
1199    async def store_graph_memory(
1200        self,
1201        content: str,
1202        topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None,
1203        memory_id: str = None,
1204    ) -> str:
1205        """Store a memory in the LightRAG graph database to capture relationships.
1206
1207        This method creates a text file with the memory content and uploads it to the LightRAG
1208        memory server, which then processes it to extract entities and relationships.
1209
1210        Args:
1211            content: The memory content to store
1212            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory
1213            memory_id: Optional memory ID to link with the SQLite memory
1214
1215        Returns:
1216            str: Success or error message
1217        """
1218        try:
1219            if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
1220                logger.warning("LightRAG memory URL not configured")
1221                return "❌ Graph memory not configured. Memory not stored in graph database."
1222
1223            # Validate content
1224            if not content or not content.strip():
1225                logger.warning("Empty content provided to store_graph_memory")
1226                return "❌ Error: Content cannot be empty."
1227
1228            # Parse topics parameter
1229            topic_list = []
1230            if topics is not None:
1231                if isinstance(topics, str):
1232                    # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
1233                    if "," in topics:
1234                        topic_list = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
1235                    else:
1236                        topic_list = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else []
1237                elif isinstance(topics, list):
1238                    # Clean up list - remove empty entries
1239                    topic_list = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
1240                else:
1241                    # Convert anything else to string and put in list
1242                    topic_str = str(topics).strip()
1243                    topic_list = (
1244                        [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else []
1245                    )
1246
1247            # Create a unique filename for this memory
1248            timestamp = int(time.time())
1249            memory_hash = hashlib.md5(f"{content}_{timestamp}".encode()).hexdigest()[:8]
1250
1251            # If memory_id is provided, use it in the filename for traceability
1252            if memory_id:
1253                filename = f"memory_{memory_id}_{memory_hash}.txt"
1254            else:
1255                filename = f"memory_{memory_hash}.txt"
1256
1257            # Prepare the content with metadata
1258            file_content = content
1259
1260            # Add topics as metadata if available
1261            if topic_list:
1262                file_content += f"\n\nTopics: {', '.join(topic_list)}"
1263
1264            # Create a temporary file
1265            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(
1266                mode="w", suffix=".txt", delete=False
1267            ) as temp_file:
1268                temp_file.write(file_content)
1269                temp_file_path = temp_file.name
1270
1271            try:
1272                # Upload the file using the /documents/upload endpoint
1273                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/upload"
1274
1275                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
1276                    with open(temp_file_path, "rb") as file:
1277                        # Create form data for file upload
1278                        data = aiohttp.FormData()
1279                        data.add_field(
1280                            "file", file, filename=filename, content_type="text/plain"
1281                        )
1282
1283                        async with session.post(url, data=data, timeout=30) as resp:
1284                            if resp.status in [200, 201]:
1285                                logger.info(
1286                                    "Successfully stored memory in graph database: %s",
1287                                    filename,
1288                                )
1289                                return f"✅ Memory successfully stored in graph database: {content[:50]}..."
1290                            else:
1291                                error_detail = await resp.text()
1292                                logger.warning(
1293                                    f"Failed to store memory in graph: {error_detail}"
1294                                )
1295                                return (
1296                                    f"❌ Error storing memory in graph: {error_detail}"
1297                                )
1298
1299            finally:
1300                # Clean up the temporary file
1301                try:
1302                    os.unlink(temp_file_path)
1303                except OSError:
1304                    pass  # Ignore cleanup errors
1305
1306        except Exception as e:
1307            logger.error("Error storing memory in graph: %s", e)
1308            return f"❌ Error storing memory in graph: {str(e)}"

Store a memory in the LightRAG graph database to capture relationships.

This method creates a text file with the memory content and uploads it to the LightRAG memory server, which then processes it to extract entities and relationships.

Args: content: The memory content to store topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory memory_id: Optional memory ID to link with the SQLite memory

Returns: str: Success or error message

async def query_graph_memory( self, query: str, mode: str = 'mix', top_k: int = 5, response_type: str = 'Multiple Paragraphs') -> dict: 
1310    async def query_graph_memory(
1311        self,
1312        query: str,
1313        mode: str = "mix",
1314        top_k: int = 5,
1315        response_type: str = "Multiple Paragraphs",
1316    ) -> dict:
1317        """Query the LightRAG memory graph to explore relationships between memories.
1318
1319        This method sends a query to the LightRAG memory server to retrieve memories and their
1320        relationships based on the query. It supports different query modes and response formats.
1321
1322        Args:
1323            query: The query to search for in the memory graph
1324            mode: Query mode - "semantic" (vector search), "graph" (graph traversal), or "mix" (combined)
1325            top_k: Maximum number of results to return
1326            response_type: Format of the response - "Multiple Paragraphs", "Single Paragraph", etc.
1327
1328        Returns:
1329            dict: Query results with memories and their relationships
1330        """
1331        try:
1332            if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
1333                logger.warning("LightRAG memory URL not configured")
1334                return {
1335                    "error": "Graph memory not configured. Cannot query graph database."
1336                }
1337
1338            # Validate query
1339            if not query or not query.strip():
1340                logger.warning("Empty query provided to query_graph_memory")
1341                return {"error": "Query cannot be empty. Please provide a search term."}
1342
1343            # Validate mode
1344            valid_modes = ["local", "global", "hybrid"]
1345            if mode not in valid_modes:
1346                logger.warning(f"Invalid mode '{mode}' provided to query_graph_memory")
1347                mode = "mix"  # Default to mix mode
1348
1349            # Validate response_type
1350            valid_response_types = [
1351                "Multiple Paragraphs",
1352                "Single Paragraph",
1353                "Bullet Points",
1354                "JSON",
1355            ]
1356            if response_type not in valid_response_types:
1357                logger.warning(
1358                    f"Invalid response_type '{response_type}' provided to query_graph_memory"
1359                )
1360                response_type = "Multiple Paragraphs"  # Default to multiple paragraphs
1361
1362            # Prepare the query parameters
1363            params = {
1364                "query": query.strip(),
1365                "mode": mode,
1366                "top_k": top_k,
1367                "response_type": response_type,
1368            }
1369
1370            # Send the query to the LightRAG memory server
1371            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/query"
1372
1373            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
1374                async with session.get(url, params=params, timeout=60) as resp:
1375                    if resp.status == 200:
1376                        result = await resp.json()
1377                        logger.info(
1378                            f"Successfully queried graph memory: {query[:50]}..."
1379                        )
1380                        return result
1381                    else:
1382                        error_detail = await resp.text()
1383                        logger.warning(f"Failed to query graph memory: {error_detail}")
1384                        return {
1385                            "error": f"Error querying graph memory: {error_detail}",
1386                            "query": query,
1387                            "mode": mode,
1388                        }
1389
1390        except Exception as e:
1391            logger.error(f"Error querying graph memory: {e}")
1392            return {
1393                "error": f"Error querying graph memory: {str(e)}",
1394                "query": query,
1395                "mode": mode,
1396            }

Query the LightRAG memory graph to explore relationships between memories.

This method sends a query to the LightRAG memory server to retrieve memories and their relationships based on the query. It supports different query modes and response formats.

Args: query: The query to search for in the memory graph mode: Query mode - "semantic" (vector search), "graph" (graph traversal), or "mix" (combined) top_k: Maximum number of results to return response_type: Format of the response - "Multiple Paragraphs", "Single Paragraph", etc.

Returns: dict: Query results with memories and their relationships

async def get_memory_graph_labels(self) -> str: 
1398    async def get_memory_graph_labels(self) -> str:
1399        """Get the list of all entity and relation labels from the memory graph.
1400
1401        This method retrieves all entity and relation labels from the LightRAG memory graph,
1402        providing insights into the types of information stored in the graph.
1403
1404        Returns:
1405            str: Formatted string with entity and relation labels
1406        """
1407        try:
1408            if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
1409                logger.warning("LightRAG memory URL not configured")
1410                return "❌ Graph memory not configured. Cannot retrieve graph labels."
1411
1412            # Send the request to the LightRAG memory server
1413            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/label/list"
1414
1415            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
1416                async with session.get(url, timeout=30) as resp:
1417                    if resp.status == 200:
1418                        data = await resp.json()
1419
1420                        # Handle different response formats
1421                        entity_labels = []
1422                        relation_labels = []
1423
1424                        # Format 1: Direct array of all labels
1425                        if isinstance(data, list):
1426                            all_labels = data
1427                            # We can't distinguish between entity and relation labels in this format
1428                            entity_labels = all_labels
1429
1430                        # Format 2: Dict with 'labels' key containing all labels
1431                        elif isinstance(data, dict) and "labels" in data:
1432                            all_labels = data["labels"]
1433                            # We can't distinguish between entity and relation labels in this format
1434                            entity_labels = all_labels
1435
1436                        # Format 3: Dict with separate 'entity_labels' and 'relation_labels' keys
1437                        elif isinstance(data, dict):
1438                            if "entity_labels" in data:
1439                                entity_labels = data["entity_labels"]
1440                            if "relation_labels" in data:
1441                                relation_labels = data["relation_labels"]
1442
1443                        # Format the result
1444                        result = "🏷️ MEMORY GRAPH LABELS\n\n"
1445
1446                        if entity_labels:
1447                            result += "Entity Types:\n"
1448                            for label in sorted(entity_labels):
1449                                result += f"- {label}\n"
1450                            result += "\n"
1451
1452                        if relation_labels:
1453                            result += "Relation Types:\n"
1454                            for label in sorted(relation_labels):
1455                                result += f"- {label}\n"
1456
1457                        if not entity_labels and not relation_labels:
1458                            result += "No labels found in the memory graph. Try storing some memories first!"
1459
1460                        logger.info("Retrieved memory graph labels successfully")
1461                        return result
1462                    else:
1463                        error_detail = await resp.text()
1464                        logger.warning(
1465                            f"Failed to retrieve graph labels: {error_detail}"
1466                        )
1467                        return f"❌ Error retrieving graph labels: {error_detail}"
1468
1469        except Exception as e:
1470            logger.error(f"Error retrieving memory graph labels: {e}")
1471            return f"❌ Error retrieving memory graph labels: {str(e)}"

Get the list of all entity and relation labels from the memory graph.

This method retrieves all entity and relation labels from the LightRAG memory graph, providing insights into the types of information stored in the graph.

Returns: str: Formatted string with entity and relation labels

async def delete_memories_by_topic(self, topics: Union[List[str], str]) -> str: 
1473    async def delete_memories_by_topic(self, topics: Union[List[str], str]) -> str:
1474        """Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics from both local and graph memory."""
1475        try:
1476            if isinstance(topics, str):
1477                topics = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",")]
1478
1479            # Get memories to delete from local storage
1480            memories_to_delete = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_memories_by_topic(
1481                topics=topics, db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
1482            )
1483
1484            if not memories_to_delete:
1485                return f"No memories found for topics: {', '.join(topics)}"
1486
1487            deleted_count = 0
1488            for memory in memories_to_delete:
1489                await self.delete_memory(memory.memory_id)
1490                deleted_count += 1
1491
1492            return f"Successfully deleted {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}"
1493
1494        except Exception as e:
1495            logger.error(f"Error deleting memories by topic: {e}")
1496            return f"❌ Error deleting memories by topic: {str(e)}"

Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics from both local and graph memory.

class AgentModelManager: 
 24class AgentModelManager:
 25    """Manages model creation and configuration."""
 26
 27    def __init__(
 28        self,
 29        model_provider: str,
 30        model_name: str,
 31        ollama_base_url: str,
 32        seed: Optional[int] = None,
 33    ):
 34        """Initialize the model manager.
 35
 36        Args:
 37            model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
 38            model_name: Model name to use
 39            ollama_base_url: Base URL for Ollama API
 40            seed: Optional seed for model reproducibility
 41        """
 42        self.model_provider = model_provider
 43        self.model_name = model_name
 44        self.ollama_base_url = ollama_base_url
 45        self.seed = seed
 46
 47    def create_model(self) -> Union[OpenAIChat, Ollama]:
 48        """Create the appropriate model instance based on provider.
 49
 50        Returns:
 51            Configured model instance (uses regular Ollama for Qwen3 compatibility)
 52
 53        Raises:
 54            ValueError: If unsupported model provider is specified
 55        """
 56        if self.model_provider == "openai":
 57            # Use LMStudio URL from settings when provider is openai
 58            lmstudio_url = settings.LMSTUDIO_URL
 59
 60            # Check if we're using LMStudio (localhost:1234 indicates LMStudio)
 61            if "localhost:1234" in lmstudio_url or "1234" in lmstudio_url:
 62                # Use LMStudio with OpenAI-compatible API
 63                # Ensure the base URL has the correct /v1 endpoint for LMStudio
 64                base_url = lmstudio_url
 65                if not base_url.endswith("/v1"):
 66                    base_url = base_url.rstrip("/") + "/v1"
 67
 68                logger.info(f"Using LMStudio with OpenAI-compatible API at: {base_url}")
 69                logger.info(f"Model: {self.model_name}")
 70                logger.info(
 71                    "This will use /v1/chat/completions endpoint (OpenAI format)"
 72                )
 73
 74                # Remove response_format constraint to allow native OpenAI tool calling
 75                # LMStudio should support OpenAI's standard tool calling via the tools parameter
 76                model = OpenAIChat(
 77                    id=self.model_name,
 78                    base_url=base_url,  # Use corrected base URL with /v1 endpoint
 79                    api_key="lm-studio",  # LMStudio doesn't require a real API key
 80                    # No request_params with response_format - let OpenAI handle tool calling natively
 81                )
 82
 83                # WORKAROUND: Fix incorrect role mapping in Agno framework
 84                # The default_role_map incorrectly maps "system" -> "developer"
 85                # but OpenAI API only accepts: user, assistant, system, tool
 86                if hasattr(model, "role_map"):
 87                    model.role_map = {
 88                        "system": "system",  # Fix: should be "system", not "developer"
 89                        "user": "user",
 90                        "assistant": "assistant",
 91                        "tool": "tool",
 92                        "model": "assistant",
 93                    }
 94                    logger.info(
 95                        f"🔧 Applied role mapping fix to LMStudio model: {self.model_name}"
 96                    )
 97
 98                return model
 99            else:
100                # Standard OpenAI API
101                logger.info(f"Using standard OpenAI API with model: {self.model_name}")
102                model = OpenAIChat(id=self.model_name)
103
104                # WORKAROUND: Fix incorrect role mapping in Agno framework
105                # The default_role_map incorrectly maps "system" -> "developer"
106                # but OpenAI API only accepts: user, assistant, system, tool
107                if hasattr(model, "role_map"):
108                    model.role_map = {
109                        "system": "system",  # Fix: should be "system", not "developer"
110                        "user": "user",
111                        "assistant": "assistant",
112                        "tool": "tool",
113                        "model": "assistant",
114                    }
115                    logger.warning(
116                        f"🔧 Applied role mapping fix to OpenAI model: {self.model_name}"
117                    )
118
119                return model
120        elif self.model_provider == "ollama":
121            # Get dynamic context size for this model
122            context_size, detection_method = get_model_context_size_sync(
123                self.model_name, self.ollama_base_url
124            )
125
126            logger.info(
127                "Using context size %d for model %s (detected via: %s)",
128                context_size,
129                self.model_name,
130                detection_method,
131            )
132
133            # Use standard configuration for other models
134            model_options = {
135                "num_ctx": context_size,  # Use dynamically detected context window
136                "temperature": 0.3,  # Optional: set temperature for consistency
137                "num_predict": -1,  # Allow unlimited prediction length
138                "top_k": 40,
139                "top_p": 0.9,
140                "repeat_penalty": 1.1,
141                "seed": self.seed,
142            }
143
144            # Special handling for qwen models with optimized parameters
145            if "qwen" in self.model_name.lower():
146                logger.info(
147                    "Using optimized configuration for Qwen model: %s",
148                    self.model_name,
149                )
150
151                # Get Qwen settings from configuration
152                try:
153                    qwen_settings = get_qwen_instruct_settings()
154
155                    model_options.update(
156                        {
157                            "num_predict": 32768,  # Set specific prediction length for qwen
158                            "temperature": qwen_settings["temperature"],
159                            "top_k": qwen_settings["top_k"],
160                            "top_p": qwen_settings["top_p"],
161                            "min_p": qwen_settings["min_p"],
162                            "repeat_penalty": 1.1,
163                        }
164                    )
165                except Exception as e:
166                    logger.warning(f"Failed to load Qwen settings, using defaults: {e}")
167                    # Fallback to original hardcoded values
168                    model_options.update(
169                        {
170                            "num_predict": 32768,
171                            "temperature": 0.3,
172                            "top_k": 20,
173                            "top_p": 0.95,
174                            "min_p": 0,
175                            "repeat_penalty": 1.1,
176                        }
177                    )
178
179            if (
180                "llama3.1" in self.model_name.lower()
181                or "llama3.2" in self.model_name.lower()
182                or "llama3.3" in self.model_name.lower()
183            ):
184                logger.info(
185                    "Using optimized configuration for Llama 3.x model: %s",
186                    self.model_name,
187                )
188                model_options.update(
189                    {
190                        "stop": [
191                            "<|start_header_id|>",
192                            "<|end_header_id|>",
193                            "<|eot_id|>",
194                        ],
195                    }
196                )
197
198            # Add reasoning support for compatible models
199            reasoning_models = [
200                "o1",
201                "o1-preview",
202                "o1-mini",  # OpenAI reasoning models
203                "qwen3:8b",
204                "qwen3:1.7b",  # Fixed: lowercase 'b' to match model_contexts.py
205                "qwen3:4b",
206                "qwen3-4b-instruct",  # New Qwen model variants
207                "hf.co/unsloth/qwen3-4b-instruct",  # HuggingFace Qwen model from settings
208                "qwq",  # Qwen reasoning models
209                "deepseek-r1",
210                "deepseek-reasoner",  # DeepSeek reasoning models
211                "llama3.2",
212                "llama3.3",  # Recent Llama models with reasoning
213                "mistral",
214                "mixtral",  # Mistral models with reasoning capabilities
215            ]
216
217            # Check if current model supports reasoning
218            model_supports_reasoning = any(
219                reasoning_model in self.model_name.lower()
220                for reasoning_model in reasoning_models
221            )
222
223            model = Ollama(
224                id=self.model_name,
225                host=self.ollama_base_url,  # Use host parameter for Ollama
226                options=model_options,
227            )
228
229            # WORKAROUND: Fix incorrect role mapping in Agno framework
230            # The default_role_map incorrectly maps "system" -> "developer"
231            # but OpenAI API only accepts: user, assistant, system, tool
232            if hasattr(model, "role_map"):
233                model.role_map = {
234                    "system": "system",  # Fix: should be "system", not "developer"
235                    "user": "user",
236                    "assistant": "assistant",
237                    "tool": "tool",
238                    "model": "assistant",
239                }
240                logger.info(
241                    f"🔧 Applied role mapping fix to Ollama model: {self.model_name}"
242                )
243
244            return model
245        else:
246            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported model provider: {self.model_provider}")

Manages model creation and configuration.

AgentModelManager( model_provider: str, model_name: str, ollama_base_url: str, seed: Optional[int] = None) 
27    def __init__(
28        self,
29        model_provider: str,
30        model_name: str,
31        ollama_base_url: str,
32        seed: Optional[int] = None,
33    ):
34        """Initialize the model manager.
35
36        Args:
37            model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
