 308    # Required by Agno Memory class - model attribute
 309    model: Optional[Model] = Field(default=None)
 310
 311    # Configuration
 312    config: SemanticMemoryManagerConfig = Field(
 313        default_factory=SemanticMemoryManagerConfig
 314    )
 315
 316    # Components
 317    topic_classifier: TopicClassifier = Field(default_factory=TopicClassifier)
 318    duplicate_detector: SemanticDuplicateDetector = Field(default=None)
 319
 320    # State tracking
 321    memories_updated: bool = Field(default=False)
 322
 323    def __init__(
 324        self,
 325        model: Optional[Model] = None,
 326        config: Optional[SemanticMemoryManagerConfig] = None,
 327        similarity_threshold: float = 0.8,
 328        enable_semantic_dedup: bool = True,
 329        enable_exact_dedup: bool = True,
 330        enable_topic_classification: bool = True,
 331        debug_mode: bool = False,
 332    ):
 333        """Initialize the Semantic Memory Manager."""
 334        if config is None:
 335            config = SemanticMemoryManagerConfig(
 336                similarity_threshold=similarity_threshold,
 337                enable_semantic_dedup=enable_semantic_dedup,
 338                enable_exact_dedup=enable_exact_dedup,
 339                enable_topic_classification=enable_topic_classification,
 340                debug_mode=debug_mode,
 341            )
 342
 343        self.model = model  # Required by Agno Memory class
 344        self.config = config
 345
 346        # Get the correct path to topics.yaml
 347        current_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
 348        topics_yaml_path = os.path.join(current_dir, "topics.yaml")
 349
 350        self.topic_classifier = TopicClassifier(config_path=topics_yaml_path)
 351        self.duplicate_detector = SemanticDuplicateDetector(
 352            similarity_threshold=config.similarity_threshold
 353        )
 354        self.memories_updated = False
 355
 356        if self.config.debug_mode:
 357            logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
 358
 359        logger.info(
 360            "Initialized SemanticMemoryManager with similarity_threshold=%.2f",
 361            config.similarity_threshold,
 362        )
 363
 364    def _is_exact_duplicate(
 365        self, new_memory: str, existing_memories: List[UserMemory]
 366    ) -> Optional[UserMemory]:
 367        """Check for exact duplicate memories."""
 368        if not self.config.enable_exact_dedup:
 369            return None
 370
 371        new_memory_clean = new_memory.strip().lower()
 372
 373        for existing in existing_memories:
 374            existing_clean = existing.memory.strip().lower()
 375            if new_memory_clean == existing_clean:
 376                logger.debug("Exact duplicate found: '%s'", new_memory)
 377                return existing
 378
 379        return None
 380
 381    def _is_semantic_duplicate(
 382        self, new_memory: str, existing_memories: List[UserMemory]
 383    ) -> Optional[UserMemory]:
 384        """Check for semantic duplicate memories."""
 385        if not self.config.enable_semantic_dedup:
 386            return None
 387
 388        existing_texts = [mem.memory for mem in existing_memories]
 389        is_dup, best_match, similarity = self.duplicate_detector.is_duplicate(
 390            new_memory, existing_texts
 391        )
 392
 393        if is_dup and best_match:
 394            # Find the matching memory object
 395            for existing in existing_memories:
 396                if existing.memory == best_match:
 397                    logger.debug(
 398                        "Semantic duplicate found (similarity: %.2f): '%s' ~ '%s'",
 399                        similarity,
 400                        new_memory,
 401                        existing.memory,
 402                    )
 403                    return existing
 404
 405        return None
 406
 407    def _should_reject_memory(
 408        self, new_memory: str, existing_memories: List[UserMemory]
 409    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 410        """Determine if a memory should be rejected."""
 411        # Check memory length
 412        if len(new_memory) > self.config.max_memory_length:
 413            return (
 414                True,
 415                f"Memory too long ({len(new_memory)} > {self.config.max_memory_length} chars)",
 416            )
 417
 418        # Check for exact duplicates
 419        exact_duplicate = self._is_exact_duplicate(new_memory, existing_memories)
 420        if exact_duplicate:
 421            return True, f"Exact duplicate of: '{exact_duplicate.memory}'"
 422
 423        # Check for semantic duplicates
 424        semantic_duplicate = self._is_semantic_duplicate(new_memory, existing_memories)
 425        if semantic_duplicate:
 426            return True, f"Semantic duplicate of: '{semantic_duplicate.memory}'"
 427
 428        return False, ""
 429
 430    def _get_recent_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str) -> List[UserMemory]:
 431        """Get recent memories for duplicate checking."""
 432        try:
 433            memory_rows = db.read_memories(
 434                user_id=user_id, limit=self.config.recent_memory_limit, sort="desc"
 435            )
 436
 437            user_memories = []
 438            for row in memory_rows:
 439                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
 440                    try:
 441                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
 442                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
 443                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
 444                        logger.warning(
 445                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
 446                        )
 447
 448            return user_memories
 449        except Exception as e:
 450            logger.error("Error retrieving recent memories: %s", e)
 451            return []
 452
 453    def add_memory(
 454        self,
 455        memory_text: str,
 456        db: MemoryDb,
 457        user_id: str = None,
 458        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
 459        input_text: Optional[str] = None,
 460    ) -> MemoryStorageResult:
 461        """
 462        Add a memory with duplicate detection and topic classification.
 463
 464        :param memory_text: The memory text to add
 465        :param db: Memory database instance
 466        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
 467        :param topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
 468        :param input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
 469        :return: MemoryStorageResult with detailed status information
 470        """
 471        # Get current user ID if not provided
 472        if user_id is None:
 473            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 474            
 475        # Validate input
 476        if not memory_text or not memory_text.strip():
 477            return MemoryStorageResult(
 478                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_EMPTY,
 479                message="Memory content cannot be empty",
 480                local_success=False,
 481                graph_success=False
 482            )
 483
 484        # Get recent memories for duplicate checking
 485        existing_memories = self._get_recent_memories(db, user_id)
 486
 487        # Check memory length
 488        if len(memory_text) > self.config.max_memory_length:
 489            return MemoryStorageResult(
 490                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_TOO_LONG,
 491                message=f"Memory too long ({len(memory_text)} > {self.config.max_memory_length} chars)",
 492                local_success=False,
 493                graph_success=False
 494            )
 495
 496        # Check for exact duplicates
 497        exact_duplicate = self._is_exact_duplicate(memory_text, existing_memories)
 498        if exact_duplicate:
 499            return MemoryStorageResult(
 500                status=MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_EXACT,
 501                message=f"Exact duplicate of: '{exact_duplicate.memory}'",
 502                local_success=False,
 503                graph_success=False,
 504                similarity_score=1.0
 505            )
 506
 507        # Check for semantic duplicates
 508        semantic_duplicate = self._is_semantic_duplicate(memory_text, existing_memories)
 509        if semantic_duplicate:
 510            # Get similarity score for the duplicate
 511            existing_texts = [mem.memory for mem in existing_memories]
 512            _, _, similarity_score = self.duplicate_detector.is_duplicate(memory_text, existing_texts)
 513            
 514            return MemoryStorageResult(
 515                status=MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_SEMANTIC,
 516                message=f"Semantic duplicate of: '{semantic_duplicate.memory}'",
 517                local_success=False,
 518                graph_success=False,
 519                similarity_score=similarity_score
 520            )
 521
 522        # Auto-classify topics if not provided
 523        if topics is None and self.config.enable_topic_classification:
 524            topics = self.topic_classifier.classify(memory_text)
 525
 526        # Create the memory
 527        try:
 528            from uuid import uuid4
 529
 530            memory_id = str(uuid4())
 531            last_updated = datetime.now()
 532
 533            user_memory = UserMemory(
 534                memory_id=memory_id,
 535                memory=memory_text,
 536                topics=topics,
 537                last_updated=last_updated,
 538                input=input_text,
 539            )
 540
 541            memory_row = MemoryRow(
 542                id=memory_id,
 543                user_id=user_id,
 544                memory=user_memory.to_dict(),
 545                last_updated=last_updated,
 546            )
 547
 548            db.upsert_memory(memory_row)
 549
 550            self.memories_updated = True
 551
 552            logger.info(
 553                "Added memory for user %s: '%s' (topics: %s)",
 554                user_id,
 555                memory_text,
 556                topics,
 557            )
 558            if self.config.debug_mode:
 559                print(f"✅ ACCEPTED: '{memory_text}' (topics: {topics})")
 560
 561            return MemoryStorageResult(
 562                status=MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS,
 563                message="Memory added successfully",
 564                memory_id=memory_id,
 565                topics=topics,
 566                local_success=True,
 567                graph_success=False  # Will be updated by the caller for dual storage
 568            )
 569
 570        except Exception as e:
 571            error_msg = f"Error adding memory: {e}"
 572            logger.error(error_msg)
 573            return MemoryStorageResult(
 574                status=MemoryStorageStatus.STORAGE_ERROR,
 575                message=error_msg,
 576                local_success=False,
 577                graph_success=False
 578            )
 579
 580    def update_memory(
 581        self,
 582        memory_id: str,
 583        memory_text: str,
 584        db: MemoryDb,
 585        user_id: str = None,
 586        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
 587        input_text: Optional[str] = None,
 588    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 589        """
 590        Update an existing memory.
 591
 592        :param memory_id: ID of the memory to update
 593        :param memory_text: New memory text
 594        :param db: Memory database instance
 595        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
 596        :param topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
 597        :param input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
 598        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
 599        """
 600        # Get current user ID if not provided
 601        if user_id is None:
 602            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 603            
 604        # Auto-classify topics if not provided
 605        if topics is None and self.config.enable_topic_classification:
 606            topics = self.topic_classifier.classify(memory_text)
 607
 608        try:
 609            last_updated = datetime.now()
 610
 611            user_memory = UserMemory(
 612                memory_id=memory_id,
 613                memory=memory_text,
 614                topics=topics,
 615                last_updated=last_updated,
 616                input=input_text,
 617            )
 618
 619            memory_row = MemoryRow(
 620                id=memory_id,
 621                user_id=user_id,
 622                memory=user_memory.to_dict(),
 623                last_updated=last_updated,
 624            )
 625
 626            db.upsert_memory(memory_row)
 627
 628            self.memories_updated = True
 629
 630            logger.info(
 631                "Updated memory %s for user %s: '%s'", memory_id, user_id, memory_text
 632            )
 633            if self.config.debug_mode:
 634                print(f"🔄 UPDATED: '{memory_text}' (topics: {topics})")
 635
 636            return True, "Memory updated successfully"
 637
 638        except Exception as e:
 639            error_msg = f"Error updating memory: {e}"
 640            logger.error(error_msg)
 641            return False, error_msg
 642
 643    def delete_memory(
 644        self, memory_id: str, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None
 645    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 646        """
 647        Delete a memory.
 648
 649        :param memory_id: ID of the memory to delete
 650        :param db: Memory database instance
 651        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
 652        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
 653        """
 654        try:
 655            # Get current user ID if not provided
 656            if user_id is None:
 657                user_id = get_current_user_id()
 658                
 659            # First check if the memory exists
 660            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
 661            memory_exists = False
 662            for row in memory_rows:
 663                if row.id == memory_id and row.user_id == user_id:
 664                    memory_exists = True
 665                    break
 666            
 667            if not memory_exists:
 668                logger.warning("Memory %s not found for user %s", memory_id, user_id)
 669                return False, f"Memory {memory_id} not found"
 670            
 671            # Delete the memory
 672            db.delete_memory(memory_id)
 673
 674            self.memories_updated = True
 675
 676            logger.info("Deleted memory %s for user %s", memory_id, user_id)
 677            if self.config.debug_mode:
 678                print(f"🗑️ DELETED: {memory_id}")
 679
 680            return True, f"Memory {memory_id} deleted successfully"
 681
 682        except Exception as e:
 683            error_msg = f"Error deleting memory {memory_id}: {e}"
 684            logger.error(error_msg)
 685            return False, error_msg
 686
 687    def delete_memories_by_topic(
 688        self, topics: List[str], db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None
 689    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 690        """
 691        Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics.
 692
 693        :param topics: A list of topics to delete memories for.
 694        :param db: Memory database instance.
 695        :param user_id: User ID for the memories.
 696        :return: Tuple of (success, message).
 697        """
 698        # Get current user ID if not provided
 699        if user_id is None:
 700            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 701            
 702        if not topics:
 703            return False, "No topics provided for deletion."
 704
 705        try:
 706            # Get all memories for the specified topics
 707            memories_to_delete = self.get_memories_by_topic(
 708                db=db, user_id=user_id, topics=topics
 709            )
 710
 711            if not memories_to_delete:
 712                return (
 713                    True,
 714                    f"No memories found for topics: {', '.join(topics)}.",
 715                )
 716
 717            deleted_count = 0
 718            for memory in memories_to_delete:
 719                success, _ = self.delete_memory(
 720                    memory_id=memory.memory_id, db=db, user_id=user_id
 721                )
 722                if success:
 723                    deleted_count += 1
 724
 725            self.memories_updated = True
 726
 727            logger.info(
 728                "Deleted %d memories for topics '%s' for user %s",
 729                deleted_count,
 730                ", ".join(topics),
 731                user_id,
 732            )
 733            if self.config.debug_mode:
 734                print(
 735                    f"🗑️ DELETED BY TOPIC: {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}"
 736                )
 737
 738            return (
 739                True,
 740                f"Successfully deleted {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}.",
 741            )
 742
 743        except Exception as e:
 744            error_msg = f"Error deleting memories by topic: {e}"
 745            logger.error(error_msg)
 746            return False, error_msg
 747
 748    def clear_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 749        """
 750        Clear all memories for a user.
 751
 752        :param db: Memory database instance
 753        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
 754        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
 755        """
 756        # Get current user ID if not provided
 757        if user_id is None:
 758            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 759            
 760        try:
 761            # Get all memories for the user first
 762            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
 763
 764            # Delete each memory
 765            for row in memory_rows:
 766                if row.user_id == user_id:
 767                    db.delete_memory(row.id)
 768
 769            self.memories_updated = True
 770
 771            logger.info("Cleared all memories for user %s", user_id)
 772            if self.config.debug_mode:
 773                print(f"🧹 CLEARED: All memories for user {user_id}")
 774
 775            return True, f"Cleared {len(memory_rows)} memories successfully"
 776
 777        except Exception as e:
 778            error_msg = f"Error clearing memories: {e}"
 779            logger.error(error_msg)
 780            return False, error_msg
 781
 782    def search_memories(
 783        self,
 784        query: str,
 785        db: MemoryDb,
 786        user_id: str = None,
 787        limit: int = None,
 788        similarity_threshold: float = 0.3,
 789        search_topics: bool = True,
 790        topic_boost: float = 0.5,
 791    ) -> List[Tuple[UserMemory, float]]:
 792        """
 793        Search memories using semantic similarity and topic matching with enhanced query expansion.
 794
 795        :param query: Search query
 796        :param db: Memory database instance
 797        :param user_id: User ID to search within
 798        :param limit: Maximum number of results
 799        :param similarity_threshold: Minimum similarity threshold for content
 800        :param search_topics: Whether to include topic search (default: True)
 801        :param topic_boost: Score boost for topic matches (default: 0.5)
 802        :return: List of (UserMemory, combined_score) tuples
 803        """
 804        import time
 805        
 806        # LATENCY DEBUG: Start timing memory search
 807        search_start_time = time.perf_counter()
 808        logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Starting search_memories for query: %s", query[:50])
 809        
 810        # Get current user ID if not provided
 811        if user_id is None:
 812            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 813            
 814        try:
 815            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time query expansion
 816            expand_start = time.perf_counter()
 817            expanded_queries = self._expand_query(query)
 818            expand_time = time.perf_counter() - expand_start
 819            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Query expansion took %.3f seconds (%d queries)", expand_time, len(expanded_queries))
 820
 821            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time database read
 822            db_start = time.perf_counter()
 823            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
 824            db_time = time.perf_counter() - db_start
 825            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Database read took %.3f seconds (%d rows)", db_time, len(memory_rows))
 826
 827            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time memory conversion
 828            convert_start = time.perf_counter()
 829            user_memories = []
 830            for row in memory_rows:
 831                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
 832                    try:
 833                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
 834                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
 835                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
 836                        logger.warning(
 837                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
 838                        )
 839            convert_time = time.perf_counter() - convert_start
 840            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Memory conversion took %.3f seconds (%d memories)", convert_time, len(user_memories))
 841
 842            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time similarity calculations
 843            similarity_start = time.perf_counter()
 844            results = []
 845            query_lower = query.lower().strip()
 846
 847            for memory in user_memories:
 848                max_similarity = 0.0
 849                best_query = query
 850
 851                # Test original query and all expanded queries
 852                for test_query in expanded_queries:
 853                    content_similarity = (
 854                        self.duplicate_detector._calculate_semantic_similarity(
 855                            test_query, memory.memory
 856                        )
 857                    )
 858                    if content_similarity > max_similarity:
 859                        max_similarity = content_similarity
 860                        best_query = test_query
 861
 862                # Topic matching with enhanced search
 863                topic_score = 0.0
 864                topic_matches = []
 865
 866                if search_topics and memory.topics:
 867                    for topic in memory.topics:
 868                        # Check original query and expanded queries against topics
 869                        for test_query in expanded_queries:
 870                            test_query_lower = test_query.lower()
 871                            if (
 872                                test_query_lower in topic.lower()
 873                                or topic.lower() in test_query_lower
 874                            ):
 875                                if test_query_lower == topic.lower():
 876                                    topic_score = 1.0  # Exact topic match
 877                                    topic_matches.append(topic)
 878                                    break
 879                                else:
 880                                    topic_score = max(
 881                                        topic_score, 0.8
 882                                    )  # Partial topic match
 883                                    topic_matches.append(topic)
 884
 885                # Enhanced keyword matching for work-related queries
 886                keyword_score = self._calculate_keyword_score(
 887                    expanded_queries, memory.memory
 888                )
 889
 890                # Combined scoring: use the best of content similarity, topic match, or keyword match
 891                final_score = max(
 892                    max_similarity, topic_score * topic_boost, keyword_score
 893                )
 894
 895                if (
 896                    final_score >= similarity_threshold
 897                    or topic_score > 0
 898                    or keyword_score > 0.4
 899                ):
 900                    results.append((memory, final_score))
 901
 902                    if self.config.debug_mode and (
 903                        topic_matches or keyword_score > 0.4
 904                    ):
 905                        logger.debug(
 906                            "Enhanced match for query '%s': memory='%s', topics=%s, final_score=%.3f (content=%.3f, topic=%.3f, keyword=%.3f)",
 907                            query,
 908                            memory.memory[:50],
 909                            topic_matches,
 910                            final_score,
 911                            max_similarity,
 912                            topic_score,
 913                            keyword_score,
 914                        )
 915
 916            similarity_time = time.perf_counter() - similarity_start
 917            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Similarity calculations took %.3f seconds (%d memories processed)", similarity_time, len(user_memories))
 918
 919            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time sorting
 920            sort_start = time.perf_counter()
 921            results.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
 922            sort_time = time.perf_counter() - sort_start
 923            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Sorting took %.3f seconds", sort_time)
 924
 925            # LATENCY DEBUG: Total timing
 926            total_time = time.perf_counter() - search_start_time
 927            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Total search_memories time: %.3f seconds (expand: %.3f, db: %.3f, convert: %.3f, similarity: %.3f, sort: %.3f)",
 928                       total_time, expand_time, db_time, convert_time, similarity_time, sort_time)
 929
 930            return results[:limit]
 931
 932        except Exception as e:
 933            logger.error("Error searching memories: %s", e)
 934            return []
 935
 936    def get_memories_by_topic(
 937        self,
 938        db: MemoryDb,
 939        user_id: str = None,
 940        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
 941        limit: Optional[int] = None,
 942    ) -> List[UserMemory]:
 943        """
 944        Get memories filtered by a list of topics, without similarity search.
 945
 946        :param db: Memory database instance
 947        :param user_id: User ID to search within
 948        :param topics: Optional list of topics to filter by. If None, returns all memories.
 949        :param limit: Maximum number of results to return
 950        :return: List of UserMemory objects matching the topics.
 951        """
 952        # Get current user ID if not provided
 953        if user_id is None:
 954            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 955            
 956        try:
 957            # Get all memories for the user
 958            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id, sort="desc")
 959
 960            user_memories = []
 961            for row in memory_rows:
 962                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
 963                    try:
 964                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
 965                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
 966                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
 967                        logger.warning(
 968                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
 969                        )
 970
 971            if not topics:
 972                # If no topics are specified, return all memories up to the limit
 973                return user_memories[:limit]
 974
 975            # Filter memories by the given topics
 976            filtered_memories = []
 977            topic_set = {t.lower() for t in topics}
 978            for memory in user_memories:
 979                if memory.topics and any(
 980                    t.lower() in topic_set for t in memory.topics
 981                ):
 982                    filtered_memories.append(memory)
 983
 984            # Sort by date (already sorted by read_memories) and limit
 985            return filtered_memories[:limit]
 986
 987        except Exception as e:
 988            logger.error("Error getting memories by topic: %s", e)
 989            return []
 990
 991    def _expand_query(self, query: str) -> List[str]:
 992        """
 993        Expand query with synonyms and related terms for better semantic matching.
 994
 995        :param query: Original search query
 996        :return: List of expanded queries including the original
 997        """
 998        query_lower = query.lower().strip()
 999        expanded = [query]  # Always include original query
1000
1001        # Work-related expansions
1002        work_synonyms = {
1003            "work": [
1004                "job",
1005                "employment",
1006                "career",
1007                "occupation",
1008                "position",
1009                "company",
1010                "employer",
1011                "workplace",
1012            ],
1013            "workplace": ["work", "job", "office", "company", "employer", "business"],
1014            "job": ["work", "employment", "career", "position", "occupation", "role"],
1015            "company": ["employer", "business", "organization", "workplace", "firm"],
1016            "career": ["job", "work", "profession", "occupation", "employment"],
1017        }
1018
1019        # Education-related expansions
1020        education_synonyms = {
1021            "school": ["university", "college", "education", "academic", "institution"],
1022            "university": ["college", "school", "education", "academic", "institution"],
1023            "degree": ["education", "qualification", "diploma", "certification"],
1024            "study": ["education", "learning", "academic", "school", "university"],
1025        }
1026
1027        # Personal-related expansions
1028        personal_synonyms = {
1029            "hobby": ["interest", "activity", "pastime", "recreation", "leisure"],
1030            "interest": ["hobby", "passion", "activity", "like", "enjoy"],
1031            "like": ["enjoy", "prefer", "love", "interest", "hobby"],
1032            "preference": ["like", "prefer", "choice", "favorite"],
1033        }
1034
1035        # Combine all synonym dictionaries
1036        all_synonyms = {**work_synonyms, **education_synonyms, **personal_synonyms}
1037
1038        # Add synonyms for words in the query
1039        query_words = query_lower.split()
1040        for word in query_words:
1041            if word in all_synonyms:
1042                for synonym in all_synonyms[word]:
1043                    # Create expanded queries by replacing the word with synonyms
1044                    expanded_query = query_lower.replace(word, synonym)
1045                    if expanded_query not in expanded:
1046                        expanded.append(expanded_query)
1047
1048                    # Also add just the synonym
1049                    if synonym not in expanded:
1050                        expanded.append(synonym)
1051
1052        return expanded
1053
1054    def _calculate_keyword_score(self, queries: List[str], memory_text: str) -> float:
1055        """
1056        Calculate keyword-based similarity score for enhanced matching.
1057
1058        :param queries: List of query variations to test
1059        :param memory_text: Memory text to search in
1060        :return: Keyword similarity score (0.0 to 1.0)
1061        """
1062        memory_lower = memory_text.lower()
1063        max_score = 0.0
1064
1065        for query in queries:
1066            query_words = query.lower().split()
1067            if not query_words:
1068                continue
1069
1070            matches = 0
1071            for word in query_words:
1072                if (
1073                    len(word) > 2 and word in memory_lower
1074                ):  # Only count words longer than 2 chars
1075                    matches += 1
1076
1077            if query_words:
1078                score = matches / len(query_words)
1079                max_score = max(max_score, score)
1080
1081        return max_score
1082
1083    def get_all_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> List[UserMemory]:
1084        """
1085        Get all memories for a user.
1086
1087        :param db: Memory database instance
1088        :param user_id: User ID to retrieve memories for
1089        :return: List of UserMemory objects
1090        """
1091        # Get current user ID if not provided
1092        if user_id is None:
1093            user_id = get_current_user_id()
1094            
1095        try:
1096            # Get all memories for the user
1097            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id, sort="desc")
1098
1099            user_memories = []
1100            for row in memory_rows:
1101                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
1102                    try:
1103                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
1104                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
1105                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
1106                        logger.warning(
1107                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
1108                        )
1109
1110            logger.info("Retrieved %d memories for user %s", len(user_memories), user_id)
1111            return user_memories
1112
1113        except Exception as e:
1114            logger.error("Error retrieving all memories: %s", e)
1115            return []
1116
1117    def get_memory_stats(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1118        """
1119        Get statistics about memories for a user.
1120
1121        :param db: Memory database instance
1122        :param user_id: User ID to analyze
1123        :return: Dictionary with memory statistics
1124        """
1125        # Get current user ID if not provided
1126        if user_id is None:
1127            user_id = get_current_user_id()
1128            
1129        try:
1130            memories = self._get_recent_memories(db, user_id)
1131
1132            if not memories:
1133                return {"total_memories": 0}
1134
1135            # Topic distribution
1136            topic_counts = {}
1137            for memory in memories:
1138                if memory.topics:
1139                    for topic in memory.topics:
1140                        topic_counts[topic] = topic_counts.get(topic, 0) + 1
1141
1142            # Average memory length
1143            avg_length = sum(len(m.memory) for m in memories) / len(memories)
1144
1145            # Recent activity (memories in last 24 hours)
1146            recent_count = 0
1147            if memories:
1148                cutoff = datetime.now().replace(
1149                    hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0
1150                )
1151                for memory in memories:
1152                    if memory.last_updated and memory.last_updated >= cutoff:
1153                        recent_count += 1
1154
1155            return {
1156                "total_memories": len(memories),
1157                "topic_distribution": topic_counts,
1158                "average_memory_length": avg_length,
1159                "recent_memories_24h": recent_count,
1160                "most_common_topic": (
1161                    max(topic_counts.items(), key=lambda x: x[1])[0]
1162                    if topic_counts
1163                    else None
1164                ),
1165            }
1166
1167        except Exception as e:
1168            logger.error("Error getting memory stats: %s", e)
1169            return {"error": str(e)}
1170
1171    def process_input(
1172        self,
1173        input_text: str,
1174        db: MemoryDb,
1175        user_id: str = None,
1176        extract_multiple: bool = True,
1177    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1178        """
1179        Process input text and extract memories without using LLM.
1180
1181        This method uses simple heuristics to determine if the input contains
1182        memorable information and extracts it accordingly.
1183
1184        :param input_text: Input text to process
1185        :param db: Memory database instance
1186        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
1187        :param extract_multiple: Whether to try extracting multiple memories from input
1188        :return: Dictionary with processing results
1189        """
1190        results = {
1191            "memories_added": [],
1192            "memories_rejected": [],
1193            "total_processed": 0,
1194            "success": True,
1195            "message": "Processing completed",
1196        }
1197
1198        try:
1199            # Simple heuristics to extract memorable statements
1200            memorable_statements = self._extract_memorable_statements(input_text)
1201
1202            for statement in memorable_statements:
1203                result = self.add_memory(
1204                    memory_text=statement,
1205                    db=db,
1206                    user_id=user_id,
1207                    input_text=input_text,
1208                )
1209
1210                results["total_processed"] += 1
1211
1212                if result.is_success:
1213                    results["memories_added"].append(
1214                        {
1215                            "memory_id": result.memory_id,
1216                            "memory": statement,
1217                            "topics": result.topics,
1218                        }
1219                    )
1220                else:
1221                    results["memories_rejected"].append(
1222                        {"memory": statement, "reason": result.message}
1223                    )
1224
1225            if results["memories_added"]:
1226                self.memories_updated = True
1227
1228        except Exception as e:
1229            results["success"] = False
1230            results["message"] = f"Error processing input: {e}"
1231            logger.error("Error processing input: %s", e)
1232
1233        return results
1234
1235    def create_or_update_memories(
1236        self,
1237        messages: List,  # List[Message] from agno.models.message
1238        existing_memories: List[Dict[str, Any]],
1239        user_id: str,
1240        db: MemoryDb,
1241        delete_memories: bool = True,
1242        clear_memories: bool = True,
1243    ) -> str:
1244        """
1245        Create or update memories based on messages - LLM-free implementation.
1246
1247        This method provides the same interface as Agno's MemoryManager but uses
1248        semantic analysis instead of LLM calls for better performance and reliability.
1249
1250        :param messages: List of Message objects to process
1251        :param existing_memories: List of existing memory dictionaries
1252        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
1253        :param db: Memory database instance
1254        :param delete_memories: Whether deletion is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1255        :param clear_memories: Whether clearing is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1256        :return: String describing the actions taken
1257        """
1258        logger.debug("SemanticMemoryManager.create_or_update_memories Start")
1259
1260        # Create a simple memory class for duplicate checking
1261        class SimpleMemory:
1262            def __init__(self, memory_text: str, memory_id: str = ""):
1263                self.memory = memory_text
1264                self.memory_id = memory_id
1265
1266        # Convert existing memories to UserMemory objects for our processing
1267        existing_user_memories = []
1268        for mem_dict in existing_memories:
1269            try:
1270                # Create a UserMemory-like object for our duplicate detection
1271                memory_text = mem_dict.get("memory", "")
1272                if memory_text:
1273                    existing_user_memories.append(
1274                        SimpleMemory(memory_text, mem_dict.get("memory_id", ""))
1275                    )
1276            except Exception as e:
1277                logger.warning(f"Failed to process existing memory: {e}")
1278
1279        # Extract text content from messages
1280        message_texts = []
1281        for message in messages:
1282            if hasattr(message, "content") and message.content:
1283                if hasattr(message, "role") and message.role == "user":
1284                    # Only process user messages for memory extraction
1285                    message_texts.append(str(message.content))
1286            elif hasattr(message, "get_content_string"):
1287                # Use agno's method to get content
1288                content = message.get_content_string()
1289                if content and hasattr(message, "role") and message.role == "user":
1290                    message_texts.append(content)
1291
1292        if not message_texts:
1293            logger.debug("No user messages found to process")
1294            return "No user messages to process for memory creation"
1295
1296        # Combine all message texts
1297        combined_input = " ".join(message_texts)
1298
1299        # Extract memorable statements
1300        memorable_statements = self._extract_memorable_statements(combined_input)
1301
1302        if not memorable_statements:
1303            logger.debug("No memorable statements found in messages")
1304            return "No memorable information found in the messages"
1305
1306        # Process each memorable statement
1307        actions_taken = []
1308        memories_added = 0
1309        memories_rejected = 0
1310
1311        for statement in memorable_statements:
1312            # Check for duplicates against existing memories
1313            should_reject, reason = self._should_reject_memory(
1314                statement, existing_user_memories
1315            )
1316
1317            if should_reject:
1318                memories_rejected += 1
1319                actions_taken.append(f"Rejected: '{statement[:50]}...' - {reason}")
1320                logger.debug(f"Rejected memory: {reason}")
1321                continue
1322
1323            # Add the memory
1324            result = self.add_memory(
1325                memory_text=statement,
1326                db=db,
1327                user_id=user_id,
1328                input_text=combined_input,
1329            )
1330
1331            if result.is_success:
1332                memories_added += 1
1333                actions_taken.append(f"Added: '{statement[:50]}...'")
1334                logger.debug(f"Added memory: {result.memory_id}")
1335
1336                # Add to existing memories list for subsequent duplicate checking
1337                existing_user_memories.append(SimpleMemory(statement, result.memory_id or ""))
1338            else:
1339                memories_rejected += 1
1340                actions_taken.append(
1341                    f"Failed to add: '{statement[:50]}...' - {result.message}"
1342                )
1343                logger.warning(f"Failed to add memory: {result.message}")
1344
1345        # Set memories_updated flag if any memories were added
1346        if memories_added > 0:
1347            self.memories_updated = True
1348
1349        # Create response summary
1350        response_parts = [
1351            f"Processed {len(memorable_statements)} memorable statements",
1352            f"Added {memories_added} new memories",
1353            f"Rejected {memories_rejected} duplicates/invalid memories",
1354        ]
1355
1356        if self.config.debug_mode and actions_taken:
1357            response_parts.append("Actions taken:")
1358            response_parts.extend(actions_taken[:5])  # Limit to first 5 actions
1359            if len(actions_taken) > 5:
1360                response_parts.append(f"... and {len(actions_taken) - 5} more actions")
1361
1362        response = ". ".join(response_parts)
1363        logger.debug("SemanticMemoryManager.create_or_update_memories End")
1364
1365        return response
1366
1367    async def acreate_or_update_memories(
1368        self,
1369        messages: List,  # List[Message] from agno.models.message
1370        existing_memories: List[Dict[str, Any]],
1371        user_id: str,
1372        db: MemoryDb,
1373        delete_memories: bool = True,
1374        clear_memories: bool = True,
1375    ) -> str:
1376        """
1377        Async version of create_or_update_memories.
1378
1379        Since our implementation doesn't use async operations, this just calls
1380        the sync version. This maintains compatibility with Agno's async interface.
1381        """
1382        return self.create_or_update_memories(
1383            messages=messages,
1384            existing_memories=existing_memories,
1385            user_id=user_id,
1386            db=db,
1387            delete_memories=delete_memories,
1388            clear_memories=clear_memories,
1389        )
1390
1391    def run_memory_task(
1392        self,
1393        task: str,
1394        existing_memories: List[Dict[str, Any]],
1395        user_id: str,
1396        db: MemoryDb,
1397        delete_memories: bool = True,
1398        clear_memories: bool = True,
1399    ) -> str:
1400        """
1401        Process a memory task without using LLM.
1402
1403        This method provides the same interface as Agno's MemoryManager.run_memory_task
1404        but uses semantic analysis instead of LLM calls for better performance and reliability.
1405
1406        :param task: The task/input text to process for memory extraction
1407        :param existing_memories: List of existing memory dictionaries
1408        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
1409        :param db: Memory database instance
1410        :param delete_memories: Whether deletion is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1411        :param clear_memories: Whether clearing is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1412        :return: String describing the actions taken
1413        """
1414        logger.debug("SemanticMemoryManager.run_memory_task Start")
1415
1416        try:
1417            # Extract memorable statements from the task
1418            memorable_statements = self._extract_memorable_statements(task)
1419
1420            if not memorable_statements:
1421                logger.debug("No memorable statements found in task")
1422                return "No memorable information found in the task"
1423
1424            # Convert existing memories to UserMemory-like objects for duplicate checking
1425            class SimpleMemory:
1426                def __init__(self, memory_text: str, memory_id: str = ""):
1427                    self.memory = memory_text
1428                    self.memory_id = memory_id
1429
1430            existing_user_memories = []
1431            for mem_dict in existing_memories:
1432                try:
1433                    memory_text = mem_dict.get("memory", "")
1434                    if memory_text:
1435                        existing_user_memories.append(
1436                            SimpleMemory(memory_text, mem_dict.get("memory_id", ""))
1437                        )
1438                except Exception as e:
1439                    logger.warning(f"Failed to process existing memory: {e}")
1440
1441            # Process each memorable statement
1442            actions_taken = []
1443            memories_added = 0
1444            memories_rejected = 0
1445
1446            for statement in memorable_statements:
1447                # Check for duplicates against existing memories
1448                should_reject, reason = self._should_reject_memory(
1449                    statement, existing_user_memories
1450                )
1451
1452                if should_reject:
1453                    memories_rejected += 1
1454                    actions_taken.append(f"Rejected: '{statement[:50]}...' - {reason}")
1455                    logger.debug(f"Rejected memory: {reason}")
1456                    continue
1457
1458                # Add the memory
1459                result = self.add_memory(
1460                    memory_text=statement,
1461                    db=db,
1462                    user_id=user_id,
1463                    input_text=task,
1464                )
1465
1466                if result.is_success:
1467                    memories_added += 1
1468                    actions_taken.append(f"Added: '{statement[:50]}...'")
1469                    logger.debug(f"Added memory: {result.memory_id}")
1470
1471                    # Add to existing memories list for subsequent duplicate checking
1472                    existing_user_memories.append(
1473                        SimpleMemory(statement, result.memory_id or "")
1474                    )
1475                else:
1476                    memories_rejected += 1
1477                    actions_taken.append(
1478                        f"Failed to add: '{statement[:50]}...' - {result.message}"
1479                    )
1480                    logger.warning(f"Failed to add memory: {result.message}")
1481
1482            # Set memories_updated flag if any memories were added
1483            if memories_added > 0:
1484                self.memories_updated = True
1485
1486            # Create response summary
1487            response_parts = [
1488                f"Processed {len(memorable_statements)} memorable statements",
1489                f"Added {memories_added} new memories",
1490                f"Rejected {memories_rejected} duplicates/invalid memories",
1491            ]
1492
1493            if self.config.debug_mode and actions_taken:
1494                response_parts.append("Actions taken:")
1495                response_parts.extend(actions_taken[:5])  # Limit to first 5 actions
1496                if len(actions_taken) > 5:
1497                    response_parts.append(
1498                        f"... and {len(actions_taken) - 5} more actions"
1499                    )
1500
1501            response = ". ".join(response_parts)
1502            logger.debug("SemanticMemoryManager.run_memory_task End")
1503
1504            return response
1505
1506        except Exception as e:
1507            error_msg = f"Error in run_memory_task: {e}"
1508            logger.error(error_msg)
1509            return error_msg
1510
1511    async def arun_memory_task(
1512        self,
1513        task: str,
1514        existing_memories: List[Dict[str, Any]],
1515        user_id: str,
1516        db: MemoryDb,
1517        delete_memories: bool = True,
1518        clear_memories: bool = True,
1519    ) -> str:
1520        """
1521        Async version of run_memory_task.
1522
1523        Since our implementation doesn't use async operations, this just calls
1524        the sync version. This maintains compatibility with Agno's async interface.
1525
1526        :param task: The task/input text to process for memory extraction
1527        :param existing_memories: List of existing memory dictionaries
1528        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
1529        :param db: Memory database instance
1530        :param delete_memories: Whether deletion is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1531        :param clear_memories: Whether clearing is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1532        :return: String describing the actions taken
1533        """
1534        return self.run_memory_task(
1535            task=task,
1536            existing_memories=existing_memories,
1537            user_id=user_id,
1538            db=db,
1539            delete_memories=delete_memories,
1540            clear_memories=clear_memories,
1541        )
1542
1543    def _extract_memorable_statements(self, text: str) -> List[str]:
1544        """
1545        Extract memorable statements from text using simple heuristics.
1546
1547        :param text: Input text
1548        :return: List of memorable statements
1549        """
1550        statements = []
1551
1552        # Split by sentences
1553        sentences = re.split(r"[.!?]+", text)
1554
1555        # Patterns that indicate memorable information
1556        memorable_patterns = [
1557            r"\bi am\b",
1558            r"\bmy name is\b",
1559            r"\bi work\b",
1560            r"\bi live\b",
1561            r"\bi like\b",
1562            r"\bi love\b",
1563            r"\bi hate\b",
1564            r"\bi prefer\b",
1565            r"\bi have\b",
1566            r"\bi study\b",
1567            r"\bi graduated\b",
1568            r"\bmy favorite\b",
1569            r"\bmy goal\b",
1570            r"\bi want to\b",
1571            r"\bi plan to\b",
1572        ]
1573
1574        for sentence in sentences:
1575            sentence = sentence.strip()
1576            if len(sentence) < 10:  # Skip very short sentences
1577                continue
1578
1579            # Check if sentence contains memorable patterns
1580            for pattern in memorable_patterns:
1581                if re.search(pattern, sentence, re.IGNORECASE):
1582                    statements.append(sentence)
1583                    break
1584
1585        return statements

Semantic Memory Manager that provides LLM-free memory management.

This manager combines the structure of Agno's MemoryManager with semantic search and duplicate detection capabilities, without requiring LLM invocation.

SemanticMemoryManager( model: Optional[agno.models.base.Model] = None, config: Optional[SemanticMemoryManagerConfig] = None, similarity_threshold: float = 0.8, enable_semantic_dedup: bool = True, enable_exact_dedup: bool = True, enable_topic_classification: bool = True, debug_mode: bool = False) 
323    def __init__(
324        self,
325        model: Optional[Model] = None,
326        config: Optional[SemanticMemoryManagerConfig] = None,
327        similarity_threshold: float = 0.8,
328        enable_semantic_dedup: bool = True,
329        enable_exact_dedup: bool = True,
330        enable_topic_classification: bool = True,
331        debug_mode: bool = False,
332    ):
333        """Initialize the Semantic Memory Manager."""
334        if config is None:
335            config = SemanticMemoryManagerConfig(
336                similarity_threshold=similarity_threshold,
337                enable_semantic_dedup=enable_semantic_dedup,
338                enable_exact_dedup=enable_exact_dedup,
339                enable_topic_classification=enable_topic_classification,
340                debug_mode=debug_mode,
341            )
342
343        self.model = model  # Required by Agno Memory class
344        self.config = config
345
346        # Get the correct path to topics.yaml
347        current_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
348        topics_yaml_path = os.path.join(current_dir, "topics.yaml")
349
350        self.topic_classifier = TopicClassifier(config_path=topics_yaml_path)
351        self.duplicate_detector = SemanticDuplicateDetector(
352            similarity_threshold=config.similarity_threshold
353        )
354        self.memories_updated = False
355
356        if self.config.debug_mode:
357            logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
358
359        logger.info(
360            "Initialized SemanticMemoryManager with similarity_threshold=%.2f",
361            config.similarity_threshold,
362        )

Initialize the Semantic Memory Manager.

model: Optional[agno.models.base.Model] = FieldInfo(annotation=NoneType, required=False, default=None)
config: SemanticMemoryManagerConfig = FieldInfo(annotation=NoneType, required=False, default_factory=SemanticMemoryManagerConfig)
topic_classifier: TopicClassifier = FieldInfo(annotation=NoneType, required=False, default_factory=TopicClassifier)
duplicate_detector: SemanticDuplicateDetector = FieldInfo(annotation=NoneType, required=False, default=None)
memories_updated: bool = FieldInfo(annotation=NoneType, required=False, default=False)
def add_memory( self, memory_text: str, db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None, topics: Optional[List[str]] = None, input_text: Optional[str] = None) -> personal_agent.core.semantic_memory_manager.MemoryStorageResult: 
453    def add_memory(
454        self,
455        memory_text: str,
456        db: MemoryDb,
457        user_id: str = None,
458        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
459        input_text: Optional[str] = None,
460    ) -> MemoryStorageResult:
461        """
462        Add a memory with duplicate detection and topic classification.
463
464        :param memory_text: The memory text to add
465        :param db: Memory database instance
466        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
467        :param topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
468        :param input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
469        :return: MemoryStorageResult with detailed status information
470        """
471        # Get current user ID if not provided
472        if user_id is None:
473            user_id = get_current_user_id()
474            
475        # Validate input
476        if not memory_text or not memory_text.strip():
477            return MemoryStorageResult(
478                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_EMPTY,
479                message="Memory content cannot be empty",
480                local_success=False,
481                graph_success=False
482            )
483
484        # Get recent memories for duplicate checking
485        existing_memories = self._get_recent_memories(db, user_id)
486
487        # Check memory length
488        if len(memory_text) > self.config.max_memory_length:
489            return MemoryStorageResult(
490                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_TOO_LONG,
491                message=f"Memory too long ({len(memory_text)} > {self.config.max_memory_length} chars)",
492                local_success=False,
493                graph_success=False
494            )
495
496        # Check for exact duplicates
497        exact_duplicate = self._is_exact_duplicate(memory_text, existing_memories)
498        if exact_duplicate:
499            return MemoryStorageResult(
500                status=MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_EXACT,
501                message=f"Exact duplicate of: '{exact_duplicate.memory}'",
502                local_success=False,
503                graph_success=False,
504                similarity_score=1.0
505            )
506
507        # Check for semantic duplicates
508        semantic_duplicate = self._is_semantic_duplicate(memory_text, existing_memories)
509        if semantic_duplicate:
510            # Get similarity score for the duplicate
511            existing_texts = [mem.memory for mem in existing_memories]
512            _, _, similarity_score = self.duplicate_detector.is_duplicate(memory_text, existing_texts)
513            
514            return MemoryStorageResult(
515                status=MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_SEMANTIC,
516                message=f"Semantic duplicate of: '{semantic_duplicate.memory}'",
517                local_success=False,
518                graph_success=False,
519                similarity_score=similarity_score
520            )
521
522        # Auto-classify topics if not provided
523        if topics is None and self.config.enable_topic_classification:
524            topics = self.topic_classifier.classify(memory_text)
525
526        # Create the memory
527        try:
528            from uuid import uuid4
529
530            memory_id = str(uuid4())
531            last_updated = datetime.now()
532
533            user_memory = UserMemory(
534                memory_id=memory_id,
535                memory=memory_text,
536                topics=topics,
537                last_updated=last_updated,
538                input=input_text,
539            )
540
541            memory_row = MemoryRow(
542                id=memory_id,
543                user_id=user_id,
544                memory=user_memory.to_dict(),
545                last_updated=last_updated,
546            )
547
548            db.upsert_memory(memory_row)
549
550            self.memories_updated = True
551
552            logger.info(
553                "Added memory for user %s: '%s' (topics: %s)",
554                user_id,
555                memory_text,
556                topics,
557            )
558            if self.config.debug_mode:
559                print(f"✅ ACCEPTED: '{memory_text}' (topics: {topics})")
560
561            return MemoryStorageResult(
562                status=MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS,
563                message="Memory added successfully",
564                memory_id=memory_id,
565                topics=topics,
566                local_success=True,
567                graph_success=False  # Will be updated by the caller for dual storage
568            )
569
570        except Exception as e:
571            error_msg = f"Error adding memory: {e}"
572            logger.error(error_msg)
573            return MemoryStorageResult(
574                status=MemoryStorageStatus.STORAGE_ERROR,
575                message=error_msg,
576                local_success=False,
577                graph_success=False
578            )

Add a memory with duplicate detection and topic classification.

Parameters
  • memory_text: The memory text to add
  • db: Memory database instance
  • user_id: User ID for the memory
  • topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
  • input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
Returns

MemoryStorageResult with detailed status information

def update_memory( self, memory_id: str, memory_text: str, db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None, topics: Optional[List[str]] = None, input_text: Optional[str] = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
580    def update_memory(
581        self,
582        memory_id: str,
583        memory_text: str,
584        db: MemoryDb,
585        user_id: str = None,
586        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
587        input_text: Optional[str] = None,
588    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
589        """
590        Update an existing memory.
591
592        :param memory_id: ID of the memory to update
593        :param memory_text: New memory text
594        :param db: Memory database instance
595        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
596        :param topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
597        :param input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
598        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
599        """
600        # Get current user ID if not provided
601        if user_id is None:
602            user_id = get_current_user_id()
603            
604        # Auto-classify topics if not provided
605        if topics is None and self.config.enable_topic_classification:
606            topics = self.topic_classifier.classify(memory_text)
607
608        try:
609            last_updated = datetime.now()
610
611            user_memory = UserMemory(
612                memory_id=memory_id,
613                memory=memory_text,
614                topics=topics,
615                last_updated=last_updated,
616                input=input_text,
617            )
618
619            memory_row = MemoryRow(
620                id=memory_id,
621                user_id=user_id,
622                memory=user_memory.to_dict(),
623                last_updated=last_updated,
624            )
625
626            db.upsert_memory(memory_row)
627
628            self.memories_updated = True
629
630            logger.info(
631                "Updated memory %s for user %s: '%s'", memory_id, user_id, memory_text
632            )
633            if self.config.debug_mode:
634                print(f"🔄 UPDATED: '{memory_text}' (topics: {topics})")
635
636            return True, "Memory updated successfully"
637
638        except Exception as e:
639            error_msg = f"Error updating memory: {e}"
640            logger.error(error_msg)
641            return False, error_msg

Update an existing memory.

Parameters
  • memory_id: ID of the memory to update
  • memory_text: New memory text
  • db: Memory database instance
  • user_id: User ID for the memory
  • topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
  • input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
Returns

Tuple of (success, message)

def delete_memory( self, memory_id: str, db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
643    def delete_memory(
644        self, memory_id: str, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None
645    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
646        """
647        Delete a memory.
648
649        :param memory_id: ID of the memory to delete
650        :param db: Memory database instance
651        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
652        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
653        """
654        try:
655            # Get current user ID if not provided
656            if user_id is None:
657                user_id = get_current_user_id()
658                
659            # First check if the memory exists
660            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
661            memory_exists = False
662            for row in memory_rows:
663                if row.id == memory_id and row.user_id == user_id:
664                    memory_exists = True
665                    break
666            
667            if not memory_exists:
668                logger.warning("Memory %s not found for user %s", memory_id, user_id)
669                return False, f"Memory {memory_id} not found"
670            
671            # Delete the memory
672            db.delete_memory(memory_id)
673
674            self.memories_updated = True
675
676            logger.info("Deleted memory %s for user %s", memory_id, user_id)
677            if self.config.debug_mode:
678                print(f"🗑️ DELETED: {memory_id}")
679
680            return True, f"Memory {memory_id} deleted successfully"
681
682        except Exception as e:
683            error_msg = f"Error deleting memory {memory_id}: {e}"
684            logger.error(error_msg)
685            return False, error_msg

Delete a memory.

Parameters
  • memory_id: ID of the memory to delete
  • db: Memory database instance
  • user_id: User ID for the memory
Returns

Tuple of (success, message)

def delete_memories_by_topic( self, topics: List[str], db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
687    def delete_memories_by_topic(
688        self, topics: List[str], db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None
689    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
690        """
691        Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics.
692
693        :param topics: A list of topics to delete memories for.
694        :param db: Memory database instance.
695        :param user_id: User ID for the memories.
696        :return: Tuple of (success, message).
697        """
698        # Get current user ID if not provided
699        if user_id is None:
700            user_id = get_current_user_id()
701            
702        if not topics:
703            return False, "No topics provided for deletion."
704
705        try:
706            # Get all memories for the specified topics
707            memories_to_delete = self.get_memories_by_topic(
708                db=db, user_id=user_id, topics=topics
709            )
710
711            if not memories_to_delete:
712                return (
713                    True,
714                    f"No memories found for topics: {', '.join(topics)}.",
715                )
716
717            deleted_count = 0
718            for memory in memories_to_delete:
719                success, _ = self.delete_memory(
720                    memory_id=memory.memory_id, db=db, user_id=user_id
721                )
722                if success:
723                    deleted_count += 1
724
725            self.memories_updated = True
726
727            logger.info(
728                "Deleted %d memories for topics '%s' for user %s",
729                deleted_count,
730                ", ".join(topics),
731                user_id,
732            )
733            if self.config.debug_mode:
734                print(
735                    f"🗑️ DELETED BY TOPIC: {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}"
736                )
737
738            return (
739                True,
740                f"Successfully deleted {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}.",
741            )
742
743        except Exception as e:
744            error_msg = f"Error deleting memories by topic: {e}"
745            logger.error(error_msg)
746            return False, error_msg

Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics.

Parameters
  • topics: A list of topics to delete memories for.
  • db: Memory database instance.
  • user_id: User ID for the memories.
Returns

Tuple of (success, message).

def clear_memories( self, db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
748    def clear_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
749        """
750        Clear all memories for a user.
751
752        :param db: Memory database instance
753        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
754        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
755        """
756        # Get current user ID if not provided
757        if user_id is None:
758            user_id = get_current_user_id()
759            
760        try:
761            # Get all memories for the user first
762            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
763
764            # Delete each memory
765            for row in memory_rows:
766                if row.user_id == user_id:
767                    db.delete_memory(row.id)
768
769            self.memories_updated = True
770
771            logger.info("Cleared all memories for user %s", user_id)
772            if self.config.debug_mode:
773                print(f"🧹 CLEARED: All memories for user {user_id}")
774
775            return True, f"Cleared {len(memory_rows)} memories successfully"
776
777        except Exception as e:
778            error_msg = f"Error clearing memories: {e}"
779            logger.error(error_msg)
780            return False, error_msg

Clear all memories for a user.

Parameters
  • db: Memory database instance
  • user_id: User ID for the memories
Returns

Tuple of (success, message)

def search_memories( self, query: str, db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None, limit: int = None, similarity_threshold: float = 0.3, search_topics: bool = True, topic_boost: float = 0.5) -> List[Tuple[agno.memory.v2.schema.UserMemory, float]]: 
782    def search_memories(
783        self,
784        query: str,
785        db: MemoryDb,
786        user_id: str = None,
787        limit: int = None,
788        similarity_threshold: float = 0.3,
789        search_topics: bool = True,
790        topic_boost: float = 0.5,
791    ) -> List[Tuple[UserMemory, float]]:
792        """
793        Search memories using semantic similarity and topic matching with enhanced query expansion.
794
795        :param query: Search query
796        :param db: Memory database instance
797        :param user_id: User ID to search within
798        :param limit: Maximum number of results
799        :param similarity_threshold: Minimum similarity threshold for content
800        :param search_topics: Whether to include topic search (default: True)
801        :param topic_boost: Score boost for topic matches (default: 0.5)
802        :return: List of (UserMemory, combined_score) tuples
803        """
804        import time
805        
806        # LATENCY DEBUG: Start timing memory search
807        search_start_time = time.perf_counter()
808        logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Starting search_memories for query: %s", query[:50])
809        
810        # Get current user ID if not provided
811        if user_id is None:
812            user_id = get_current_user_id()
813            
814        try:
815            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time query expansion
816            expand_start = time.perf_counter()
817            expanded_queries = self._expand_query(query)
818            expand_time = time.perf_counter() - expand_start
819            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Query expansion took %.3f seconds (%d queries)", expand_time, len(expanded_queries))
820
821            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time database read
822            db_start = time.perf_counter()
823            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
824            db_time = time.perf_counter() - db_start
825            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Database read took %.3f seconds (%d rows)", db_time, len(memory_rows))
826
827            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time memory conversion
828            convert_start = time.perf_counter()
829            user_memories = []
830            for row in memory_rows:
831                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
832                    try:
833                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
834                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
835                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
836                        logger.warning(
837                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
838                        )
839            convert_time = time.perf_counter() - convert_start
840            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Memory conversion took %.3f seconds (%d memories)", convert_time, len(user_memories))
841
842            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time similarity calculations
843            similarity_start = time.perf_counter()
844            results = []
845            query_lower = query.lower().strip()
846
847            for memory in user_memories:
848                max_similarity = 0.0
849                best_query = query
850
851                # Test original query and all expanded queries
852                for test_query in expanded_queries:
853                    content_similarity = (
854                        self.duplicate_detector._calculate_semantic_similarity(
855                            test_query, memory.memory
856                        )
857                    )
858                    if content_similarity > max_similarity:
859                        max_similarity = content_similarity
860                        best_query = test_query
861
862                # Topic matching with enhanced search
863                topic_score = 0.0
864                topic_matches = []
865
866                if search_topics and memory.topics:
867                    for topic in memory.topics:
868                        # Check original query and expanded queries against topics
869                        for test_query in expanded_queries:
870                            test_query_lower = test_query.lower()
871                            if (
872                                test_query_lower in topic.lower()
873                                or topic.lower() in test_query_lower
874                            ):
875                                if test_query_lower == topic.lower():
876                                    topic_score = 1.0  # Exact topic match
877                                    topic_matches.append(topic)
878                                    break
879                                else:
880                                    topic_score = max(
881                                        topic_score, 0.8
882                                    )  # Partial topic match
883                                    topic_matches.append(topic)
884
885                # Enhanced keyword matching for work-related queries
886                keyword_score = self._calculate_keyword_score(
887                    expanded_queries, memory.memory
888                )
889
890                # Combined scoring: use the best of content similarity, topic match, or keyword match
891                final_score = max(
892                    max_similarity, topic_score * topic_boost, keyword_score
893                )
894
895                if (
896                    final_score >= similarity_threshold
897                    or topic_score > 0
898                    or keyword_score > 0.4
899                ):
900                    results.append((memory, final_score))
901
902                    if self.config.debug_mode and (
903                        topic_matches or keyword_score > 0.4
904                    ):
905                        logger.debug(
906                            "Enhanced match for query '%s': memory='%s', topics=%s, final_score=%.3f (content=%.3f, topic=%.3f, keyword=%.3f)",
907                            query,
908                            memory.memory[:50],
909                            topic_matches,
910                            final_score,
911                            max_similarity,
912                            topic_score,
913                            keyword_score,
914                        )
915
916            similarity_time = time.perf_counter() - similarity_start
917            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Similarity calculations took %.3f seconds (%d memories processed)", similarity_time, len(user_memories))
918
919            # LATENCY DEBUG: Time sorting
920            sort_start = time.perf_counter()
921            results.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
922            sort_time = time.perf_counter() - sort_start
923            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Sorting took %.3f seconds", sort_time)
924
925            # LATENCY DEBUG: Total timing
926            total_time = time.perf_counter() - search_start_time
927            logger.info("🔍 MEMORY LATENCY: Total search_memories time: %.3f seconds (expand: %.3f, db: %.3f, convert: %.3f, similarity: %.3f, sort: %.3f)",
928                       total_time, expand_time, db_time, convert_time, similarity_time, sort_time)
929
930            return results[:limit]
931
932        except Exception as e:
933            logger.error("Error searching memories: %s", e)
934            return []

Search memories using semantic similarity and topic matching with enhanced query expansion.

Parameters
  • query: Search query
  • db: Memory database instance
  • user_id: User ID to search within
  • limit: Maximum number of results
  • similarity_threshold: Minimum similarity threshold for content
  • search_topics: Whether to include topic search (default: True)
  • topic_boost: Score boost for topic matches (default: 0.5)
Returns

List of (UserMemory, combined_score) tuples

def get_memories_by_topic( self, db: agno.memory.v2.db.base.MemoryDb, user_id: str = None, topics: Optional[List[str]] = None, limit: Optional[int] = None) -> List[agno.memory.v2.schema.UserMemory]: 
936    def get_memories_by_topic(
937        self,
938        db: MemoryDb,
939        user_id: str = None,
940        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
941        limit: Optional[int] = None,
942    ) -> List[UserMemory]:
943        """
944        Get memories filtered by a list of topics, without similarity search.
945
