def create_structured_instructions(base_instructions: str) -> str: 
268def create_structured_instructions(base_instructions: str) -> str:
269    """
270    Combine base agent instructions with structured output requirements.
271    
272    Args:
273        base_instructions: Original agent instructions
274        
275    Returns:
276        Enhanced instructions with JSON structure requirements
277    """
278    structured_prompt = StructuredResponseParser.create_system_prompt()
279    
280    return f"""
281{base_instructions}
282
283## RESPONSE FORMAT REQUIREMENTS
284
285{structured_prompt}
286
287Remember: Your response must be valid JSON following the exact schema above. The user will see the "content" field as your main response.
288"""

Combine base agent instructions with structured output requirements.

Args: base_instructions: Original agent instructions

Returns: Enhanced instructions with JSON structure requirements

class TopicClassifier: 
 43class TopicClassifier:
 44    def __init__(self, config_path=None):
 45        import os
 46        if config_path is None:
 47            # Default to topics.yaml in the same directory as this file
 48            current_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
 49            config_path = os.path.join(current_dir, "topics.yaml")
 50
 51        self.load_config(config_path)
 52        self.stopwords = set(
 53            [
 54                "i",
 55                "me",
 56                "my",
 57                "myself",
 58                "we",
 59                "our",
 60                "ours",
 61                "ourselves",
 62                "you",
 63                "your",
 64                "yours",
 65                "yourself",
 66                "yourselves",
 67                "he",
 68                "him",
 69                "his",
 70                "himself",
 71                "she",
 72                "her",
 73                "hers",
 74                "herself",
 75                "it",
 76                "its",
 77                "itself",
 78                "they",
 79                "them",
 80                "their",
 81                "theirs",
 82                "themselves",
 83                "what",
 84                "which",
 85                "who",
 86                "whom",
 87                "this",
 88                "that",
 89                "these",
 90                "those",
 91                "am",
 92                "is",
 93                "are",
 94                "was",
 95                "were",
 96                "be",
 97                "been",
 98                "being",
 99                "have",
100                "has",
101                "had",
102                "having",
103                "do",
104                "does",
105                "did",
106                "doing",
107                "a",
108                "an",
109                "the",
110                "and",
111                "but",
112                "if",
113                "or",
114                "because",
115                "as",
116                "until",
117                "while",
118                "of",
119                "at",
120                "by",
121                "for",
122                "with",
123                "through",
124                "during",
125                "before",
126                "after",
127                "above",
128                "below",
129                "up",
130                "down",
131                "in",
132                "out",
133                "on",
134                "off",
135                "over",
136                "under",
137                "again",
138                "further",
139                "then",
140                "once",
141            ]
142        )
143        self.confidence_threshold = 0.1
144        self.keyword_weight = 1
145        self.phrase_weight = 3
146
147    def load_config(self, config_path):
148        with open(config_path, "r") as f:
149            config = yaml.safe_load(f)
150            self.categories = config.get("categories", {})
151            self.phrases = config.get("phrases", {})
152
153    def clean_text(self, text):
154        text = text.lower()
155        # Expand common contractions
156        text = re.sub(r"i'm", "i am", text)
157        text = re.sub(r"you're", "you are", text)
158        text = re.sub(r"he's", "he is", text)
159        text = re.sub(r"she's", "she is", text)
160        text = re.sub(r"it's", "it is", text)
161        text = re.sub(r"we're", "we are", text)
162        text = re.sub(r"they're", "they are", text)
163        text = re.sub(r"can't", "cannot", text)
164        text = re.sub(r"won't", "will not", text)
165        text = re.sub(r"don't", "do not", text)
166        text = re.sub(r"doesn't", "does not", text)
167        text = re.sub(r"didn't", "did not", text)
168        text = re.sub(r"isn't", "is not", text)
169        text = re.sub(r"aren't", "are not", text)
170        text = re.sub(r"wasn't", "was not", text)
171        text = re.sub(r"weren't", "were not", text)
172        text = re.sub(r"haven't", "have not", text)
173        text = re.sub(r"hasn't", "has not", text)
174        text = re.sub(r"hadn't", "had not", text)
175        text = re.sub(r"wouldn't", "would not", text)
176        text = re.sub(r"shouldn't", "should not", text)
177        text = re.sub(r"couldn't", "could not", text)
178
179        # Preserve special characters relevant to programming languages (e.g., C++, C#)
180        # and remove other non-alphanumeric characters, but keep spaces.
181        text = re.sub(r"[^a-z0-9#+\s]", "", text)
182        tokens = text.split()
183        tokens = [word for word in tokens if word not in self.stopwords]
184        return " ".join(tokens)
185
186    def classify(self, text, return_list=True):
187        """
188        Classify the topic(s) of a given text.
189
190        Args:
191            text (str): Text to classify
192            return_list (bool): If True, returns list of topic names only.
193                               If False, returns dict with confidence scores.
194
195        Returns:
196            Union[List[str], Dict[str, float]]: Topic classification results
197        """
198        cleaned = self.clean_text(text)
199        cleaned_words = cleaned.split()
200        raw_scores = {category: 0 for category in self.categories}
201
202        # Check phrases first (higher weight)
203        for category, phrases in self.phrases.items():
204            if category in raw_scores:  # Make sure category exists in raw_scores
205                for phrase in phrases:
206                    if phrase.lower() in cleaned:
207                        raw_scores[category] += self.phrase_weight
208
209        # Check individual keywords with whole word matching
210        for category, keywords in self.categories.items():
211            for keyword in keywords:
212                keyword_lower = keyword.lower()
213                # Use whole word matching to avoid partial matches like "ai" in "hiking"
214                if keyword_lower in cleaned_words:
215                    raw_scores[category] += self.keyword_weight
216                # Also check for exact phrase matches for multi-word keywords
217                elif " " in keyword_lower and keyword_lower in cleaned:
218                    raw_scores[category] += self.keyword_weight
219
220        total_score = sum(raw_scores.values())
221        if total_score == 0:
222            return ["unknown"] if return_list else {"unknown": 0.0}
223
224        normalized_scores = {
225            cat: score / total_score for cat, score in raw_scores.items() if score > 0
226        }
227        high_confidence = {
228            cat: round(score, 3)
229            for cat, score in normalized_scores.items()
230            if score >= self.confidence_threshold
231        }
232
233        if not high_confidence:
234            return ["unknown"] if return_list else {"unknown": 0.0}
235
236        if return_list:
237            return list(high_confidence.keys())
238        else:
239            return high_confidence
TopicClassifier(config_path=None) 
 44    def __init__(self, config_path=None):
 45        import os
 46        if config_path is None:
 47            # Default to topics.yaml in the same directory as this file
 48            current_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
 49            config_path = os.path.join(current_dir, "topics.yaml")
 50
 51        self.load_config(config_path)
 52        self.stopwords = set(
 53            [
 54                "i",
 55                "me",
 56                "my",
 57                "myself",
 58                "we",
 59                "our",
 60                "ours",
 61                "ourselves",
 62                "you",
 63                "your",
 64                "yours",
 65                "yourself",
 66                "yourselves",
 67                "he",
 68                "him",
 69                "his",
 70                "himself",
 71                "she",
 72                "her",
 73                "hers",
 74                "herself",
 75                "it",
 76                "its",
 77                "itself",
 78                "they",
 79                "them",
 80                "their",
 81                "theirs",
 82                "themselves",
 83                "what",
 84                "which",
 85                "who",
 86                "whom",
 87                "this",
 88                "that",
 89                "these",
 90                "those",
 91                "am",
 92                "is",
 93                "are",
 94                "was",
 95                "were",
 96                "be",
 97                "been",
 98                "being",
 99                "have",
100                "has",
101                "had",
102                "having",
103                "do",
104                "does",
105                "did",
106                "doing",
107                "a",
108                "an",
109                "the",
110                "and",
111                "but",
112                "if",
113                "or",
114                "because",
115                "as",
116                "until",
117                "while",
118                "of",

120                "by",

122                "with",

124                "during",
125                "before",
126                "after",
127                "above",
128                "below",
129                "up",
130                "down",
131                "in",
132                "out",
133                "on",
134                "off",
135                "over",
136                "under",
137                "again",
138                "further",
139                "then",
140                "once",
141            ]
142        )
143        self.confidence_threshold = 0.1
144        self.keyword_weight = 1
145        self.phrase_weight = 3
stopwords
confidence_threshold
keyword_weight
phrase_weight
def load_config(self, config_path): 
147    def load_config(self, config_path):
148        with open(config_path, "r") as f:
149            config = yaml.safe_load(f)
150            self.categories = config.get("categories", {})
151            self.phrases = config.get("phrases", {})
def clean_text(self, text): 
153    def clean_text(self, text):
154        text = text.lower()
155        # Expand common contractions
156        text = re.sub(r"i'm", "i am", text)
157        text = re.sub(r"you're", "you are", text)
158        text = re.sub(r"he's", "he is", text)
159        text = re.sub(r"she's", "she is", text)
160        text = re.sub(r"it's", "it is", text)
161        text = re.sub(r"we're", "we are", text)
162        text = re.sub(r"they're", "they are", text)
163        text = re.sub(r"can't", "cannot", text)
164        text = re.sub(r"won't", "will not", text)
165        text = re.sub(r"don't", "do not", text)
166        text = re.sub(r"doesn't", "does not", text)
167        text = re.sub(r"didn't", "did not", text)
168        text = re.sub(r"isn't", "is not", text)
169        text = re.sub(r"aren't", "are not", text)
170        text = re.sub(r"wasn't", "was not", text)
171        text = re.sub(r"weren't", "were not", text)
172        text = re.sub(r"haven't", "have not", text)
173        text = re.sub(r"hasn't", "has not", text)
174        text = re.sub(r"hadn't", "had not", text)
175        text = re.sub(r"wouldn't", "would not", text)
176        text = re.sub(r"shouldn't", "should not", text)
177        text = re.sub(r"couldn't", "could not", text)
178
179        # Preserve special characters relevant to programming languages (e.g., C++, C#)
180        # and remove other non-alphanumeric characters, but keep spaces.
181        text = re.sub(r"[^a-z0-9#+\s]", "", text)
182        tokens = text.split()
183        tokens = [word for word in tokens if word not in self.stopwords]
184        return " ".join(tokens)
def classify(self, text, return_list=True): 
186    def classify(self, text, return_list=True):
187        """
188        Classify the topic(s) of a given text.
189
190        Args:
191            text (str): Text to classify
192            return_list (bool): If True, returns list of topic names only.
193                               If False, returns dict with confidence scores.
194
195        Returns:
196            Union[List[str], Dict[str, float]]: Topic classification results
197        """
198        cleaned = self.clean_text(text)
199        cleaned_words = cleaned.split()
200        raw_scores = {category: 0 for category in self.categories}
201
202        # Check phrases first (higher weight)
203        for category, phrases in self.phrases.items():
204            if category in raw_scores:  # Make sure category exists in raw_scores
205                for phrase in phrases:
206                    if phrase.lower() in cleaned:
207                        raw_scores[category] += self.phrase_weight
208
209        # Check individual keywords with whole word matching
210        for category, keywords in self.categories.items():
211            for keyword in keywords:
212                keyword_lower = keyword.lower()
213                # Use whole word matching to avoid partial matches like "ai" in "hiking"
214                if keyword_lower in cleaned_words:
215                    raw_scores[category] += self.keyword_weight
216                # Also check for exact phrase matches for multi-word keywords
217                elif " " in keyword_lower and keyword_lower in cleaned:
218                    raw_scores[category] += self.keyword_weight
219
220        total_score = sum(raw_scores.values())
221        if total_score == 0:
222            return ["unknown"] if return_list else {"unknown": 0.0}
223
224        normalized_scores = {
225            cat: score / total_score for cat, score in raw_scores.items() if score > 0
226        }
227        high_confidence = {
228            cat: round(score, 3)
229            for cat, score in normalized_scores.items()
230            if score >= self.confidence_threshold
231        }
232
233        if not high_confidence:
234            return ["unknown"] if return_list else {"unknown": 0.0}
235
236        if return_list:
237            return list(high_confidence.keys())
238        else:
239            return high_confidence

Classify the topic(s) of a given text.

Args: text (str): Text to classify return_list (bool): If True, returns list of topic names only. If False, returns dict with confidence scores.

Returns: Union[List[str], Dict[str, float]]: Topic classification results

@dataclass
class RuleSet: 
32@dataclass
33class RuleSet:
34    """Basic ruleset"""
35
36    keywords: List[str]
37    patterns: List[Pattern]

Basic ruleset

RuleSet(keywords: List[str], patterns: List[Pattern])
keywords: List[str]
patterns: List[Pattern]
class UserManager: 
 18class UserManager:
 19    """Complete user management with LightRAG integration."""
 20    
 21    def __init__(self, data_dir: str = None, storage_backend: str = None, project_root: str = None):
 22        """
 23        Initialize the user manager.
 24        
 25        Args:
 26            data_dir: Data directory path (defaults to config DATA_DIR)
 27            storage_backend: Storage backend (defaults to config STORAGE_BACKEND)
 28            project_root: Project root directory (deprecated, LightRAGManager now uses PERSAG_HOME)
 29        """
 30        # Store the configuration for use in methods
 31        if data_dir is None or storage_backend is None:
 32            from personal_agent.config import DATA_DIR, STORAGE_BACKEND
 33            self.data_dir = data_dir or DATA_DIR
 34            self.storage_backend = storage_backend or STORAGE_BACKEND
 35        else:
 36            self.data_dir = data_dir
 37            self.storage_backend = storage_backend
 38            
 39        self.registry = UserRegistry(self.data_dir, self.storage_backend)
 40        # LightRAGManager now uses PERSAG_HOME internally, project_root parameter is deprecated
 41        self.lightrag_manager = LightRAGManager(project_root)
 42    
 43    def get_all_users(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 44        """
 45        Get all users from the registry.
 46        
 47        Returns:
 48            List of user dictionaries with current user marked
 49        """
 50        users = self.registry.get_all_users()
 51        
 52        # Mark current user
 53        from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
 54        current_user_id = get_current_user_id()
 55        
 56        for user in users:
 57            user["is_current"] = (user["user_id"] == current_user_id)
 58        
 59        return users
 60    
 61    def get_user(self, user_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
 62        """
 63        Get a specific user from the registry.
 64        
 65        Args:
 66            user_id: User identifier
 67            
 68        Returns:
 69            User dictionary or None if not found
 70        """
 71        return self.registry.get_user(user_id)
 72    
 73    def create_user(self, user_id: str, user_name: str = None, user_type: str = "Standard") -> Dict[str, Any]:
 74        """
 75        Create a new user in the system.
 76        
 77        Args:
 78            user_id: Unique user identifier
 79            user_name: Display name for the user (defaults to user_id)
 80            user_type: User type (Standard, Admin, Guest)
 81            
 82        Returns:
 83            Dictionary containing result information
 84        """
 85        try:
 86            # Validate input
 87            if not user_id:
 88                return {"success": False, "error": "User ID is required"}
 89            
 90            if not user_name:
 91                user_name = user_id
 92            
 93            # Add user to registry
 94            if self.registry.add_user(user_id, user_name, user_type):
 95                return {
 96                    "success": True,
 97                    "message": f"User '{user_id}' created successfully",
 98                    "user_id": user_id
 99                }
100            else:
101                return {
102                    "success": False,
103                    "error": f"User '{user_id}' already exists"
104                }
105        
106        except Exception as e:
107            return {
108                "success": False,
109                "error": f"Error creating user: {str(e)}"
110            }
111    
112    def switch_user(self, user_id: str, restart_lightrag: bool = True, update_global_config: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]:
113        """
114        Switch to a different user with complete system integration.
115        
116        Args:
117            user_id: User ID to switch to
118            restart_lightrag: Whether to restart LightRAG services
119            update_global_config: Whether to update global USER_ID configuration
120            
121        Returns:
122            Dictionary containing result information
123        """
124        try:
125            # Validate input
126            if not user_id:
127                return {"success": False, "error": "User ID is required"}
128            
129            # Check if user exists in registry
130            if not self.registry.user_exists(user_id):
131                return {"success": False, "error": f"User '{user_id}' does not exist"}
132            
133            # Get current user using dynamic function
134            from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
135            current_user = get_current_user_id()
136            
137            # Don't switch if already the current user
138            if user_id == current_user:
139                return {"success": False, "error": f"Already logged in as '{user_id}'"}
140            
141            results = {
142                "success": True,
143                "user_id": user_id,
144                "previous_user": current_user,
145                "actions_performed": [],
146                "warnings": [],
147                "lightrag_status": {},
148                "config_refresh": {}
149            }
150            
151            # Update global environment variable and persistent user file
152            if update_global_config:
153                os.environ["USER_ID"] = user_id
154                results["actions_performed"].append("Updated global USER_ID environment variable")
155
156                # Write to ~/.persag/env.userid to persist the change
157                try:
158                    from ..core.persag_manager import get_persag_manager
159                    persag_manager = get_persag_manager()
160                    success = persag_manager.set_userid(user_id)
161                    if success:
162                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Persisted current user to ~/.persag/env.userid")
163                    else:
164                        results["warnings"].append("Could not write to ~/.persag/env.userid")
165                except Exception as e:
166                    results["warnings"].append(f"Could not write to ~/.persag/env.userid: {e}")
167
168                # Refresh user-dependent configuration settings
169                from personal_agent.config import refresh_user_dependent_settings
170                refreshed_settings = refresh_user_dependent_settings()
171                results["config_refresh"] = refreshed_settings
172                results["actions_performed"].append("Refreshed user-dependent configuration settings")
173            
174            # Restart LightRAG services with new user ID
175            if restart_lightrag:
176                lightrag_result = self.lightrag_manager.restart_lightrag_services(user_id)
177                results["lightrag_status"] = lightrag_result
178                
179                if lightrag_result["success"]:
180                    results["actions_performed"].append("Restarted LightRAG services")
181                    if lightrag_result["services_restarted"]:
182                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Services restarted: {', '.join(lightrag_result['services_restarted'])}")
183                else:
184                    results["warnings"].append("LightRAG restart had issues")
185                    if lightrag_result["errors"]:
186                        results["warnings"].extend(lightrag_result["errors"])
187            
188            # Update user's last_seen timestamp
189            self.registry.update_last_seen(user_id)
190            results["actions_performed"].append("Updated user last_seen timestamp")
191            
192            return results
193        
194        except Exception as e:
195            return {
196                "success": False,
197                "error": f"Error switching user: {str(e)}"
198            }
199    
200    def delete_user(self, user_id: str, delete_data: bool = True, backup_data: bool = False, dry_run: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]:
201        """
202        Delete a user from the system with comprehensive data cleanup.
203        
204        Args:
205            user_id: User ID to delete
206            delete_data: Whether to delete persistent data directory (default: True)
207            backup_data: Whether to backup data before deletion (default: False)
208            dry_run: Preview mode - show what would be deleted without deleting (default: False)
209            
210        Returns:
211            Dictionary containing detailed result information
212        """
213        try:
214            # Validate input
215            if not user_id:
216                return {"success": False, "error": "User ID is required"}
217            
218            # Check if user exists
219            if not self.registry.user_exists(user_id):
220                return {"success": False, "error": f"User '{user_id}' does not exist"}
221            
222            # Get current user
223            from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
224            current_user = get_current_user_id()
225            
226            # Don't delete the current user
227            if user_id == current_user:
228                return {"success": False, "error": "Cannot delete the current user"}
229            
230            # Initialize result structure
231            results = {
232                "success": True,
233                "user_id": user_id,
234                "dry_run": dry_run,
235                "actions_performed": [],
236                "data_deleted": {
237                    "registry": False,
238                    "data_directory": False,
239                    "directories_removed": [],
240                    "files_removed": 0,
241                    "total_size_mb": 0.0
242                },
243                "backup_info": {},
244                "warnings": [],
245                "errors": []
246            }
247            
248            # Get user data directory path
249            user_data_dir = None
250            if delete_data:
251                user_data_dir = Path(self.data_dir) / self.storage_backend / user_id
252                
253                if dry_run:
254                    # In dry-run mode, analyze what would be deleted
255                    if user_data_dir.exists():
256                        size_info = self._calculate_directory_size(user_data_dir)
257                        results["data_deleted"]["directories_removed"] = [str(user_data_dir)]
258                        results["data_deleted"]["files_removed"] = size_info["file_count"]
259                        results["data_deleted"]["total_size_mb"] = size_info["size_mb"]
260                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] Would delete user data directory: {user_data_dir}")
261                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] Would remove {size_info['file_count']} files ({size_info['size_mb']:.2f} MB)")
262                    else:
263                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] User data directory does not exist: {user_data_dir}")
264                    
265                    results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] Would remove user '{user_id}' from registry")
266                    return results
267            
268            # Backup data if requested
269            if backup_data and user_data_dir and user_data_dir.exists():
270                backup_result = self._backup_user_data(user_id, user_data_dir)
271                results["backup_info"] = backup_result
272                if backup_result["success"]:
273                    results["actions_performed"].append(f"Backed up user data to: {backup_result['backup_path']}")
274                else:
275                    results["warnings"].append(f"Backup failed: {backup_result['error']}")
276            
277            # Delete user data directory
278            if delete_data and user_data_dir:
279                try:
280                    if user_data_dir.exists():
281                        # Calculate size before deletion for reporting
282                        size_info = self._calculate_directory_size(user_data_dir)
283                        
284                        # Remove the directory and all contents
285                        shutil.rmtree(user_data_dir)
286                        
287                        results["data_deleted"]["data_directory"] = True
288                        results["data_deleted"]["directories_removed"] = [str(user_data_dir)]
289                        results["data_deleted"]["files_removed"] = size_info["file_count"]
290                        results["data_deleted"]["total_size_mb"] = size_info["size_mb"]
291                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Deleted user data directory: {user_data_dir}")
292                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Removed {size_info['file_count']} files ({size_info['size_mb']:.2f} MB)")
293                    else:
294                        results["warnings"].append(f"User data directory does not exist: {user_data_dir}")
295                        results["actions_performed"].append("No user data directory to delete")
296                        
297                except PermissionError as e:
298                    results["errors"].append(f"Permission denied deleting data directory: {str(e)}")
299                    results["success"] = False
300                except Exception as e:
301                    results["errors"].append(f"Error deleting data directory: {str(e)}")
302                    results["success"] = False
303            
304            # Remove user from registry (always attempt this, even if data deletion failed)
305            try:
306                if self.registry.remove_user(user_id):
307                    results["data_deleted"]["registry"] = True
308                    results["actions_performed"].append(f"Removed user '{user_id}' from registry")
309                else:
310                    results["errors"].append(f"Failed to remove user '{user_id}' from registry")
311                    results["success"] = False
312            except Exception as e:
313                results["errors"].append(f"Error removing user from registry: {str(e)}")
314                results["success"] = False
315            
316            # Set final message
317            if results["success"]:
318                if delete_data:
319                    results["message"] = f"User '{user_id}' and all associated data deleted successfully"
320                else:
321                    results["message"] = f"User '{user_id}' deleted from registry successfully"
322            else:
323                results["message"] = f"User '{user_id}' deletion completed with errors"
324            
325            return results
326        
327        except Exception as e:
328            return {
329                "success": False,
330                "error": f"Error deleting user: {str(e)}"
331            }
332    
333    def _calculate_directory_size(self, directory: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
334        """
335        Calculate the total size and file count of a directory.
336        
337        Args:
338            directory: Path to the directory
339            
340        Returns:
341            Dictionary with size information
342        """
343        try:
344            total_size = 0
345            file_count = 0
346            
347            for path in directory.rglob('*'):
348                if path.is_file():
349                    file_count += 1
350                    try:
351                        total_size += path.stat().st_size
352                    except (OSError, IOError):
353                        # Skip files we can't access
354                        pass
355            
356            return {
357                "size_bytes": total_size,
358                "size_mb": total_size / (1024 * 1024),
359                "file_count": file_count
360            }
361        except Exception:
362            return {
363                "size_bytes": 0,
364                "size_mb": 0.0,
365                "file_count": 0
366            }
367    
368    def _backup_user_data(self, user_id: str, user_data_dir: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
369        """
370        Create a backup of user data before deletion.
371        
372        Args:
373            user_id: User ID being backed up
374            user_data_dir: Path to user's data directory
375            
376        Returns:
377            Dictionary with backup result information
378        """
379        try:
380            from datetime import datetime
381            
382            # Create backup directory
383            backup_base = Path("./backups/users")
384            backup_base.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
385            
386            # Generate backup filename with timestamp
387            timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
388            backup_name = f"{user_id}_{timestamp}"
389            backup_path = backup_base / backup_name
390            
391            # Copy the entire user directory
392            shutil.copytree(user_data_dir, backup_path)
393            
394            # Calculate backup size
395            size_info = self._calculate_directory_size(backup_path)
396            
397            return {
398                "success": True,
399                "backup_path": str(backup_path),
400                "backup_size_mb": size_info["size_mb"],
401                "files_backed_up": size_info["file_count"],
402                "timestamp": timestamp
403            }
404            
405        except Exception as e:
406            return {
407                "success": False,
408                "error": f"Backup failed: {str(e)}"
409            }
410    
411    def restart_lightrag_for_current_user(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
412        """
413        Restart LightRAG services for the current user.
414        
415        Returns:
416            Dictionary containing result information
417        """
418        try:
419            from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
420            current_user = get_current_user_id()
421            
422            # Ensure current user is registered
423            self.registry.ensure_current_user_registered()
424            
425            # Restart LightRAG services
426            result = self.lightrag_manager.restart_lightrag_services(current_user)
427            
428            if result["success"]:
429                # Update user's last_seen timestamp
430                self.registry.update_last_seen(current_user)
431            
432            return result
433        
434        except Exception as e:
435            return {
436                "success": False,
437                "error": f"Error restarting LightRAG: {str(e)}"
438            }
439    
440    def get_lightrag_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
441        """
442        Get current LightRAG service status.
443        
444        Returns:
445            Dictionary with service status information
446        """
447        try:
448            return self.lightrag_manager.get_service_status()
449        except Exception as e:
450            return {
451                "error": f"Error getting LightRAG status: {str(e)}"
452            }
453    
454    def ensure_current_user_registered(self) -> bool:
455        """
456        Ensure the current USER_ID is registered in the registry.
457        
458        Returns:
459            True if user was already registered or successfully added
460        """
461        return self.registry.ensure_current_user_registered()
462    
463    def update_user(self, user_id: str, **kwargs) -> Dict[str, Any]:
464        """
465        Update user information.
466        
467        Args:
468            user_id: User identifier
469            **kwargs: Fields to update (user_name, user_type, etc.)
470            
471        Returns:
472            Dictionary containing result information
473        """
474        try:
475            if self.registry.update_user(user_id, **kwargs):
476                return {
477                    "success": True,
478                    "message": f"User '{user_id}' updated successfully"
479                }
480            else:
481                return {
482                    "success": False,
483                    "error": f"User '{user_id}' not found"
484                }
485        except Exception as e:
486            return {
487                "success": False,
488                "error": f"Error updating user: {str(e)}"
489            }
490    
491    def get_user_details(self, user_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
492        """
493        Get detailed information for a specific user.
494        
495        Args:
496            user_id: User ID to get details for
497            
498        Returns:
499            Dictionary containing user details
500        """
501        user = self.registry.get_user(user_id)
502        if not user:
503            return {}
504        
505        # Add additional details
506        user_details = user.copy()
507        
508        # Add current user status
509        from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
510        user_details["is_current"] = (user_id == get_current_user_id())
511        
512        # Add LightRAG status if this is the current user
513        if user_details["is_current"]:
514            try:
515                lightrag_status = self.get_lightrag_status()
516                user_details["lightrag_status"] = lightrag_status
517            except Exception:
518                user_details["lightrag_status"] = {"error": "Could not get LightRAG status"}
519        
520        return user_details

Complete user management with LightRAG integration.

UserManager( data_dir: str = None, storage_backend: str = None, project_root: str = None) 
21    def __init__(self, data_dir: str = None, storage_backend: str = None, project_root: str = None):
22        """
23        Initialize the user manager.
24        
25        Args:
26            data_dir: Data directory path (defaults to config DATA_DIR)
27            storage_backend: Storage backend (defaults to config STORAGE_BACKEND)
28            project_root: Project root directory (deprecated, LightRAGManager now uses PERSAG_HOME)
29        """
30        # Store the configuration for use in methods
31        if data_dir is None or storage_backend is None:
32            from personal_agent.config import DATA_DIR, STORAGE_BACKEND
33            self.data_dir = data_dir or DATA_DIR
34            self.storage_backend = storage_backend or STORAGE_BACKEND
35        else:
36            self.data_dir = data_dir
37            self.storage_backend = storage_backend
38            
39        self.registry = UserRegistry(self.data_dir, self.storage_backend)
40        # LightRAGManager now uses PERSAG_HOME internally, project_root parameter is deprecated
41        self.lightrag_manager = LightRAGManager(project_root)

def get_all_users(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:

45        Get all users from the registry.
46        
47        Returns:

49        """

def get_user(self, user_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: 
61    def get_user(self, user_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
62        """
63        Get a specific user from the registry.

Get a specific user from the registry.

Args: user_id: User identifier

Returns: User dictionary or None if not found

def create_user( self, user_id: str, user_name: str = None, user_type: str = 'Standard') -> Dict[str, Any]: 
 73    def create_user(self, user_id: str, user_name: str = None, user_type: str = "Standard") -> Dict[str, Any]:
 74        """
 75        Create a new user in the system.
 76        
 77        Args:
 78            user_id: Unique user identifier
 79            user_name: Display name for the user (defaults to user_id)
 80            user_type: User type (Standard, Admin, Guest)
 81            
 82        Returns:
 83            Dictionary containing result information
 84        """
 85        try:
 86            # Validate input
 87            if not user_id:
 88                return {"success": False, "error": "User ID is required"}
 89            
 90            if not user_name:
 91                user_name = user_id
 92            
 93            # Add user to registry
 94            if self.registry.add_user(user_id, user_name, user_type):
 95                return {
 96                    "success": True,
 97                    "message": f"User '{user_id}' created successfully",
 98                    "user_id": user_id
 99                }
100            else:
101                return {
102                    "success": False,
103                    "error": f"User '{user_id}' already exists"
104                }
105        
106        except Exception as e:
107            return {
108                "success": False,
109                "error": f"Error creating user: {str(e)}"
110            }

Create a new user in the system.

Args: user_id: Unique user identifier user_name: Display name for the user (defaults to user_id) user_type: User type (Standard, Admin, Guest)

Returns: Dictionary containing result information

def switch_user( self, user_id: str, restart_lightrag: bool = True, update_global_config: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
112    def switch_user(self, user_id: str, restart_lightrag: bool = True, update_global_config: bool = True) -> Dict[str, Any]:
113        """
114        Switch to a different user with complete system integration.
115        
116        Args:
117            user_id: User ID to switch to
118            restart_lightrag: Whether to restart LightRAG services
119            update_global_config: Whether to update global USER_ID configuration
120            
121        Returns:
122            Dictionary containing result information
123        """
124        try:
125            # Validate input
126            if not user_id:
127                return {"success": False, "error": "User ID is required"}
128            
129            # Check if user exists in registry
130            if not self.registry.user_exists(user_id):
131                return {"success": False, "error": f"User '{user_id}' does not exist"}
132            
133            # Get current user using dynamic function
134            from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
135            current_user = get_current_user_id()
136            
137            # Don't switch if already the current user
138            if user_id == current_user:
139                return {"success": False, "error": f"Already logged in as '{user_id}'"}
140            
141            results = {
142                "success": True,
143                "user_id": user_id,
144                "previous_user": current_user,
145                "actions_performed": [],
146                "warnings": [],
147                "lightrag_status": {},
148                "config_refresh": {}
149            }
150            
151            # Update global environment variable and persistent user file
152            if update_global_config:
153                os.environ["USER_ID"] = user_id
154                results["actions_performed"].append("Updated global USER_ID environment variable")
155
156                # Write to ~/.persag/env.userid to persist the change
157                try:
158                    from ..core.persag_manager import get_persag_manager
159                    persag_manager = get_persag_manager()
160                    success = persag_manager.set_userid(user_id)
161                    if success:
162                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Persisted current user to ~/.persag/env.userid")
163                    else:
164                        results["warnings"].append("Could not write to ~/.persag/env.userid")
165                except Exception as e:
166                    results["warnings"].append(f"Could not write to ~/.persag/env.userid: {e}")
167
168                # Refresh user-dependent configuration settings
169                from personal_agent.config import refresh_user_dependent_settings
170                refreshed_settings = refresh_user_dependent_settings()
171                results["config_refresh"] = refreshed_settings
172                results["actions_performed"].append("Refreshed user-dependent configuration settings")
173            
174            # Restart LightRAG services with new user ID
175            if restart_lightrag:
176                lightrag_result = self.lightrag_manager.restart_lightrag_services(user_id)
177                results["lightrag_status"] = lightrag_result
178                
179                if lightrag_result["success"]:
180                    results["actions_performed"].append("Restarted LightRAG services")
181                    if lightrag_result["services_restarted"]:
182                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Services restarted: {', '.join(lightrag_result['services_restarted'])}")
183                else:
184                    results["warnings"].append("LightRAG restart had issues")
185                    if lightrag_result["errors"]:
186                        results["warnings"].extend(lightrag_result["errors"])
187            
188            # Update user's last_seen timestamp
189            self.registry.update_last_seen(user_id)
190            results["actions_performed"].append("Updated user last_seen timestamp")
191            
192            return results
193        
194        except Exception as e:
195            return {
196                "success": False,
197                "error": f"Error switching user: {str(e)}"
198            }

Switch to a different user with complete system integration.

Args: user_id: User ID to switch to restart_lightrag: Whether to restart LightRAG services update_global_config: Whether to update global USER_ID configuration

Returns: Dictionary containing result information

def delete_user( self, user_id: str, delete_data: bool = True, backup_data: bool = False, dry_run: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
200    def delete_user(self, user_id: str, delete_data: bool = True, backup_data: bool = False, dry_run: bool = False) -> Dict[str, Any]:
201        """
202        Delete a user from the system with comprehensive data cleanup.
203        
204        Args:
205            user_id: User ID to delete
206            delete_data: Whether to delete persistent data directory (default: True)
207            backup_data: Whether to backup data before deletion (default: False)
208            dry_run: Preview mode - show what would be deleted without deleting (default: False)
209            
210        Returns:
211            Dictionary containing detailed result information
212        """
213        try:
214            # Validate input
215            if not user_id:
216                return {"success": False, "error": "User ID is required"}
217            
218            # Check if user exists
219            if not self.registry.user_exists(user_id):
220                return {"success": False, "error": f"User '{user_id}' does not exist"}
221            
222            # Get current user
223            from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
224            current_user = get_current_user_id()
225            
226            # Don't delete the current user
227            if user_id == current_user:
228                return {"success": False, "error": "Cannot delete the current user"}
229            
230            # Initialize result structure
231            results = {
232                "success": True,
233                "user_id": user_id,
234                "dry_run": dry_run,
235                "actions_performed": [],
236                "data_deleted": {
237                    "registry": False,
238                    "data_directory": False,
239                    "directories_removed": [],
240                    "files_removed": 0,
241                    "total_size_mb": 0.0
242                },
243                "backup_info": {},
244                "warnings": [],
245                "errors": []
246            }
247            
248            # Get user data directory path
249            user_data_dir = None
250            if delete_data:
251                user_data_dir = Path(self.data_dir) / self.storage_backend / user_id
252                
253                if dry_run:
254                    # In dry-run mode, analyze what would be deleted
255                    if user_data_dir.exists():
256                        size_info = self._calculate_directory_size(user_data_dir)
257                        results["data_deleted"]["directories_removed"] = [str(user_data_dir)]
258                        results["data_deleted"]["files_removed"] = size_info["file_count"]
259                        results["data_deleted"]["total_size_mb"] = size_info["size_mb"]
260                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] Would delete user data directory: {user_data_dir}")
261                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] Would remove {size_info['file_count']} files ({size_info['size_mb']:.2f} MB)")
262                    else:
263                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] User data directory does not exist: {user_data_dir}")
264                    
265                    results["actions_performed"].append(f"[DRY RUN] Would remove user '{user_id}' from registry")
266                    return results
267            
268            # Backup data if requested
269            if backup_data and user_data_dir and user_data_dir.exists():
270                backup_result = self._backup_user_data(user_id, user_data_dir)
271                results["backup_info"] = backup_result
272                if backup_result["success"]:
273                    results["actions_performed"].append(f"Backed up user data to: {backup_result['backup_path']}")
274                else:
275                    results["warnings"].append(f"Backup failed: {backup_result['error']}")
276            
277            # Delete user data directory
278            if delete_data and user_data_dir:
279                try:
280                    if user_data_dir.exists():
281                        # Calculate size before deletion for reporting
282                        size_info = self._calculate_directory_size(user_data_dir)
283                        
284                        # Remove the directory and all contents
285                        shutil.rmtree(user_data_dir)
286                        
287                        results["data_deleted"]["data_directory"] = True
288                        results["data_deleted"]["directories_removed"] = [str(user_data_dir)]
289                        results["data_deleted"]["files_removed"] = size_info["file_count"]
290                        results["data_deleted"]["total_size_mb"] = size_info["size_mb"]
291                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Deleted user data directory: {user_data_dir}")
292                        results["actions_performed"].append(f"Removed {size_info['file_count']} files ({size_info['size_mb']:.2f} MB)")
293                    else:
294                        results["warnings"].append(f"User data directory does not exist: {user_data_dir}")
295                        results["actions_performed"].append("No user data directory to delete")
296                        
297                except PermissionError as e:
298                    results["errors"].append(f"Permission denied deleting data directory: {str(e)}")
299                    results["success"] = False
300                except Exception as e:
301                    results["errors"].append(f"Error deleting data directory: {str(e)}")
302                    results["success"] = False
303            
304            # Remove user from registry (always attempt this, even if data deletion failed)
305            try:
306                if self.registry.remove_user(user_id):
307                    results["data_deleted"]["registry"] = True
308                    results["actions_performed"].append(f"Removed user '{user_id}' from registry")
309                else:
310                    results["errors"].append(f"Failed to remove user '{user_id}' from registry")
311                    results["success"] = False
312            except Exception as e:
313                results["errors"].append(f"Error removing user from registry: {str(e)}")
314                results["success"] = False
315            
316            # Set final message
317            if results["success"]:
318                if delete_data:
319                    results["message"] = f"User '{user_id}' and all associated data deleted successfully"
320                else:
321                    results["message"] = f"User '{user_id}' deleted from registry successfully"
322            else:
323                results["message"] = f"User '{user_id}' deletion completed with errors"
324            
325            return results
326        
327        except Exception as e:
328            return {
329                "success": False,
330                "error": f"Error deleting user: {str(e)}"
331            }

Delete a user from the system with comprehensive data cleanup.

Args: user_id: User ID to delete delete_data: Whether to delete persistent data directory (default: True) backup_data: Whether to backup data before deletion (default: False) dry_run: Preview mode - show what would be deleted without deleting (default: False)

Returns: Dictionary containing detailed result information

def restart_lightrag_for_current_user(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
411    def restart_lightrag_for_current_user(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
412        """
413        Restart LightRAG services for the current user.
414        
415        Returns:
416            Dictionary containing result information
417        """
418        try:
419            from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
420            current_user = get_current_user_id()
421            
422            # Ensure current user is registered
423            self.registry.ensure_current_user_registered()
424            
425            # Restart LightRAG services
426            result = self.lightrag_manager.restart_lightrag_services(current_user)
427            
428            if result["success"]:
429                # Update user's last_seen timestamp
430                self.registry.update_last_seen(current_user)
431            
432            return result
433        
434        except Exception as e:
435            return {
436                "success": False,
437                "error": f"Error restarting LightRAG: {str(e)}"
438            }

Restart LightRAG services for the current user.

Returns: Dictionary containing result information

def get_lightrag_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
440    def get_lightrag_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
441        """
442        Get current LightRAG service status.
443        
444        Returns:
445            Dictionary with service status information
446        """
447        try:
448            return self.lightrag_manager.get_service_status()
449        except Exception as e:
450            return {
451                "error": f"Error getting LightRAG status: {str(e)}"
452            }

Get current LightRAG service status.

Returns: Dictionary with service status information

def ensure_current_user_registered(self) -> bool: 
454    def ensure_current_user_registered(self) -> bool:
455        """
456        Ensure the current USER_ID is registered in the registry.
457        
458        Returns:
459            True if user was already registered or successfully added
460        """
461        return self.registry.ensure_current_user_registered()

Ensure the current USER_ID is registered in the registry.

Returns: True if user was already registered or successfully added

def update_user(self, user_id: str, **kwargs) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
463    def update_user(self, user_id: str, **kwargs) -> Dict[str, Any]:
464        """
465        Update user information.
466        
467        Args:
468            user_id: User identifier
469            **kwargs: Fields to update (user_name, user_type, etc.)
470            
471        Returns:
472            Dictionary containing result information
473        """
474        try:
475            if self.registry.update_user(user_id, **kwargs):
476                return {
477                    "success": True,
478                    "message": f"User '{user_id}' updated successfully"
479                }
480            else:
481                return {
482                    "success": False,
483                    "error": f"User '{user_id}' not found"
484                }
485        except Exception as e:
486            return {
487                "success": False,
488                "error": f"Error updating user: {str(e)}"
489            }

Update user information.

Args: user_id: User identifier **kwargs: Fields to update (user_name, user_type, etc.)

Returns: Dictionary containing result information

def get_user_details(self, user_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
491    def get_user_details(self, user_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
492        """
493        Get detailed information for a specific user.
494        
495        Args:
496            user_id: User ID to get details for
497            
498        Returns:
499            Dictionary containing user details
500        """
501        user = self.registry.get_user(user_id)
502        if not user:
503            return {}
504        
505        # Add additional details
506        user_details = user.copy()
507        
508        # Add current user status
509        from personal_agent.config import get_current_user_id
510        user_details["is_current"] = (user_id == get_current_user_id())
511        
512        # Add LightRAG status if this is the current user
513        if user_details["is_current"]:
514            try:
515                lightrag_status = self.get_lightrag_status()
516                user_details["lightrag_status"] = lightrag_status
517            except Exception:
518                user_details["lightrag_status"] = {"error": "Could not get LightRAG status"}
519        
520        return user_details

Get detailed information for a specific user.

Args: user_id: User ID to get details for

Returns: Dictionary containing user details

class UserRegistry: 
 18class UserRegistry:
 19    """Simple user registry for tracking Personal Agent users."""
 20
 21    def __init__(self, data_dir: str = None, storage_backend: str = None):
 22        """
 23        Initialize the user registry.
 24
 25        Args:
 26            data_dir: Data directory path (defaults to config DATA_DIR)
 27            storage_backend: Storage backend (defaults to config STORAGE_BACKEND)
 28        """
 29        if data_dir is None or storage_backend is None:
 30            data_dir = data_dir or PERSAG_HOME
 31            storage_backend = storage_backend or STORAGE_BACKEND
 32
 33        self.registry_file = Path(data_dir) / "users_registry.json"
 34        self.registry_file.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 35
 36        # Initialize registry file if it doesn't exist
 37        if not self.registry_file.exists():
 38            self._create_empty_registry()
 39
 40    def _create_empty_registry(self):
 41        """Create an empty registry file."""
 42        empty_registry = {"users": []}
 43        with open(self.registry_file, "w") as f:
 44            json.dump(empty_registry, f, indent=2)
 45
 46    def _load_registry(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 47        """Load the registry from file."""
 48        try:
 49            with open(self.registry_file, "r") as f:
 50                return json.load(f)
 51        except (FileNotFoundError, json.JSONDecodeError):
 52            self._create_empty_registry()
 53            return {"users": []}
 54
 55    def _save_registry(self, registry: Dict[str, Any]):
 56        """Save the registry to file."""
 57        with open(self.registry_file, "w") as f:
 58            json.dump(registry, f, indent=2)
 59
 60    def add_user(
 61        self, user_id: str, user_name: str = None, user_type: str = "Standard"
 62    ) -> bool:
 63        """
 64        Add a new user to the registry.
 65
 66        Args:
 67            user_id: Unique user identifier
 68            user_name: Display name for the user (defaults to user_id)
 69            user_type: User type (Standard, Admin, Guest)
 70
 71        Returns:
 72            True if user was added, False if user already exists
 73        """
 74        if not user_id:
 75            raise ValueError("user_id cannot be empty")
 76
 77        registry = self._load_registry()
 78
 79        # Check if user already exists
 80        for user in registry["users"]:
 81            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
 82                return False
 83
 84        # Add new user
 85        new_user = {
 86            "user_id": user_id,
 87            "user_name": user_name or user_id,
 88            "user_type": user_type,
 89            "created_at": datetime.now().isoformat(),
 90            "last_seen": datetime.now().isoformat(),
 91        }
 92
 93        registry["users"].append(new_user)
 94        self._save_registry(registry)
 95        return True
 96
 97    def get_all_users(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 98        """
 99        Get all users from the registry.
100
101        Returns:
102            List of user dictionaries
103        """
104        registry = self._load_registry()
105        return registry.get("users", [])
106
107    def get_user(self, user_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
108        """
109        Get a specific user from the registry.
110
111        Args:
112            user_id: User identifier
113
114        Returns:
115            User dictionary or None if not found
116        """
117        registry = self._load_registry()
118        for user in registry["users"]:
119            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
120                return user
121        return None
122
123    def remove_user(self, user_id: str) -> bool:
124        """
125        Remove a user from the registry.
126
127        Args:
128            user_id: User identifier
129
130        Returns:
131            True if user was removed, False if user not found
132        """
133        registry = self._load_registry()
134        original_count = len(registry["users"])
135
136        registry["users"] = [
137            user for user in registry["users"] if user["user_id"] != user_id
138        ]
139
140        if len(registry["users"]) < original_count:
141            self._save_registry(registry)
142            return True
143        return False
144
145    def update_last_seen(self, user_id: str) -> bool:
146        """
147        Update the last_seen timestamp for a user.
148
149        Args:
150            user_id: User identifier
151
152        Returns:
153            True if user was updated, False if user not found
154        """
155        registry = self._load_registry()
156
157        for user in registry["users"]:
158            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
159                user["last_seen"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
160                self._save_registry(registry)
161                return True
162        return False
163
164    def update_user(self, user_id: str, **kwargs) -> bool:
165        """
166        Update user information.
167
168        Args:
169            user_id: User identifier
170            **kwargs: Fields to update (user_name, user_type, etc.)
171
172        Returns:
173            True if user was updated, False if user not found
174        """
175        registry = self._load_registry()
176
177        for user in registry["users"]:
178            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
179                # Update allowed fields
180                allowed_fields = {"user_name", "user_type"}
181                for key, value in kwargs.items():
182                    if key in allowed_fields:
183                        user[key] = value
184
185                user["last_seen"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
186                self._save_registry(registry)
187                return True
188        return False
189
190    def user_exists(self, user_id: str) -> bool:
191        """
192        Check if a user exists in the registry.
193
194        Args:
195            user_id: User identifier
196
197        Returns:
198            True if user exists, False otherwise
199        """
200        return self.get_user(user_id) is not None
201
202    def get_current_user(self) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
203        """
204        Get the current user from the single source of truth (user_id_mgr).
205
206        Returns:
207            Current user dictionary or None if not found
208        """
209        return self.get_user(get_current_user_id())
210
211    def ensure_current_user_registered(self) -> bool:
212        """
213        Ensure the current USER_ID is registered in the registry.
214        Auto-registers if not found.
215
216        Returns:
217            True if user was already registered or successfully added
218        """
219        current_user_id = get_userid()
220        if self.user_exists(current_user_id):
221            # Update last_seen for existing user
222            self.update_last_seen(current_user_id)
223            return True
224        else:
225            # Auto-register current user
226            return self.add_user(current_user_id, current_user_id, "Admin")

Simple user registry for tracking Personal Agent users.

UserRegistry(data_dir: str = None, storage_backend: str = None) 
21    def __init__(self, data_dir: str = None, storage_backend: str = None):
22        """
23        Initialize the user registry.
24
25        Args:
26            data_dir: Data directory path (defaults to config DATA_DIR)
27            storage_backend: Storage backend (defaults to config STORAGE_BACKEND)
28        """
29        if data_dir is None or storage_backend is None:
30            data_dir = data_dir or PERSAG_HOME
31            storage_backend = storage_backend or STORAGE_BACKEND
32
33        self.registry_file = Path(data_dir) / "users_registry.json"
34        self.registry_file.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
35
36        # Initialize registry file if it doesn't exist
37        if not self.registry_file.exists():
38            self._create_empty_registry()

Initialize the user registry.

Args: data_dir: Data directory path (defaults to config DATA_DIR) storage_backend: Storage backend (defaults to config STORAGE_BACKEND)

registry_file
def add_user( self, user_id: str, user_name: str = None, user_type: str = 'Standard') -> bool: 
60    def add_user(
61        self, user_id: str, user_name: str = None, user_type: str = "Standard"
62    ) -> bool:
63        """
64        Add a new user to the registry.
65
66        Args:
67            user_id: Unique user identifier
68            user_name: Display name for the user (defaults to user_id)
69            user_type: User type (Standard, Admin, Guest)
70
71        Returns:
72            True if user was added, False if user already exists
73        """
74        if not user_id:
75            raise ValueError("user_id cannot be empty")
76
77        registry = self._load_registry()
78
79        # Check if user already exists
80        for user in registry["users"]:
81            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
82                return False
83
84        # Add new user
85        new_user = {
86            "user_id": user_id,
87            "user_name": user_name or user_id,
88            "user_type": user_type,
89            "created_at": datetime.now().isoformat(),
90            "last_seen": datetime.now().isoformat(),
91        }
92
93        registry["users"].append(new_user)
94        self._save_registry(registry)
95        return True

Add a new user to the registry.

Args: user_id: Unique user identifier user_name: Display name for the user (defaults to user_id) user_type: User type (Standard, Admin, Guest)

Returns: True if user was added, False if user already exists

def get_all_users(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]: 
 97    def get_all_users(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
 98        """
 99        Get all users from the registry.
100
101        Returns:
102            List of user dictionaries
103        """
104        registry = self._load_registry()
105        return registry.get("users", [])

Get all users from the registry.

Returns: List of user dictionaries

def get_user(self, user_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: 
107    def get_user(self, user_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
108        """
109        Get a specific user from the registry.
110
111        Args:
112            user_id: User identifier
113
114        Returns:
115            User dictionary or None if not found
116        """
117        registry = self._load_registry()
118        for user in registry["users"]:
119            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
120                return user
121        return None

Get a specific user from the registry.

Args: user_id: User identifier

Returns: User dictionary or None if not found

def remove_user(self, user_id: str) -> bool: 
123    def remove_user(self, user_id: str) -> bool:
124        """
125        Remove a user from the registry.
126
127        Args:
128            user_id: User identifier
129
130        Returns:
131            True if user was removed, False if user not found
132        """
133        registry = self._load_registry()
134        original_count = len(registry["users"])
135
136        registry["users"] = [
137            user for user in registry["users"] if user["user_id"] != user_id
138        ]
139
140        if len(registry["users"]) < original_count:
141            self._save_registry(registry)
142            return True
143        return False

Remove a user from the registry.

Args: user_id: User identifier

Returns: True if user was removed, False if user not found

def update_last_seen(self, user_id: str) -> bool: 
145    def update_last_seen(self, user_id: str) -> bool:
146        """
147        Update the last_seen timestamp for a user.
148
149        Args:
150            user_id: User identifier
151
152        Returns:
153            True if user was updated, False if user not found
154        """
155        registry = self._load_registry()
156
157        for user in registry["users"]:
158            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
159                user["last_seen"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
160                self._save_registry(registry)
161                return True
162        return False

Update the last_seen timestamp for a user.

Args: user_id: User identifier

Returns: True if user was updated, False if user not found

def update_user(self, user_id: str, **kwargs) -> bool: 
164    def update_user(self, user_id: str, **kwargs) -> bool:
165        """
166        Update user information.
167
168        Args:
169            user_id: User identifier
170            **kwargs: Fields to update (user_name, user_type, etc.)
171
172        Returns:
173            True if user was updated, False if user not found
174        """
175        registry = self._load_registry()
176
177        for user in registry["users"]:
178            if user["user_id"] == user_id:
179                # Update allowed fields
180                allowed_fields = {"user_name", "user_type"}
181                for key, value in kwargs.items():
182                    if key in allowed_fields:
183                        user[key] = value
184
185                user["last_seen"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
186                self._save_registry(registry)
187                return True
188        return False

Update user information.

Args: user_id: User identifier **kwargs: Fields to update (user_name, user_type, etc.)

Returns: True if user was updated, False if user not found

def user_exists(self, user_id: str) -> bool: 
190    def user_exists(self, user_id: str) -> bool:
191        """
192        Check if a user exists in the registry.
193
194        Args:
195            user_id: User identifier
196
197        Returns:
198            True if user exists, False otherwise
199        """
200        return self.get_user(user_id) is not None

Check if a user exists in the registry.

Args: user_id: User identifier

Returns: True if user exists, False otherwise

def get_current_user(self) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: 
202    def get_current_user(self) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
203        """
204        Get the current user from the single source of truth (user_id_mgr).
205
206        Returns:
207            Current user dictionary or None if not found
208        """
209        return self.get_user(get_current_user_id())

Get the current user from the single source of truth (user_id_mgr).

Returns: Current user dictionary or None if not found

def ensure_current_user_registered(self) -> bool: 
211    def ensure_current_user_registered(self) -> bool:
212        """
213        Ensure the current USER_ID is registered in the registry.
214        Auto-registers if not found.
215
216        Returns:
217            True if user was already registered or successfully added
218        """
219        current_user_id = get_userid()
220        if self.user_exists(current_user_id):
221            # Update last_seen for existing user
222            self.update_last_seen(current_user_id)
223            return True
224        else:
225            # Auto-register current user
226            return self.add_user(current_user_id, current_user_id, "Admin")

Ensure the current USER_ID is registered in the registry. Auto-registers if not found.

Returns: True if user was already registered or successfully added

class LightRAGManager: 
 16class LightRAGManager:
 17    """Manages LightRAG Docker services with Python implementation of restart-lightrag.sh."""
 18
 19    def __init__(self, project_root: str = None):
 20        """
 21        Initialize the LightRAG manager.
 22
 23        Args:
 24            project_root: Project root directory (deprecated, now uses PERSAG_HOME)
 25        """
 26        # Import settings to get the correct PERSAG_HOME-based paths
 27        from personal_agent.config.settings import (
 28            LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_DIR,
 29            LIGHTRAG_SERVER_DIR,
 30        )
 31
 32        # Use the centralized configuration paths from PERSAG_HOME
 33        self.lightrag_server_dir = Path(LIGHTRAG_SERVER_DIR)
 34        self.lightrag_memory_dir = Path(LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_DIR)
 35
 36        # Keep project_root for backward compatibility, but it's no longer used for docker paths
 37        self.project_root = Path(project_root) if project_root else Path.cwd()
 38
 39    def update_docker_compose_user_id(self, user_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 40        """
 41        Update USER_ID in docker-compose .env files and docker-compose.yml files.
 42
 43        Args:
 44            user_id: User ID to set in environment files
 45
 46        Returns:
 47            Dictionary with operation results
 48        """
 49        results = {"success": True, "updated_files": [], "errors": []}
 50
 51        # List of directories to update
 52        directories = [
 53            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
 54            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
 55        ]
 56
 57        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
 58            if not dir_path.exists():
 59                results["errors"].append(
 60                    f"Directory {dir_name} not found at {dir_path}"
 61                )
 62                continue
 63
 64            # Update .env file
 65            env_file = dir_path / ".env"
 66
 67            try:
 68                # Read existing .env file or create new one
 69                env_lines = []
 70                user_id_found = False
 71
 72                if env_file.exists():
 73                    with open(env_file, "r") as f:
 74                        for line in f:
 75                            if line.startswith("USER_ID="):
 76                                env_lines.append(f"USER_ID={user_id}\n")
 77                                user_id_found = True
 78                            else:
 79                                env_lines.append(line)
 80
 81                # Add USER_ID if not found
 82                if not user_id_found:
 83                    env_lines.append(f"USER_ID={user_id}\n")
 84
 85                # Write updated .env file
 86                with open(env_file, "w") as f:
 87                    f.writelines(env_lines)
 88
 89                results["updated_files"].append(str(env_file))
 90
 91            except Exception as e:
 92                results["errors"].append(f"Error updating {env_file}: {str(e)}")
 93                results["success"] = False
 94                continue
 95
 96            # Update docker-compose.yml to ensure USER_ID is passed as environment variable
 97            docker_compose_file = dir_path / "docker-compose.yml"
 98
 99            try:
100                if docker_compose_file.exists():
101                    with open(docker_compose_file, "r") as f:
102                        content = f.read()
103
104                    # Parse and update USER_ID in docker-compose.yml properly
105                    lines = content.split("\n")
106                    new_lines = []
107                    in_environment_section = False
108                    user_id_updated = False
109
110                    for line in lines:
111                        if "environment:" in line and not line.strip().startswith("#"):
112                            in_environment_section = True
113                            new_lines.append(line)
114                        elif in_environment_section and line.strip().startswith(
115                            "- USER_ID="
116                        ):
117                            # Replace existing USER_ID line
118                            new_lines.append(f"      - USER_ID={user_id}")
119                            user_id_updated = True
120                        elif in_environment_section and line.startswith("      - "):
121                            # Other environment variables
122                            new_lines.append(line)
123                        elif (
124                            in_environment_section
125                            and not line.startswith("      ")
126                            and line.strip()
127                        ):
128                            # End of environment section
129                            if not user_id_updated:
130                                # Add USER_ID if it wasn't found
131                                new_lines.insert(-1, f"      - USER_ID={user_id}")
132                            in_environment_section = False
133                            new_lines.append(line)
134                        else:
135                            new_lines.append(line)
136
137                    # If we're still in environment section at end of file and USER_ID wasn't updated
138                    if in_environment_section and not user_id_updated:
139                        new_lines.append(f"      - USER_ID={user_id}")
140
141                    # Write updated docker-compose.yml
142                    with open(docker_compose_file, "w") as f:
