143                        f.write("\n".join(new_lines))
144
145                    results["updated_files"].append(str(docker_compose_file))
146
147            except Exception as e:
148                results["errors"].append(
149                    f"Error updating {docker_compose_file}: {str(e)}"
150                )
151                # Don't fail the whole operation for docker-compose.yml issues
152
153        return results
154
155    def restart_lightrag_services(self, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
156        """
157        Restart LightRAG services with smart restart logic to handle port conflicts.
158        Implements the same logic as smart-restart-lightrag.sh.
159
160        Args:
161            user_id: User ID to set (optional, uses current USER_ID if not provided)
162
163        Returns:
164            Dictionary with operation results
165        """
166        if user_id is None:
167            from personal_agent.config import get_userid
168
169            user_id = get_userid()
170
171        results = {
172            "success": True,
173            "user_id": user_id,
174            "services_restarted": [],
175            "errors": [],
176            "status": {},
177        }
178
179        # Update USER_ID in docker-compose files
180        update_result = self.update_docker_compose_user_id(user_id)
181        if not update_result["success"]:
182            results["errors"].extend(update_result["errors"])
183            results["success"] = False
184            return results
185
186        # Smart restart services with port conflict handling
187        services = [
188            (
189                "lightrag_server",
190                self.lightrag_server_dir,
191                os.getenv("LIGHTRAG_SERVER_PORT", 9621),
192            ),
193            (
194                "lightrag_memory_server",
195                self.lightrag_memory_dir,
196                os.getenv("LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_PORT", 9622),
197            ),
198        ]
199
200        # Step 1: Smart stop all services
201        for dir_name, dir_path, port in services:
202            if not dir_path.exists():
203                results["errors"].append(f"Directory {dir_name} not found")
204                continue
205
206            try:
207                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
208                os.chdir(dir_path)
209
210                # Graceful shutdown
211                stop_result = subprocess.run(
212                    ["docker-compose", "down"],
213                    capture_output=True,
214                    text=True,
215                    timeout=60,
216                )
217
218                if stop_result.returncode != 0:
219                    results["errors"].append(
220                        f"Failed to stop {dir_name}: {stop_result.stderr}"
221                    )
222                    results["success"] = False
223                else:
224                    # Wait for port to be released
225                    self._wait_for_port_release(port, timeout=30)
226
227                os.chdir(original_cwd)
228
229            except Exception as e:
230                results["errors"].append(f"Error stopping {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
231                results["success"] = False
232            finally:
233                try:
234                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
235                except:
236                    pass
237
238        # Step 2: Wait for complete cleanup
239        time.sleep(5)
240
241        # Step 3: Clean up Docker networks
242        try:
243            subprocess.run(
244                ["docker", "network", "prune", "-f"],
245                capture_output=True,
246                text=True,
247                timeout=30,
248            )
249        except Exception:
250            # Network cleanup is optional
251            pass
252
253        # Step 4: Smart start all services
254        for dir_name, dir_path, port in services:
255            if not dir_path.exists():
256                continue
257
258            try:
259                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
260                os.chdir(dir_path)
261
262                # Verify port is available before starting
263                if not self._is_port_available(port):
264                    results["errors"].append(
265                        f"Port {port} is still in use for {dir_name}"
266                    )
267                    results["success"] = False
268                    continue
269
270                # Start service with retries
271                for attempt in range(3):
272                    start_result = subprocess.run(
273                        ["docker-compose", "up", "-d"],
274                        capture_output=True,
275                        text=True,
276                        timeout=120,
277                    )
278
279                    if start_result.returncode == 0:
280                        # Wait for service to initialize
281                        time.sleep(3)
282
283                        # Verify container is running
284                        if self._is_container_running(dir_name):
285                            results["services_restarted"].append(dir_name)
286                            break
287                        else:
288                            if attempt < 2:  # Not the last attempt
289                                time.sleep(2)
290                                continue
291                            else:
292                                results["errors"].append(
293                                    f"Container for {dir_name} failed to start properly"
294                                )
295                                results["success"] = False
296                    else:
297                        if "port is already allocated" in start_result.stderr.lower():
298                            # Port conflict - wait and retry
299                            if attempt < 2:
300                                time.sleep(5)
301                                continue
302
303                        results["errors"].append(
304                            f"Failed to start {dir_name}: {start_result.stderr}"
305                        )
306                        results["success"] = False
307                        break
308
309                os.chdir(original_cwd)
310
311            except Exception as e:
312                results["errors"].append(f"Error starting {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
313                results["success"] = False
314            finally:
315                try:
316                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
317                except:
318                    pass
319
320        # Get final service status
321        if results["services_restarted"]:
322            time.sleep(2)
323            results["status"] = self.get_service_status()
324
325        return results
326
327    def _is_port_available(self, port: int) -> bool:
328        """Check if a port is available."""
329        import socket
330
331        try:
332            with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as sock:
333                sock.settimeout(1)
334                result = sock.connect_ex(("localhost", port))
335                return result != 0  # Port is available if connection fails
336        except Exception:
337            return True  # Assume available if we can't check
338
339    def _wait_for_port_release(self, port: int, timeout: int = 30) -> bool:
340        """Wait for a port to be released."""
341        import socket
342
343        start_time = time.time()
344
345        while time.time() - start_time < timeout:
346            try:
347                with socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) as sock:
348                    sock.settimeout(1)
349                    result = sock.connect_ex(("localhost", port))
350                    if result != 0:  # Port is available
351                        return True
352            except Exception:
353                return True  # Assume available if we can't check
354
355            time.sleep(1)
356
357        return False  # Timeout reached
358
359    def _is_container_running(self, service_name: str) -> bool:
360        """Check if a container is running."""
361        try:
362            # Map service names to container names
363            container_map = {
364                "lightrag_server": "lightrag_pagent",
365                "lightrag_memory_server": "lightrag_memory",
366            }
367
368            container_name = container_map.get(service_name, service_name)
369
370            result = subprocess.run(
371                [
372                    "docker",
373                    "ps",
374                    "--filter",
375                    f"name={container_name}",
376                    "--format",
377                    "{{.Names}}",
378                ],
379                capture_output=True,
380                text=True,
381                timeout=10,
382            )
383
384            return container_name in result.stdout
385
386        except Exception:
387            return False
388
389    def get_service_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
390        """
391        Get current docker-compose service status.
392        Equivalent to: docker-compose ps
393
394        Returns:
395            Dictionary with service status information
396        """
397        status = {
398            "lightrag_server": {},
399            "lightrag_memory_server": {},
400            "ollama_config": {},
401        }
402
403        # Check status for both directories
404        directories = [
405            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
406            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
407        ]
408
409        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
410            if not dir_path.exists():
411                status[dir_name] = {"error": "Directory not found"}
412                continue
413
414            try:
415                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
416                os.chdir(dir_path)
417
418                # Get docker-compose status
419                ps_result = subprocess.run(
420                    ["docker-compose", "ps", "--format", "json"],
421                    capture_output=True,
422                    text=True,
423                    timeout=30,
424                )
425
426                if ps_result.returncode == 0:
427                    try:
428                        import json
429
430                        services = (
431                            json.loads(ps_result.stdout)
432                            if ps_result.stdout.strip()
433                            else []
434                        )
435                        status[dir_name] = {
436                            "services": services,
437                            "running": len(
438                                [s for s in services if s.get("State") == "running"]
439                            ),
440                        }
441                    except json.JSONDecodeError:
442                        # Fallback to simple text parsing
443                        status[dir_name] = {
444                            "output": ps_result.stdout,
445                            "running": "running" in ps_result.stdout.lower(),
446                        }
447                else:
448                    status[dir_name] = {"error": ps_result.stderr}
449
450                # Get Ollama configuration for lightrag_server
451                if dir_name == "lightrag_server":
452                    env_file = dir_path / ".env"
453                    if env_file.exists():
454                        try:
455                            with open(env_file, "r") as f:
456                                for line in f:
457                                    if line.startswith("OLLAMA_URL="):
458                                        ollama_url = line.split("=", 1)[1].strip()
459                                        status["ollama_config"]["url"] = ollama_url
460
461                                        # Determine mode
462                                        if "host.docker.internal" in ollama_url:
463                                            status["ollama_config"]["mode"] = "LOCAL"
464                                        elif "100.100.248.61" in ollama_url:
465                                            status["ollama_config"]["mode"] = "REMOTE"
466                                        else:
467                                            status["ollama_config"]["mode"] = "CUSTOM"
468                                        break
469                        except Exception as e:
470                            status["ollama_config"]["error"] = str(e)
471
472                os.chdir(original_cwd)
473
474            except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
475                status[dir_name] = {"error": "Timeout getting status"}
476            except Exception as e:
477                status[dir_name] = {"error": str(e)}
478            finally:
479                try:
480                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
481                except:
482                    pass
483
484        return status
485
486    def stop_services(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
487        """
488        Stop all LightRAG services.
489
490        Returns:
491            Dictionary with operation results
492        """
493        results = {"success": True, "services_stopped": [], "errors": []}
494
495        directories = [
496            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
497            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
498        ]
499
500        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
501            if not dir_path.exists():
502                continue
503
504            try:
505                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
506                os.chdir(dir_path)
507
508                stop_result = subprocess.run(
509                    ["docker-compose", "down"],
510                    capture_output=True,
511                    text=True,
512                    timeout=60,
513                )
514
515                if stop_result.returncode == 0:
516                    results["services_stopped"].append(dir_name)
517                else:
518                    results["errors"].append(
519                        f"Failed to stop {dir_name}: {stop_result.stderr}"
520                    )
521                    results["success"] = False
522
523                os.chdir(original_cwd)
524
525            except Exception as e:
526                results["errors"].append(f"Error stopping {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
527                results["success"] = False
528            finally:
529                try:
530                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
531                except:
532                    pass
533
534        return results
535
536    def start_services(self, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
537        """
538        Start all LightRAG services.
539
540        Args:
541            user_id: User ID to set before starting (optional)
542
543        Returns:
544            Dictionary with operation results
545        """
546        results = {"success": True, "services_started": [], "errors": []}
547
548        # Update USER_ID if provided
549        if user_id:
550            update_result = self.update_docker_compose_user_id(user_id)
551            if not update_result["success"]:
552                results["errors"].extend(update_result["errors"])
553                results["success"] = False
554                return results
555
556        directories = [
557            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
558            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
559        ]
560
561        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
562            if not dir_path.exists():
563                continue
564
565            try:
566                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
567                os.chdir(dir_path)
568
569                start_result = subprocess.run(
570                    ["docker-compose", "up", "-d"],
571                    capture_output=True,
572                    text=True,
573                    timeout=120,
574                )
575
576                if start_result.returncode == 0:
577                    results["services_started"].append(dir_name)
578                else:
579                    results["errors"].append(
580                        f"Failed to start {dir_name}: {start_result.stderr}"
581                    )
582                    results["success"] = False
583
584                os.chdir(original_cwd)
585
586            except Exception as e:
587                results["errors"].append(f"Error starting {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
588                results["success"] = False
589            finally:
590                try:
591                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
592                except:
593                    pass
594
595        return results

Manages LightRAG Docker services with Python implementation of restart-lightrag.sh.

LightRAGManager(project_root: str = None) 
19    def __init__(self, project_root: str = None):
20        """
21        Initialize the LightRAG manager.
22
23        Args:
24            project_root: Project root directory (deprecated, now uses PERSAG_HOME)
25        """
26        # Import settings to get the correct PERSAG_HOME-based paths
27        from personal_agent.config.settings import (
28            LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_DIR,
29            LIGHTRAG_SERVER_DIR,
30        )
31
32        # Use the centralized configuration paths from PERSAG_HOME
33        self.lightrag_server_dir = Path(LIGHTRAG_SERVER_DIR)
34        self.lightrag_memory_dir = Path(LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_DIR)
35
36        # Keep project_root for backward compatibility, but it's no longer used for docker paths
37        self.project_root = Path(project_root) if project_root else Path.cwd()

Initialize the LightRAG manager.

Args: project_root: Project root directory (deprecated, now uses PERSAG_HOME)

lightrag_server_dir
lightrag_memory_dir
project_root
def update_docker_compose_user_id(self, user_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
 39    def update_docker_compose_user_id(self, user_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 40        """
 41        Update USER_ID in docker-compose .env files and docker-compose.yml files.
 42
 43        Args:
 44            user_id: User ID to set in environment files
 45
 46        Returns:
 47            Dictionary with operation results
 48        """
 49        results = {"success": True, "updated_files": [], "errors": []}
 50
 51        # List of directories to update
 52        directories = [
 53            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
 54            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
 55        ]
 56
 57        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
 58            if not dir_path.exists():
 59                results["errors"].append(
 60                    f"Directory {dir_name} not found at {dir_path}"
 61                )
 62                continue
 63
 64            # Update .env file
 65            env_file = dir_path / ".env"
 66
 67            try:
 68                # Read existing .env file or create new one
 69                env_lines = []
 70                user_id_found = False
 71
 72                if env_file.exists():
 73                    with open(env_file, "r") as f:
 74                        for line in f:
 75                            if line.startswith("USER_ID="):
 76                                env_lines.append(f"USER_ID={user_id}\n")
 77                                user_id_found = True
 78                            else:
 79                                env_lines.append(line)
 80
 81                # Add USER_ID if not found
 82                if not user_id_found:
 83                    env_lines.append(f"USER_ID={user_id}\n")
 84
 85                # Write updated .env file
 86                with open(env_file, "w") as f:
 87                    f.writelines(env_lines)
 88
 89                results["updated_files"].append(str(env_file))
 90
 91            except Exception as e:
 92                results["errors"].append(f"Error updating {env_file}: {str(e)}")
 93                results["success"] = False
 94                continue
 95
 96            # Update docker-compose.yml to ensure USER_ID is passed as environment variable
 97            docker_compose_file = dir_path / "docker-compose.yml"
 98
 99            try:
100                if docker_compose_file.exists():
101                    with open(docker_compose_file, "r") as f:
102                        content = f.read()
103
104                    # Parse and update USER_ID in docker-compose.yml properly
105                    lines = content.split("\n")
106                    new_lines = []
107                    in_environment_section = False
108                    user_id_updated = False
109
110                    for line in lines:
111                        if "environment:" in line and not line.strip().startswith("#"):
112                            in_environment_section = True
113                            new_lines.append(line)
114                        elif in_environment_section and line.strip().startswith(
115                            "- USER_ID="
116                        ):
117                            # Replace existing USER_ID line
118                            new_lines.append(f"      - USER_ID={user_id}")
119                            user_id_updated = True
120                        elif in_environment_section and line.startswith("      - "):
121                            # Other environment variables
122                            new_lines.append(line)
123                        elif (
124                            in_environment_section
125                            and not line.startswith("      ")
126                            and line.strip()
127                        ):
128                            # End of environment section
129                            if not user_id_updated:
130                                # Add USER_ID if it wasn't found
131                                new_lines.insert(-1, f"      - USER_ID={user_id}")
132                            in_environment_section = False
133                            new_lines.append(line)
134                        else:
135                            new_lines.append(line)
136
137                    # If we're still in environment section at end of file and USER_ID wasn't updated
138                    if in_environment_section and not user_id_updated:
139                        new_lines.append(f"      - USER_ID={user_id}")
140
141                    # Write updated docker-compose.yml
142                    with open(docker_compose_file, "w") as f:
143                        f.write("\n".join(new_lines))
144
145                    results["updated_files"].append(str(docker_compose_file))
146
147            except Exception as e:
148                results["errors"].append(
149                    f"Error updating {docker_compose_file}: {str(e)}"
150                )
151                # Don't fail the whole operation for docker-compose.yml issues
152
153        return results

Update USER_ID in docker-compose .env files and docker-compose.yml files.

Args: user_id: User ID to set in environment files

Returns: Dictionary with operation results

def restart_lightrag_services(self, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
155    def restart_lightrag_services(self, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
156        """
157        Restart LightRAG services with smart restart logic to handle port conflicts.
158        Implements the same logic as smart-restart-lightrag.sh.
159
160        Args:
161            user_id: User ID to set (optional, uses current USER_ID if not provided)
162
163        Returns:
164            Dictionary with operation results
165        """
166        if user_id is None:
167            from personal_agent.config import get_userid
168
169            user_id = get_userid()
170
171        results = {
172            "success": True,
173            "user_id": user_id,
174            "services_restarted": [],
175            "errors": [],
176            "status": {},
177        }
178
179        # Update USER_ID in docker-compose files
180        update_result = self.update_docker_compose_user_id(user_id)
181        if not update_result["success"]:
182            results["errors"].extend(update_result["errors"])
183            results["success"] = False
184            return results
185
186        # Smart restart services with port conflict handling
187        services = [
188            (
189                "lightrag_server",
190                self.lightrag_server_dir,
191                os.getenv("LIGHTRAG_SERVER_PORT", 9621),
192            ),
193            (
194                "lightrag_memory_server",
195                self.lightrag_memory_dir,
196                os.getenv("LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_PORT", 9622),
197            ),
198        ]
199
200        # Step 1: Smart stop all services
201        for dir_name, dir_path, port in services:
202            if not dir_path.exists():
203                results["errors"].append(f"Directory {dir_name} not found")
204                continue
205
206            try:
207                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
208                os.chdir(dir_path)
209
210                # Graceful shutdown
211                stop_result = subprocess.run(
212                    ["docker-compose", "down"],
213                    capture_output=True,
214                    text=True,
215                    timeout=60,
216                )
217
218                if stop_result.returncode != 0:
219                    results["errors"].append(
220                        f"Failed to stop {dir_name}: {stop_result.stderr}"
221                    )
222                    results["success"] = False
223                else:
224                    # Wait for port to be released
225                    self._wait_for_port_release(port, timeout=30)
226
227                os.chdir(original_cwd)
228
229            except Exception as e:
230                results["errors"].append(f"Error stopping {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
231                results["success"] = False
232            finally:
233                try:
234                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
235                except:
236                    pass
237
238        # Step 2: Wait for complete cleanup
239        time.sleep(5)
240
241        # Step 3: Clean up Docker networks
242        try:
243            subprocess.run(
244                ["docker", "network", "prune", "-f"],
245                capture_output=True,
246                text=True,
247                timeout=30,
248            )
249        except Exception:
250            # Network cleanup is optional
251            pass
252
253        # Step 4: Smart start all services
254        for dir_name, dir_path, port in services:
255            if not dir_path.exists():
256                continue
257
258            try:
259                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
260                os.chdir(dir_path)
261
262                # Verify port is available before starting
263                if not self._is_port_available(port):
264                    results["errors"].append(
265                        f"Port {port} is still in use for {dir_name}"
266                    )
267                    results["success"] = False
268                    continue
269
270                # Start service with retries
271                for attempt in range(3):
272                    start_result = subprocess.run(
273                        ["docker-compose", "up", "-d"],
274                        capture_output=True,
275                        text=True,
276                        timeout=120,
277                    )
278
279                    if start_result.returncode == 0:
280                        # Wait for service to initialize
281                        time.sleep(3)
282
283                        # Verify container is running
284                        if self._is_container_running(dir_name):
285                            results["services_restarted"].append(dir_name)
286                            break
287                        else:
288                            if attempt < 2:  # Not the last attempt
289                                time.sleep(2)
290                                continue
291                            else:
292                                results["errors"].append(
293                                    f"Container for {dir_name} failed to start properly"
294                                )
295                                results["success"] = False
296                    else:
297                        if "port is already allocated" in start_result.stderr.lower():
298                            # Port conflict - wait and retry
299                            if attempt < 2:
300                                time.sleep(5)
301                                continue
302
303                        results["errors"].append(
304                            f"Failed to start {dir_name}: {start_result.stderr}"
305                        )
306                        results["success"] = False
307                        break
308
309                os.chdir(original_cwd)
310
311            except Exception as e:
312                results["errors"].append(f"Error starting {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
313                results["success"] = False
314            finally:
315                try:
316                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
317                except:
318                    pass
319
320        # Get final service status
321        if results["services_restarted"]:
322            time.sleep(2)
323            results["status"] = self.get_service_status()
324
325        return results

Restart LightRAG services with smart restart logic to handle port conflicts. Implements the same logic as smart-restart-lightrag.sh.

Args: user_id: User ID to set (optional, uses current USER_ID if not provided)

Returns: Dictionary with operation results

def get_service_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
389    def get_service_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
390        """
391        Get current docker-compose service status.
392        Equivalent to: docker-compose ps
393
394        Returns:
395            Dictionary with service status information
396        """
397        status = {
398            "lightrag_server": {},
399            "lightrag_memory_server": {},
400            "ollama_config": {},
401        }
402
403        # Check status for both directories
404        directories = [
405            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
406            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
407        ]
408
409        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
410            if not dir_path.exists():
411                status[dir_name] = {"error": "Directory not found"}
412                continue
413
414            try:
415                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
416                os.chdir(dir_path)
417
418                # Get docker-compose status
419                ps_result = subprocess.run(
420                    ["docker-compose", "ps", "--format", "json"],
421                    capture_output=True,
422                    text=True,
423                    timeout=30,
424                )
425
426                if ps_result.returncode == 0:
427                    try:
428                        import json
429
430                        services = (
431                            json.loads(ps_result.stdout)
432                            if ps_result.stdout.strip()
433                            else []
434                        )
435                        status[dir_name] = {
436                            "services": services,
437                            "running": len(
438                                [s for s in services if s.get("State") == "running"]
439                            ),
440                        }
441                    except json.JSONDecodeError:
442                        # Fallback to simple text parsing
443                        status[dir_name] = {
444                            "output": ps_result.stdout,
445                            "running": "running" in ps_result.stdout.lower(),
446                        }
447                else:
448                    status[dir_name] = {"error": ps_result.stderr}
449
450                # Get Ollama configuration for lightrag_server
451                if dir_name == "lightrag_server":
452                    env_file = dir_path / ".env"
453                    if env_file.exists():
454                        try:
455                            with open(env_file, "r") as f:
456                                for line in f:
457                                    if line.startswith("OLLAMA_URL="):
458                                        ollama_url = line.split("=", 1)[1].strip()
459                                        status["ollama_config"]["url"] = ollama_url
460
461                                        # Determine mode
462                                        if "host.docker.internal" in ollama_url:
463                                            status["ollama_config"]["mode"] = "LOCAL"
464                                        elif "100.100.248.61" in ollama_url:
465                                            status["ollama_config"]["mode"] = "REMOTE"
466                                        else:
467                                            status["ollama_config"]["mode"] = "CUSTOM"
468                                        break
469                        except Exception as e:
470                            status["ollama_config"]["error"] = str(e)
471
472                os.chdir(original_cwd)
473
474            except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
475                status[dir_name] = {"error": "Timeout getting status"}
476            except Exception as e:
477                status[dir_name] = {"error": str(e)}
478            finally:
479                try:
480                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
481                except:
482                    pass
483
484        return status

Get current docker-compose service status. Equivalent to: docker-compose ps

Returns: Dictionary with service status information

def stop_services(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
486    def stop_services(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
487        """
488        Stop all LightRAG services.
489
490        Returns:
491            Dictionary with operation results
492        """
493        results = {"success": True, "services_stopped": [], "errors": []}
494
495        directories = [
496            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
497            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
498        ]
499
500        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
501            if not dir_path.exists():
502                continue
503
504            try:
505                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
506                os.chdir(dir_path)
507
508                stop_result = subprocess.run(
509                    ["docker-compose", "down"],
510                    capture_output=True,
511                    text=True,
512                    timeout=60,
513                )
514
515                if stop_result.returncode == 0:
516                    results["services_stopped"].append(dir_name)
517                else:
518                    results["errors"].append(
519                        f"Failed to stop {dir_name}: {stop_result.stderr}"
520                    )
521                    results["success"] = False
522
523                os.chdir(original_cwd)
524
525            except Exception as e:
526                results["errors"].append(f"Error stopping {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
527                results["success"] = False
528            finally:
529                try:
530                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
531                except:
532                    pass
533
534        return results

Stop all LightRAG services.

Returns: Dictionary with operation results

def start_services(self, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
536    def start_services(self, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
537        """
538        Start all LightRAG services.
539
540        Args:
541            user_id: User ID to set before starting (optional)
542
543        Returns:
544            Dictionary with operation results
545        """
546        results = {"success": True, "services_started": [], "errors": []}
547
548        # Update USER_ID if provided
549        if user_id:
550            update_result = self.update_docker_compose_user_id(user_id)
551            if not update_result["success"]:
552                results["errors"].extend(update_result["errors"])
553                results["success"] = False
554                return results
555
556        directories = [
557            ("lightrag_server", self.lightrag_server_dir),
558            ("lightrag_memory_server", self.lightrag_memory_dir),
559        ]
560
561        for dir_name, dir_path in directories:
562            if not dir_path.exists():
563                continue
564
565            try:
566                original_cwd = os.getcwd()
567                os.chdir(dir_path)
568
569                start_result = subprocess.run(
570                    ["docker-compose", "up", "-d"],
571                    capture_output=True,
572                    text=True,
573                    timeout=120,
574                )
575
576                if start_result.returncode == 0:
577                    results["services_started"].append(dir_name)
578                else:
579                    results["errors"].append(
580                        f"Failed to start {dir_name}: {start_result.stderr}"
581                    )
582                    results["success"] = False
583
584                os.chdir(original_cwd)
585
586            except Exception as e:
587                results["errors"].append(f"Error starting {dir_name}: {str(e)}")
588                results["success"] = False
589            finally:
590                try:
591                    os.chdir(original_cwd)
592                except:
593                    pass
594
595        return results

Start all LightRAG services.

Args: user_id: User ID to set before starting (optional)

Returns: Dictionary with operation results

class DockerIntegrationManager: 
 40class DockerIntegrationManager:
 41    """Manages Docker integration for the personal agent system."""
 42    
 43    def __init__(self, user_id: Optional[str] = None):
 44        """Initialize the Docker integration manager.
 45        
 46        Args:
 47            user_id: User ID to ensure consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID)
 48        """
 49        self.user_id = user_id or get_userid()
 50        
 51        # Fix: Use the same robust project root detection as DockerUserSync
 52        current_path = Path(__file__).resolve()
 53        project_root = None
 54        
 55        # Walk up the directory tree looking for project markers
 56        for parent in current_path.parents:
 57            # Look for common project root indicators
 58            if any((parent / marker).exists() for marker in [
 59                'pyproject.toml', 'setup.py', '.git',
 60                'lightrag_server', 'lightrag_memory_server'
 61            ]):
 62                project_root = parent
 63                break
 64        
 65        if project_root is None:
 66            # Fallback to the old method if no markers found
 67            project_root = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent.parent.resolve()
 68            logger.warning("DockerIntegrationManager: Using fallback path detection")
 69        
 70        self.base_dir = project_root
 71        
 72        # Initialize Docker sync manager if available
 73        self.docker_sync = None
 74        if DockerUserSync:
 75            try:
 76                self.docker_sync = DockerUserSync(dry_run=False)
 77                logger.debug("Docker sync manager initialized successfully")
 78            except Exception as e:
 79                logger.warning(f"Failed to initialize Docker sync manager: {e}")
 80        else:
 81            logger.warning("DockerUserSync not available - Docker integration disabled")
 82
 83    def check_docker_consistency(self) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 84        """Check if Docker configurations are consistent with system USER_ID.
 85        
 86        Returns:
 87            Tuple of (is_consistent, message)
 88        """
 89        if not self.docker_sync:
 90            return True, "Docker sync not available - skipping consistency check"
 91        
 92        try:
 93            results = self.docker_sync.check_user_id_consistency()
 94            all_consistent = all(result['consistent'] for result in results.values())
 95            
 96            if all_consistent:
 97                return True, f"All Docker configurations consistent with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
 98            else:
 99                inconsistent_servers = [
100                    name for name, result in results.items() 
101                    if not result['consistent']
102                ]
103                return False, f"Inconsistent Docker servers: {', '.join(inconsistent_servers)}"
104                
105        except Exception as e:
106            logger.error(f"Error checking Docker consistency: {e}")
107            return False, f"Error checking Docker consistency: {e}"
108
109    def ensure_docker_consistency(self, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
110        """Ensure Docker configurations are consistent with system USER_ID.
111        
112        Args:
113            force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running
114            
115        Returns:
116            Tuple of (success, message)
117        """
118        if not self.docker_sync:
119            return True, "Docker sync not available - skipping consistency enforcement"
120        
121        try:
122            # First check if sync is needed
123            is_consistent, check_message = self.check_docker_consistency()
124            
125            if is_consistent and not force_restart:
126                logger.info("Docker configurations already consistent")
127                return True, check_message
128            elif is_consistent and force_restart:
129                logger.info("Docker configurations consistent, but force restart requested")
130                # Perform synchronization with force restart even if consistent
131                success = self.docker_sync.sync_user_ids(force_restart=True)
132                if success:
133                    message = f"Successfully force restarted Docker containers with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
134                    logger.info(message)
135                    return True, message
136                else:
137                    message = "Failed to force restart Docker containers"
138                    logger.error(message)
139                    return False, message
140            else:
141                logger.info(f"Docker inconsistency detected: {check_message}")
142                logger.info("Attempting to synchronize Docker configurations...")
143                
144                # Perform synchronization
145                success = self.docker_sync.sync_user_ids(force_restart=force_restart)
146                
147                if success:
148                    message = f"Successfully synchronized Docker configurations with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
149                    logger.info(message)
150                    return True, message
151                else:
152                    message = "Failed to synchronize Docker configurations"
153                    logger.error(message)
154                    return False, message
155                
156        except Exception as e:
157            error_msg = f"Error ensuring Docker consistency: {e}"
158            logger.error(error_msg)
159            return False, error_msg
160
161    def validate_system_consistency(self) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
162        """Perform comprehensive validation of system consistency.
163        
164        Returns:
165            Tuple of (is_consistent, message)
166        """
167        if not self.docker_sync:
168            return True, "Docker sync not available - skipping validation"
169        
170        try:
171            is_consistent = self.docker_sync.validate_system_consistency()
172            
173            if is_consistent:
174                return True, f"System is fully consistent with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
175            else:
176                return False, "System inconsistencies detected - check logs for details"
177                
178        except Exception as e:
179            error_msg = f"Error validating system consistency: {e}"
180            logger.error(error_msg)
181            return False, error_msg
182
183    def pre_initialization_check(self, auto_fix: bool = True, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
184        """Perform pre-initialization consistency check and optional auto-fix.
185        
186        This method should be called before initializing the personal agent system
187        to ensure Docker configurations are consistent.
188        
189        Args:
190            auto_fix: If True, automatically fix inconsistencies
191            force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running
192            
193        Returns:
194            Tuple of (ready_to_proceed, message)
195        """
196        logger.info(f"Performing pre-initialization Docker consistency check for USER_ID: {self.user_id}")
197        
198        # Check current consistency
199        is_consistent, check_message = self.check_docker_consistency()
200        
201        if is_consistent and not force_restart:
202            logger.info("Pre-initialization check passed - Docker configurations consistent")
203            return True, check_message
204        elif is_consistent and force_restart:
205            logger.info("Docker configurations consistent, but force restart requested")
206            # Even if consistent, we need to restart if force_restart is True
207            if auto_fix:
208                logger.info("Performing force restart of Docker containers...")
209                fix_success, fix_message = self.ensure_docker_consistency(force_restart=True)
210                if fix_success:
211                    return True, f"Force restart completed: {fix_message}"
212                else:
213                    return False, f"Force restart failed: {fix_message}"
214            else:
215                return True, f"Consistent but force restart requested (auto-fix disabled): {check_message}"
216        
217        logger.warning(f"Pre-initialization check failed: {check_message}")
218        
219        if not auto_fix:
220            return False, f"Docker inconsistency detected (auto-fix disabled): {check_message}"
221        
222        logger.info("Attempting to auto-fix Docker inconsistencies...")
223        
224        # Attempt to fix inconsistencies
225        fix_success, fix_message = self.ensure_docker_consistency(force_restart=force_restart)
226        
227        if fix_success:
228            logger.info("Auto-fix successful - system ready for initialization")
229            return True, f"Auto-fixed Docker inconsistencies: {fix_message}"
230        else:
231            logger.error("Auto-fix failed - manual intervention required")
232            return False, f"Failed to auto-fix Docker inconsistencies: {fix_message}"

Manages Docker integration for the personal agent system.

DockerIntegrationManager(user_id: Optional[str] = None) 
43    def __init__(self, user_id: Optional[str] = None):
44        """Initialize the Docker integration manager.
45        
46        Args:
47            user_id: User ID to ensure consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID)
48        """
49        self.user_id = user_id or get_userid()
50        
51        # Fix: Use the same robust project root detection as DockerUserSync
52        current_path = Path(__file__).resolve()
53        project_root = None
54        
55        # Walk up the directory tree looking for project markers
56        for parent in current_path.parents:
57            # Look for common project root indicators
58            if any((parent / marker).exists() for marker in [
59                'pyproject.toml', 'setup.py', '.git',
60                'lightrag_server', 'lightrag_memory_server'
61            ]):
62                project_root = parent
63                break
64        
65        if project_root is None:
66            # Fallback to the old method if no markers found
67            project_root = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent.parent.resolve()
68            logger.warning("DockerIntegrationManager: Using fallback path detection")
69        
70        self.base_dir = project_root
71        
72        # Initialize Docker sync manager if available
73        self.docker_sync = None
74        if DockerUserSync:
75            try:
76                self.docker_sync = DockerUserSync(dry_run=False)
77                logger.debug("Docker sync manager initialized successfully")
78            except Exception as e:
79                logger.warning(f"Failed to initialize Docker sync manager: {e}")
80        else:
81            logger.warning("DockerUserSync not available - Docker integration disabled")

Initialize the Docker integration manager.

Args: user_id: User ID to ensure consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID)

user_id
base_dir
docker_sync
def check_docker_consistency(self) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
 83    def check_docker_consistency(self) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 84        """Check if Docker configurations are consistent with system USER_ID.
 85        
 86        Returns:
 87            Tuple of (is_consistent, message)
 88        """
 89        if not self.docker_sync:
 90            return True, "Docker sync not available - skipping consistency check"
 91        
 92        try:
 93            results = self.docker_sync.check_user_id_consistency()
 94            all_consistent = all(result['consistent'] for result in results.values())
 95            
 96            if all_consistent:
 97                return True, f"All Docker configurations consistent with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
 98            else:
 99                inconsistent_servers = [
100                    name for name, result in results.items() 
101                    if not result['consistent']
102                ]
103                return False, f"Inconsistent Docker servers: {', '.join(inconsistent_servers)}"
104                
105        except Exception as e:
106            logger.error(f"Error checking Docker consistency: {e}")
107            return False, f"Error checking Docker consistency: {e}"

Check if Docker configurations are consistent with system USER_ID.

Returns: Tuple of (is_consistent, message)

def ensure_docker_consistency(self, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
109    def ensure_docker_consistency(self, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
110        """Ensure Docker configurations are consistent with system USER_ID.
111        
112        Args:
113            force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running
114            
115        Returns:
116            Tuple of (success, message)
117        """
118        if not self.docker_sync:
119            return True, "Docker sync not available - skipping consistency enforcement"
120        
121        try:
122            # First check if sync is needed
123            is_consistent, check_message = self.check_docker_consistency()
124            
125            if is_consistent and not force_restart:
126                logger.info("Docker configurations already consistent")
127                return True, check_message
128            elif is_consistent and force_restart:
129                logger.info("Docker configurations consistent, but force restart requested")
130                # Perform synchronization with force restart even if consistent
131                success = self.docker_sync.sync_user_ids(force_restart=True)
132                if success:
133                    message = f"Successfully force restarted Docker containers with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
134                    logger.info(message)
135                    return True, message
136                else:
137                    message = "Failed to force restart Docker containers"
138                    logger.error(message)
139                    return False, message
140            else:
141                logger.info(f"Docker inconsistency detected: {check_message}")
142                logger.info("Attempting to synchronize Docker configurations...")
143                
144                # Perform synchronization
145                success = self.docker_sync.sync_user_ids(force_restart=force_restart)
146                
147                if success:
148                    message = f"Successfully synchronized Docker configurations with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
149                    logger.info(message)
150                    return True, message
151                else:
152                    message = "Failed to synchronize Docker configurations"
153                    logger.error(message)
154                    return False, message
155                
156        except Exception as e:
157            error_msg = f"Error ensuring Docker consistency: {e}"
158            logger.error(error_msg)
159            return False, error_msg

Ensure Docker configurations are consistent with system USER_ID.

Args: force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running

Returns: Tuple of (success, message)

def validate_system_consistency(self) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
161    def validate_system_consistency(self) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
162        """Perform comprehensive validation of system consistency.
163        
164        Returns:
165            Tuple of (is_consistent, message)
166        """
167        if not self.docker_sync:
168            return True, "Docker sync not available - skipping validation"
169        
170        try:
171            is_consistent = self.docker_sync.validate_system_consistency()
172            
173            if is_consistent:
174                return True, f"System is fully consistent with USER_ID: {self.user_id}"
175            else:
176                return False, "System inconsistencies detected - check logs for details"
177                
178        except Exception as e:
179            error_msg = f"Error validating system consistency: {e}"
180            logger.error(error_msg)
181            return False, error_msg

Perform comprehensive validation of system consistency.

Returns: Tuple of (is_consistent, message)

def pre_initialization_check( self, auto_fix: bool = True, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
183    def pre_initialization_check(self, auto_fix: bool = True, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
184        """Perform pre-initialization consistency check and optional auto-fix.
185        
186        This method should be called before initializing the personal agent system
187        to ensure Docker configurations are consistent.
188        
189        Args:
190            auto_fix: If True, automatically fix inconsistencies
191            force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running
192            
193        Returns:
194            Tuple of (ready_to_proceed, message)
195        """
196        logger.info(f"Performing pre-initialization Docker consistency check for USER_ID: {self.user_id}")
197        
198        # Check current consistency
199        is_consistent, check_message = self.check_docker_consistency()
200        
201        if is_consistent and not force_restart:
202            logger.info("Pre-initialization check passed - Docker configurations consistent")
203            return True, check_message
204        elif is_consistent and force_restart:
205            logger.info("Docker configurations consistent, but force restart requested")
206            # Even if consistent, we need to restart if force_restart is True
207            if auto_fix:
208                logger.info("Performing force restart of Docker containers...")
209                fix_success, fix_message = self.ensure_docker_consistency(force_restart=True)
210                if fix_success:
211                    return True, f"Force restart completed: {fix_message}"
212                else:
213                    return False, f"Force restart failed: {fix_message}"
214            else:
215                return True, f"Consistent but force restart requested (auto-fix disabled): {check_message}"
216        
217        logger.warning(f"Pre-initialization check failed: {check_message}")
218        
219        if not auto_fix:
220            return False, f"Docker inconsistency detected (auto-fix disabled): {check_message}"
221        
222        logger.info("Attempting to auto-fix Docker inconsistencies...")
223        
224        # Attempt to fix inconsistencies
225        fix_success, fix_message = self.ensure_docker_consistency(force_restart=force_restart)
226        
227        if fix_success:
228            logger.info("Auto-fix successful - system ready for initialization")
229            return True, f"Auto-fixed Docker inconsistencies: {fix_message}"
230        else:
231            logger.error("Auto-fix failed - manual intervention required")
232            return False, f"Failed to auto-fix Docker inconsistencies: {fix_message}"

Perform pre-initialization consistency check and optional auto-fix.

This method should be called before initializing the personal agent system to ensure Docker configurations are consistent.

Args: auto_fix: If True, automatically fix inconsistencies force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running

Returns: Tuple of (ready_to_proceed, message)

def check_docker_user_consistency(user_id: Optional[str] = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
258def check_docker_user_consistency(user_id: Optional[str] = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
259    """Convenience function to check Docker USER_ID consistency without fixing.
260    
261    Args:
262        user_id: User ID to check consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID)
263        
264    Returns:
265        Tuple of (is_consistent, message)
266    """
267    try:
268        manager = DockerIntegrationManager(user_id=user_id)
269        return manager.check_docker_consistency()
270    except Exception as e:
271        error_msg = f"Error checking Docker consistency: {e}"
272        logger.error(error_msg)
273        return False, error_msg

Convenience function to check Docker USER_ID consistency without fixing.

Args: user_id: User ID to check consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID)

Returns: Tuple of (is_consistent, message)

def ensure_docker_user_consistency( user_id: Optional[str] = None, auto_fix: bool = True, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]: 
235def ensure_docker_user_consistency(user_id: Optional[str] = None, auto_fix: bool = True, force_restart: bool = False) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
236    """Convenience function to ensure Docker USER_ID consistency.
237    
238    This function can be called from agent initialization code to ensure
239    Docker configurations are consistent before proceeding.
240    
241    Args:
242        user_id: User ID to ensure consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID)
243        auto_fix: If True, automatically fix inconsistencies
244        force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running
245        
246    Returns:
247        Tuple of (ready_to_proceed, message)
248    """
249    try:
250        manager = DockerIntegrationManager(user_id=user_id)
251        return manager.pre_initialization_check(auto_fix=auto_fix, force_restart=force_restart)
252    except Exception as e:
253        error_msg = f"Error in Docker consistency check: {e}"
254        logger.error(error_msg)
255        return False, error_msg

Convenience function to ensure Docker USER_ID consistency.

This function can be called from agent initialization code to ensure Docker configurations are consistent before proceeding.

Args: user_id: User ID to ensure consistency for (defaults to system USER_ID) auto_fix: If True, automatically fix inconsistencies force_restart: If True, restart containers even if not running

Returns: Tuple of (ready_to_proceed, message)

def extract_content_from_smollm2_response(text: str) -> str: 
113def extract_content_from_smollm2_response(text: str) -> str:
114    """Extract readable content from SmolLM2 response, handling tool response tags properly.
115    
116    SmolLM2 sometimes wraps the entire response in <tool_response> tags, so we need to
117    extract the content from inside these tags rather than removing them entirely.
118    
119    Args:
120        text: Raw response text from SmolLM2
121        
122    Returns:
123        Clean content text without tool call/response XML tags
124    """
125    if not text or not isinstance(text, str):
126        return text
127    
128    # Remove tool call blocks (for input)
129    cleaned_text = re.sub(r"<tool_call>.*?</tool_call>", "", text, flags=re.DOTALL)
130    
131    # Handle tool response blocks - extract content from inside the tags
132    tool_response_pattern = r"<tool_response>(.*?)</tool_response>"
133    tool_response_matches = re.findall(tool_response_pattern, cleaned_text, flags=re.DOTALL)
134    
135    if tool_response_matches:
136        # If we found tool_response tags, check if they contain actual response content
137        for match in tool_response_matches:
138            match_content = match.strip()
139            # If the content looks like JSON (tool output), remove it
140            if match_content.startswith('{') and match_content.endswith('}'):
141                try:
142                    json.loads(match_content)  # Validate it's JSON
143                    # It's JSON tool output, remove the entire block
144                    cleaned_text = re.sub(r"<tool_response>.*?</tool_response>", "", cleaned_text, flags=re.DOTALL)
145                except json.JSONDecodeError:
146                    # Not valid JSON, might be actual response content, extract it
147                    cleaned_text = re.sub(tool_response_pattern, r"\1", cleaned_text, flags=re.DOTALL)
148            else:
149                # Not JSON, likely actual response content, extract it
150                cleaned_text = re.sub(tool_response_pattern, r"\1", cleaned_text, flags=re.DOTALL)
151    
152    # Clean up extra whitespace and newlines
153    cleaned_text = re.sub(r'\n\s*\n', '\n', cleaned_text.strip())
154    
155    return cleaned_text

Extract readable content from SmolLM2 response, handling tool response tags properly.

SmolLM2 sometimes wraps the entire response in tags, so we need to extract the content from inside these tags rather than removing them entirely.

Args: text: Raw response text from SmolLM2

Returns: Clean content text without tool call/response XML tags

def format_smollm2_system_prompt(tools: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None) -> str: 
69def format_smollm2_system_prompt(tools: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None) -> str:
70    """Format a system prompt for SmolLM2 with tool definitions.
71    
72    Args:
73        tools: List of tool definitions in JSON schema format
74        
75    Returns:
76        Formatted system prompt string
77    """
78    if not tools:
79        tools = []
80    
81    tools_json = json.dumps(tools, indent=2)
82    
83    system_prompt = f"""You are an expert in composing functions. You are given a question and a set of possible functions.
84Based on the question, you will need to make one or more function/tool calls to achieve the purpose.
85If none of the functions can be used, point it out and refuse to answer.
86If the given question lacks the parameters required by the function, also point it out.
87
88You have access to the following tools:
89<tools>{tools_json}</tools>
90
91The output MUST strictly adhere to the following format, and NO other text MUST be included.
92The example format is as follows. Please make sure the parameter type is correct. If no function call is needed, please make the tool calls an empty list '[]'.
93<tool_call>[
94{{"name": "func_name1", "arguments": {{"argument1": "value1", "argument2": "value2"}}}},
95(more tool calls as required)
96]</tool_call>"""
97    
98    return system_prompt

Format a system prompt for SmolLM2 with tool definitions.

Args: tools: List of tool definitions in JSON schema format

Returns: Formatted system prompt string

def is_smollm2_model(model_name: str) -> bool: 
101def is_smollm2_model(model_name: str) -> bool:
102    """Check if the given model name is a SmolLM2 model.
103    
104    Args:
105        model_name: Name of the model to check
106        
107    Returns:
108        True if it's a SmolLM2 model, False otherwise
109    """
110    return "smollm2" in model_name.lower()

Check if the given model name is a SmolLM2 model.

Args: model_name: Name of the model to check

Returns: True if it's a SmolLM2 model, False otherwise

def parse_smollm2_response(text: str) -> Union[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]]: 
17def parse_smollm2_response(text: str) -> Union[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]]:
18    """Parse a response from SmolLM2 model, extracting tool calls if present.
19    
20    SmolLM2 uses <tool_call> XML tags to wrap JSON tool call data.
21    
22    Args:
23        text: Response text from the SmolLM2 model
24        
25    Returns:
26        Either the original text (if no tool calls) or a list of tool call dictionaries
27    """
28    if not text or not isinstance(text, str):
29        return text
30    
31    # Pattern to match <tool_call>...</tool_call> blocks
32    pattern = r"<tool_call>(.*?)</tool_call>"
33    matches = re.findall(pattern, text, re.DOTALL)
34    
35    if not matches:
36        # No tool calls found, return original text
37        return text
38    
39    tool_calls = []
40    for match in matches:
41        try:
42            # Clean up the JSON content
43            json_content = match.strip()
44            
45            # Parse the JSON
46            parsed_calls = json.loads(json_content)
47            
48            # Handle both single tool call and list of tool calls
49            if isinstance(parsed_calls, list):
50                tool_calls.extend(parsed_calls)
51            elif isinstance(parsed_calls, dict):
52                tool_calls.append(parsed_calls)
53            else:
54                logger.warning(f"Unexpected tool call format: {type(parsed_calls)}")
55                
56        except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
57            logger.error(f"Failed to parse tool call JSON: {e}")
58            logger.debug(f"Raw content: {json_content}")
59            continue
60    
61    if tool_calls:
62        logger.debug(f"Parsed {len(tool_calls)} tool calls from SmolLM2 response")
63        return tool_calls
64    else:
65        # Failed to parse any tool calls, return original text
66        return text

Parse a response from SmolLM2 model, extracting tool calls if present.

SmolLM2 uses XML tags to wrap JSON tool call data.

Args: text: Response text from the SmolLM2 model

Returns: Either the original text (if no tool calls) or a list of tool call dictionaries

def prepare_smollm2_messages( query: str, tools: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None, history: Optional[List[Dict[str, str]]] = None) -> List[Dict[str, str]]: 
158def prepare_smollm2_messages(
159    query: str,
160    tools: Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]] = None,
161    history: Optional[List[Dict[str, str]]] = None
162) -> List[Dict[str, str]]:
163    """Prepare messages for SmolLM2 in the expected format.
164    
165    Args:
166        query: User query
167        tools: Available tools in JSON schema format
168        history: Previous conversation history
169        
170    Returns:
171        List of message dictionaries formatted for SmolLM2
172    """
173    if tools is None:
174        tools = []
175        
176    if history:
177        messages = history.copy()
178        messages.append({"role": "user", "content": query})
179    else:
180        system_content = format_smollm2_system_prompt(tools)
181        messages = [
182            {"role": "system", "content": system_content},
183            {"role": "user", "content": query}
184        ]
185    
186    return messages

Prepare messages for SmolLM2 in the expected format.

Args: query: User query tools: Available tools in JSON schema format history: Previous conversation history

Returns: List of message dictionaries formatted for SmolLM2
